text: Bottle. Pours brown with almost no head. Salmiak aroma. Taste of licorice. Not good.

330ml bottle, best before 2017-08-26. Pour hazy dark reddish brown with a fast disappearing foam. Aroma of strong spice, clove and candied fruit. Taste is sweet and strong on the same spice, malty. High body and carbonation for the style. Dry, licorice. Long sweet clove and malty finish.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2017 Bottle bb 2018/9. Super dark black with thin head. Sugar, medicinal herbs aroma. Black liqourice, jagermeister, doughy absinthe taste. I hope something went wrong here because I usually love Het Anker beers. Hot alcohol streak in the finish. Deplorable really. What could have caused this? Oxidation? I think I?ll try again, cause I respect this brewery and something seems off, if not wow that was atrocious.

Appearance - beautiful mahogany brown color with a creamy foam top.

Aroma - raisins, honey, a hint of toasty maltiness, nice and spicy with clove and anise-seed.

Taste - echoes the aroma. I normally dislike Belgian strong ales due to their banana-y cloyingly sweet esthers, but this was a very welcome exception. The sweetness had more of a honey, even raisin characteristics without being annoyingly sweet, and the star anise notes I got from it were simply gorgeous.

Palate - not watery, not too syrup-y, and not so fizzy it drowns out the flavors. Well done.

Overall - a very, very well-made beer. My favorite holiday beer to date, indeed: my favorite spiced beer in general to date. I really, really enjoyed this and definitely got me in the christmas/wintery mood. Honestly, the only thing this beer needed more was a fireplace to enjoy it by and snow falling in the background. And I say that despite the fact that I normally, full disclosure, absolutely despise Gouden Carolus (I find it too cloyingly sweet for me). In fact, this is the beer that inspired my first homebrew. Id say that speaks for itself.
Una gran cerveza, muy aromática, destacando los toques de regaliz y frutos rojos, dejando en el paladar el gusto de café junto con las pasas y regaliz
I really liked this beer, kinda sweet and Candi buy its good. Poured nice frothy head.

Meget tydelig lakrids duft. Flot brun og behagelig første indtryk. 

Juleøl som nydes alene uden mad - men en fantastisk øl. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cumin liquorice sticky toffee notes. Dark red colour with medium to light tan head, good amount of lacing. Sweet slight bitter lifeless body. Not too bad.

11.2floz bottle with an unclear date of ??/08/2014 (smudged ink) on the back label. Paid a discounted price about $2 two months ago. Fills my tulip glass with a fizzy, murky, amber hued brown body and a quick receding head. Beet sugar is alive and well in the nose. I consider it to be the the highlight as lacks a certain pizazz otherwise. Feels lighter than it should given its alcohol content Yet alcohol is present as a sugary and subdued fennel are noted on the palate. Decent, although I remember liking this more a few years ago (5-10) when I had it once or twice.

Bottle, BB 19.09.19 (from beergium). Pours copper with beige head. The head stays. Aroma is massive spices, wormwood, anise, sweetness, malt, fruits. Flavor is sweet, malt, fruits, spices, anise. Finish slight bitterness and booze. Overall: not a huge fan of anise, ant this basically sweet-malty anise syrup... Well at least it was cheap, so it is a way to get drunk and I could force myself to drink this... but then again I would prefer some good ESL to this, so nah..
Dark Amber beer with head Small head through Out the whole beer. Medium body. The aroma is liqorice with fruity hints and a sour fruity aftertaste

Pours dark brown with a lasting beige head, particles noticeable in the end. The smell is very intense and has dried fruits, perhaps citrus, and licorice. The aroma contains lots of licorice, spices, herbs, yeast, caramel, but also hints of cough syrup. Initial taste is heavy sweet, then medium sweet and light spicy bitter. Oily, a bit sticky texture, medium carbonation, full body. Alcohol is relatively well hidden. Reminds me of NIce Chouffe but with a heavier smack from the licorice and spices hammer.
Pours a muddy bourbon brown with a short cream-tan head. Mild fruity nose. Banana bread as well. Viscous mouthfeel. Brown sugar, sorghum, and banana. A bubble gum note at the finish.

Bottle. Dark ruby red. Very sweet spicy fruity Christmas ale. Malty (caramel, toffee, candy brown sugar). Fruity (dark fruits, raisins, prunes, cherries?). Like a rum/port flavoured fruitcake. Very spicy and yeasty (lots of floaties). Spicy & fruity finish. A truly wonderful beer! (2008)

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017  Rami Rami is drinking a Gouden Carolus Christmas/Noël by Brouwerij Het Anker at Konstruktorska Business CenterMega przyprawowe (anyzek i galka muszkatulowa zwlaszcza) w aromacie. W smaku cukierki anyzowo-lukrecjowe, te takie ciemne gumowate. Reszta nutek bardziej w tle.Rami Rami: Ta reszta nutek to ziolowosc, karmel, melasa. Calosc slodka. Anyzek przegiety ale o dziwo sympatyczny. Calosc raczej kategoria UFO :)Rami Rami: Fajne cialo, syropowe Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

330ml bottle [Out of Santa Bartlebiers bag, thank you very much!]. Clear chestnut colour with ruby glimmer and average, thick, creamy, mostly lasting, moderately lacing, beige head. Herbal, spicy aroma, notes of liquorice and clove, a fruity touch of plum. Taste is sweet, herbal and spicy, notes of liquorice, clove, cinnamon, a touch of ginger and nutmeg; oily texture, smooth and soft, slightly sticky palate.
Aroma is spicey with figs, prunes and yeast. Slight alco-sting. Taste is sweet dark fruits, marzipan, cloves, nutmeg. Low bitterness.

Espuma marrón claro que permanece, color marrón oscuro casi negro que no deja pasar mucho la luz donde apenas se aprecian burbujas brotar, aroma floral en nariz, sabor especiado y dulce con recuerdo a regaliz.

Dark brown, creamy lasting small head. Dark spices like juniper berries, cloves and Jamaican piment, with herbal hoppy notes and toasted brown bread. Lots of alcohol but also satisfying, with bubbly but not heavy carbonation. Not so sweet as expected actually. Decent brew, extremely Belgian and quality is fine. Clean but not filtered to death. Decent brew. (On tap at the brewery restaurant)
Strong aromas of licorice. Pours a dark brown with tan head. Strong taste of licorice with a sweet finish. As a serial hater of licorice I did actually fairly enjoy this.

It's a shame I have a bad cold. I could smell earlier in the evening but have apparently lost my sense of smell. 12 oz. bottle from Monastery Greetings/Belgian-Style Ales. Pours a dark brown with a good tan head. Aroma…can't tell. Taste…also can't tell much. The mouth feel is very satisfying and silky but also vinous and boozy down the gullet. I would definitely like to try this when I have all of my faculties. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JAN 9, 2017 Drinking blind from a 33cl bottle . In the aroma mainly liquorice.The clear brown beer has a medium brown head. In the taste chocolate, liquorice and alcohol. Medium carbonated.

Ottima birra, lalcool cè e si sente tutto (10,5%).. Al palato spicca subito la liquirizia che sembra poi evolvere in qualcosaltro.. Laspettativa è un po delusa. Tutto sommato una delle migliori birre di Natale assaggiate.

From 330ml bottle. Pours black with eventually little head. Aroma is of fruit and taste is quite sweet. Reminds me of dandelion and burdock. Flavours do mask the alcohol strength, which is high. Some soft carbonation

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
black color with a red tone. smell of liquorice and maybe saison yeast. nice light white/brown head. taste of liquorice, malt, maybe some chocolate. better than expected.

75cl bottle at home (26 XII 2016), shared with friends. A yellow-ish, golden white collar tops a black mass with a firm dark brown gloom. This for sure is a good looking Christmas ale. The nose already has heavily sweet, cloying scents with different hints at Liegeois syrup, anise and a firm Iberian red wine, even gluhwein hint. All this is backed with a malt character. The mouthfeel keeps on being sugar-intensive, even - sweetish rather than sweet - artificial in this respect. The taste is full of that typical Belgian dark pear syrup, anise, old-fashioned cough pastilles, liquorice, Ochsenblut (ox blood). On the tongue there is a little roast, with hints of chestnut, even one or two raisins as well. All this is very subtle though. The whole however is not that complex. Thank God, the ending is well balanced: Not that sweet, not that heavily spiritful. This alcohol almost has a genever quality. This nature grants a spicy hops, almost coriander feeling to the Christmas brew. Quite a good - although with one or more artificial dashes - Belgian Christmas ale with strong Ricard anisette backbone.

Bottle. Dark opaque reddish brown with a quickly fading light brown bubbly head. Aroma is of caramel, liquorice, dark fruits, raisins, plums, treacle. Taste is of liquorice, plums, raisins, treacle, ginger. Oily mouthfeel, soft to medium carbonation.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Aroma of roasty malt, chocolate and fruits with hints of banana. Dark brown liquid with a white head. Medium-high sweetness and light-medium bitterness, nicely balanced. Average carbonation and full body. Long lasting taste. Definately recommandable. I like it a lot.

Aroma: Medium malty, molasses, tobacco, licorice.No hops. Light alcohol.
Appearance: Brilliant, dark brown body. Small, light-brown head, fine bubbles with low retention.
Flavour: Medium malty, licorice, tobacco. Balancing bitterness, but no hops. Dry finish with lingering light licorice.
Mouthfeel: Medium warming. Full bodied with medium carbonation, soft.
Overall: Very nice sipping beer. Great maltiness, but missing some complexity from more basic beer flavours.

330 ml bottle, poured.
26D. Belgian Dark Strong Ale

Thick 750, corked and caged, back dated 25/06/2014, so some gentle age. Nose is beautifully spicy, red berry leads the characteristic house esters, and theres medium caramel and alcohol. Is that licorice? Or mint? Pour dull chestnut with a little underlying ruby in the glass, sort of reminds me of an Altbier, supports a soapy-rocky beige head. Taste a little plummier, brings out the licorice/anise character much more, but thats only about medium in the big picture, a perfect compliment to the inky plum and caramel. Smooth full body but not fat, edged with some thin and wispy alcohol, subtle clove, throat warming, sticky lips. Faint pepper, faint mint, possibly some faded orange peel but mostly that enjoyable drop/anise, even woodruff - just a lovely bouquet of woodsiness, herbs, and none of it is too bold or overplayed. About as classy as a boozer can be, happily flashes its refinement, balanced but accented, a perfect holiday drink for me, again just lovely. [2016.12.27: 4.2]
Anise aroma and aftertaste. Pours deep red and eminently drinkable. On tap at Het waterhuis, Ghent.

A truly wonderful beer. Very dark in colour, very rich in taste.
Complex one

ASPETTO: marrone scuro, schiuma dorata, abbondante, fine e persistente. AROMA: decisamente speziata: arancia, frutta candita, sambuco, ribes. Poi anche caramello e fruttato. GUSTO: lo stesso che al naso, con un sentore di arancio molto evidente (forse un tantino troppo). Gusto pieno e avvolgente, e anche abbastanza fresco grazie alle spezie.

Fruit (plums, raisins), yeast, dough. Dark purple/brown with a thick foamy off white head. Long lasting with tons of lacing. Medium bodied. Sweet. Smooth. Fruity. Bready. Very nice. Clean sweet finish.

Ottimo laspetto e la schiuma. Rispettivamente mogano carico e perlage fine e perfetto.
Per quanto riguarda il gusto, capisco che possa piacere ma siamo ai margini del suo stile. Aromatica e forte, non passa inosserveta come gusto, anche troppo.
Infatti lesplosione di sapore è caratterizzata soprattutto da una forte componente di liquirizia, per i miei gusti fin troppo invadente.
Carbonatazione, come tutte le strong belghe in bottiglia, elevata, fin troppo.
Il limite di questa birra, secondo me, è quello che, vista la fortissima e sbilanciata personalità, non è abbinabile a praticamente nessun piatto.-------& looks and foam. Respectively load mahogany and fine and perfect.
As for the taste, but I understand that he may please the edge of his style. Aromatic and strong, it does not pass inosserveta as taste, too.
In fact, the explosion of flavor is mainly characterized by a strong component of licorice, for my taste too intrusive.
Carbonation, like all Belgian strong in the bottle, high, too.
The limit of this beer, in my opinion, is that, given the very strong and unbalanced personality, is not matched to virtually any dish.
Alone tasting, provided you like licorice.
Da sola degustazione, a patto che piaccia la liquirizia.

Pours a dark brown with a large frothy off white head. Aromas of raisins, pumpernickel, caramel, dpices, muscovado sugar. Taste is csramel sweetness with some raisins and quite a bit of anis seed. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

2015 bottle. Dark mahogany pour, low beige head. Aroma of dark fruit, very plummy, Belgian yeast, malts, then licorice rises to the fore. The flavour too is mostly licorice, which grows a bit tiresome over a full bottle, however there are enough other underlying flavours to pick through - plum, fig, toffee, spice. Its easy drinking for the ABV, with alcohol warmth not burn. A good winter beer.

Bottle. Brown/darkruby with short lasting foam. Aroma is sweet fruits, malts and spices. Taste is spices, plum, alcohol and medicine. I think the medicine (cough mixture) and alcohol is way to dominating in the taste. I belive this one is overrated...

Toffee, fruits like dates and plum, alcohol, spices, dark brown/reddish with a good tan head not very persistant, medium/full body, medium carbonation, taste is dominated by licorice...one of my favorite for christmas.
Deep amber with a big long lasting head. Aroma: Liqourice, anise, malt drops, spice and caramel. Sweet taste. For me this was over the top christmassy.

If this doesnt get you into the Christmas spirit, nothing will :) The beer pours amber red with long lasting froth. The aroma suggests mostly licorice and fruit cake. Tastewise, a lovely mixture of licorice, chocolate, fruit cake, toffee, caramel, herbs and spices come together to give a wonderful tasting experience. Despite its high alcohol level, its easily drinkable and leaves a long lasting aftertaste. Brilliant!

Keg at Den Engel, Leek. A deep brown colour with a medium off white head. Aroma of liquorice, fruitcake, raisin, some dark chocolate, slight aniseed, a hint of orange peel, subtle herbs and lots of spice. Taste of liquorice, aniseed, fruitcake, raisin, some dark chocolate, slight herbs, a little cola, a hint of orange peel and again, lots of spice. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A slightly warming, spicy, liquorice finish. Really liquoricey and spicy! Full of complex herbal and spicy flavours and the alcohol is well hidden. Superb.

La brasserie Het Anker na pas fait de détail pour son opus de Noël : 6 épices (exceptionnelles daprès leur descriptif), 3 houblons, un titrage alcoolique de 10,5 % Abv et un niveau de sucre relativement élevé. On sort lartillerie lourde pour être certain de ne pas tomber hors sujet. Et en effet, cest bien dune bière certifiée de Noël qui en ressort avec toutes les caractéristiques attendues. Mais en empilant les extrêmes, Het Anker sest compliqué la tâche, car il en est dautant plus difficile dobtenir le bon équilibre. Mais mention spéciale tout dabord à létiquette grâce auquel nous sommes de suite dans lesprit de Noël avec un beau graphisme. En verre, cette bonne impression se confirme : brun profond surmonté dune mousse beige dun demi centimètre dépaisseur. Le nez est dune belle complexité sur le pruneau, le chocolat, la cerise au kirsh, les céréales, le café et la girofle, le tout sans fausse note. Lentrée en matière est très plaisante avec une attaque souple et suave sur des arômes de pruneaux et cerise amarena. La seconde bouche présente une amertume chaude sur des arômes complexes dorange, de pruneaux et dépices (girofle, gingembre, anis notamment), lensemble bien soutenu par une arrière bouche suave sur lananas confit et la cerise. Lalcool, extrêmement présent permet de donner cette impression de chaleur et une belle longueur. Que reprocher à cette bière alors ?!!! Simplement que les extrêmes se marient difficilement et que cela pose clairement un problème de lisibilité. Les épices sont fortes et donnent un caractère marqué à la bière en gâchant quelque peu lamertume. Lalcool également, trop présent, déstabilise lensemble (mais à la vue de lintensité des épices, un alcool moins fort naurait pas permis de soutenir lensemble). Et enfin le sucre dune densité importante pour adoucir à la fois les épices et lalcool et conférer la texture soyeuse à la bière lalourdit toutefois et pourrait paraître quelque peu désagréable en fin de dégustation (mais un plus faible niveau de sucre aurait rendu lensemble trop sec, eu égard à lalcool et aux épices). Je mettrai également un petit bémol au final, napportant rien de neuf, voire même, de par la puissance de lalcool, perdant en arôme. En conclusion : le mieux est lennemi du bien. A vouloir trop surenchérir, Het Anker en a perdu un peu lesprit de Noël. Surcharger son sapin de mille guirlandes, boules, et autres figurines ne le rend pas plus gracieux (cela le rend toutefois très attrayant, et il faut rendre à octave, ce qui appartient à octave, nous parlons dune bière de très bonne facture tout de même).

Bue 1 an et 10 mois avant DLC. Biere noire opaque, faible mousse qui tombe assez vite. Carbo nulle. Arome de fou deau de vie a la cerise, de caramel hyper puissant et dalcool de cerise et dautres chise que je ne sais pas identifier. En bouche, hyper ronde et riche. Tres sucree, on dirait un sirop. On ne sent presque pas lalcool malgre ses 10,5%. On est encore sur la cerise, le sucre candy, le caramel.Top ! Biere tres originale qui pourrait etre ma meilleure biere si elle netait pas si riche (je nai pas pu la finir). Une biere a siroter, comme un bon rhum ou un whisky.
Mörkrubinröd. Lite skum blir kvar. Luktar lite kryddigt. Söt. Och söt. Söt och lite lakrits. Och söt.

Mycket söt, intensiv arom med stor maltkropp, karamell samt inslag av kryddor, jäst, lakrits och torkade plommon.
Djup kulör någonstans mellan brun och rubinröd. Aning kort skum.
Stor, komplex smak där frukt och malt dominerar. Sötman är onödigt tilltagen. Torkad frukt är tydligare accentuerad i smaken än i doften och så även lakritsen. Avslutningen är aning kryddig.
Fyllig kropp och välavvägd, litet kolsyra. Eftersmaken är lång och söt.
Good beer, but a step away from being a wonderful beer. Too evidence of alcohol, lack a little subtlety.

Botella, BBD:18/09/17
Color marron, sabor malta, dulce, notas a pasas, cuerpo denso, rica.
Negro con reflejos rojizos y espuma beis. Aroma de regaliz, fruto negro, menta. Cuerpo denso con sabor como en aroma con final de amargor ligero, pero equilibrado y fresco.

On tap Bierhuis. Aroma more subdued than Delirium Christmas and Gulden Draak (in my 3x flight). Maybe because it is last in line...taste is more complex, the spicing is evident but not overwhelming--nicely balanced. Each sip tastes better than the previous.... But it was correct to taste this one last. I would order this again, excellent!

Piana spora, średnio pęcherzykowa, po kilku minutach opada do nieregularnej pierzynki. Barwa rubinowa, klarowna. Zapach słodowo estrowo ziołowy, przy czym nieco drażni szałwia/tymianek i anyżek, które budzą skojarzenia z lekarstwem... W smaku słodkie, jest karmel, miód, kandyzowane i suszone owoce, ale najbardziej znów dają się we znaki zioła, które dominują całość, tworząc z piwa syropowe monstrum o likierowej konsystencji... Wysycenie średnie, goryczka niska, pikantna, szczypiąca, miętowa w posmaku.

Anyż i szałwia - coś dla miłośników takiej kombinacji, dla sympatyków Amolu i syropu na kaszel...

Flaska från Beergium, något år gammal. Mörkbrun, nästan svart med beiget skum. Söt och kryddig doft med anis, fänkål och lite lakrits i förgrunden. Söt och fyllig, även i smaken mest stjärnanis och fänkål. En del brunt socker, lite kaffetoner i bakgrunden. Mustigt och juligt. Gott om man gillar en ganska kryddad öl. Bas-ölen bär dock upp det väl.

Nez: Réglisse, anis
Bouche: Chocolat, réglisse, anis, épicée, herbacée, liquoreuse
Une bière de noël très bien faite.
Aroma is pine and herbs. Flavor is licorice,a touch of mint, and spice. I like this one.

Lukt: anis, fänkål, mörkt muscovadosocker, syrligt
Smak: söt, bränt socker, lite syrlig i eftersmaken, 
Växte efter ett tag!!

Deep dark brown body, medium beige head. Aroma of liquorice, green anis, dried raisin, caramel, spicies, alcohol fusel. Flavours of caramel, liquorice, green anis, dried raisin, alcohol fusel, spices. Long warm, liquorice and green anis finish. Smooth and creamy body, soft carbo. Good but the anis and liquorice are a bit cloying.

Bottle bb 25/07/2019
Dark brown with red tones, toffeebrown foam.

Nose is dried fruit, anis, oak...
Mouth is sweet, dominantly, not much bitterness at all, the finish is dominated of burnt sugar.

750ml bottle. Deep dark, almost black, clear ruby colour. Thick beige head with nice and long lacing. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, red fruits, spices, yeast, licorice and some light chocolate hints. Taste is sweet, very loaded. Malt is present on the mouth, and the alcohol isnt subtle at all. It turns to a subtle bitter on the end. Astringent aftertaste, like a scotch shot. Full body, high carbonation, slick texture. It was more like a doppelbock to me, and a very good one, but maltier. Excellent for cold weather; a must-try for the holidays.

En bouteille. Couleur cuivrée style Coca light (mais le reste nest pas "light"). Belle mousse quasi blanche et relativement persistante. Joli nez de réglisse, framboise, cuberdon, raisin, anis ... Bouche : fort sucrée, sur le fruit (cerise, framboise), ronde, épices et herbes, légère amertume. Bonne mais trop sucrée pour moi.

Bottle at Martythesmarty and Hirigalzkars xmas beer tasting.
Brown, offwhite large head.
Aroma of salmiak, piggelin and mint.
Taste sweet, thoothpaste. Nice texture.

Bottle. Pours dark maroon, with a small, creamy, mocha head. Aroma is dark roasted malts, with bread, kandi, caramel, tobacco and wooden barrels, as well as liquorice, and some light spices and herbal notes. Full body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is sweet, fruity, dark malts, with liquorice, tobacco, raisins, and herbal notes of camphor, as well as bread and wooden notes.

Vackert rubinröd med stor gräddvit skumkrona som lägger sig som en hinna på ytan och fäster på glasets kanter. Doften är stor och vinös med en massa söta torkade frukter, rejält med anis plus lite andra kryddor samt lite pomerans. Smaken är mycket komplex, läckert söt av torkad frukt (dadlar, fikon, aprikoser), vinös (inte så konstigt med 10,5%), anis och sötlakrits, pomerans och en julig liten kryddighet. Stor, rund och fyllig munkänsla med lite eldighet av alkoholen. Oj, oj, denna är bara sååå smaskig att smutta på.

Bottle. Clear deep reddish brown, beige five finger head, disipates slowly leaving lots of lacings. Aroma is licorice, anise, dried dark fruit, dark bread, jelly, spruce. Taste is very sweet with licorice notes, bread, honey, fruity notes near the finish, warmth and alcohol as well as oxidated notes in the end. Big body, low carbo. A very big beer on flavours.

Wow! Truly amazing beer. Aroma is of delicatey spiced gluhwein and appearance to match, deep burgundy. Pours from bottle with beautiful tall off-white foam head. Taste mildly sweet with no bitterness or saltiness. Palate soft and supple. Fantastic beer. I almost thought I was drinking a rich red wine at first. Highly recommend, not just for Christmas. Top notch drop.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2016 Cellared 2013 bottle served in a Belgian snifter at about 45F. 
Dark brown body thats opaque in the glass. Fragile, bubbly white head but good lacing. 
Aroma: Slightly bready and very fruity with loads of raisins.
Flavor: lightly sweet, moderately complex; fruity with notes of dates and golden raisins. Lightly spicy. 
Full bodied with medium carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2017 Belle brune avec un regard aguicheur, dont la couleur rappelle un certain soda américain, le tout avec une mousse épaisse à la versée qui disparait rapidement pour laisser un collet ocre sur quelques millimètres. Nez exquis : pêche blanche bien mûre, mangue, pruneau, cerise noire, orange, zest de citron, pomme cuite avec de la cannelle, mandarine, vanille... Derrière, on devine des composantes épicées végétales, que lon retrouve notamment dans... la Chartreuse ! Une vraie liqueur, avec un alcool bien équilibré et des sucres gourmands (sirop dérable, cassonade, caramel, pâte sablée...). Une véritable bière de Noël !!! Bouche hyper ronde, un peu huileuse qui tapisse généreusement tous les sens. Carbonatation faible, alcool puissant mais dans la bonne tonalité et qui exhausse parfaitement les arômes. Le côté liquoreux est très présent et rappelle vraiment le vin chaud dans ses saveurs. Toujours limpression de boire une petite Chartreuse jaune au passage (avec de grosses notes danis, de badiane...) ! Le fruit est bien là, la pêche est toujours présente, ainsi que le raisin sec, la mirabelle, la prune, la cerise confite, le chocolat... Les houblons sont discrets mais sont distillés tout au long de la dégustation. Het Anker nous gratifie une fois de plus dune grande bière, dans la lignée de la Cuvee Van De Keizer par exemple... Presque parfaite si elle navait pas ce côté trop sucrée et si les houblons étaient un poil plus virulents. Bouteille 33cl, V&B Grenoble.

A belgian, very dark brown, very strong X-mas ale with barley malt and wheat, and with very high, creamy head. Aroma is liqourice toffee, caramel, light malt, light prune? Taste is sweet and light bitter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle, 2013 edition if memory serves right. Dark mahogany body with a low compact beige head. Liquorice, caramel, tons of anise, some herbs, floral notes and a touch of cinnamon. Quite nice, but the anise thing is a bit over the top for me.
Mahogny brown color, huge beige head. Sweet caramel aromas, sugar figs and toffee. Taste of... Jägermeister? I dont like Jäger. Off-putting.

33cl-fles bij Mario. Merci! U: Donkerbruin met een grote beige schuimkraag. G: Veel anijs, drop en wat karamel. S: Zeer zoet, opnieuw veel anijs, gedroogd fruit, wat alcohol en geroosterde mout. M: Plakkerig met zachte carbonatie.

Das Gouden Carolus Christmas ist ein belgisches Weihnachtsbier, welches mit 6 Gewürzen gebraut wurde. Das Bier ist fast schwarz, rötlich schimmernd mit hellem Schaum. Der Geruch offenbart deutliche Süßholznoten, dazu etwas Minze, Anis, dunkle Malze und ein Hauch Zimt. Ganz schön was los in der Nase! Der Antrunk ist eine Wucht! Und zwar nicht nur wegen der 10,5%, sondern auch weil diese die Vielfalt an Aromen wie einen Hustensaft wirken lassen. Nicht unangenehm, aber überraschend. Insgesamt ein außergewöhnliches Bier - für meinen Geschmack sehr gut, aber sicherlich polarisierend. Die verwendeten Zutaten konnte ich leider nicht in Erfahrung bringen, diese hätte ich gerne gewusst. Empfehlung!

Poured from the tap at the Taco Mac in Cumberland, GA. The appearance is a dark reddish-brown color with a small off-white head. The aroma is fruit and cinnamon with some black licorice. Has a very nice flavor of licorice and the alcohol blends in well.

Bottle from Cork & Fork in Gainesville VA
Aroma: licorice, caramel, dark fruits
Appearance: clear mahogany with a beige head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: full body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Delicious

750 mL bottle shared by ebone1988 for the damn book. 2014 vintage. The pour is a light black with hints of garnet and ruby shining through. There is a large cream colored head that falls down to a thin film leaving some good lacing. The aroma is really interesting. There is a bright fruitiness and a big spice. This is definitely like a potpourri thing. The spiciness, the fruitiness and a light molasses. The flavor is extraordinarily floral. This is like drinking nectar and chewing on flower petals. Christ. This tastes like I just stole the little flower girls basket and threw down because I was high. The floral is just too much. There is a decent spice and a light fruit, but youre not touching the flowers. The mouth feel is a little thicker and nicely carbonated with a lingeringly sweet molasses and floral finish. Not awful.

Bottle shared with koleminer20, for the book. 2014 vintage. Aroma is fruity, spice, malt, potpurri, floral, molasses, sweet and nice. Appearance is brown red, light light tan head, hazy. Taste is fruity, floral, very floral, some spice, some figs and other dark fruit, but mostly it tastes like a basket of potpourri. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, floral dark fruit aftertaste. Overall, this would be better if it wasnt so flowery.
Svart garge med lys beige skum. Lukter karamellmalt og litt krydderier. Den er lagret siden november 2013. Fyldig og smaker litt krydder og også litt alkohol. Litt bitter avslutning.

Punertavan tummanruskea olut vaaleahkolla, kivasti pitsiä jättävällä mutta aika nopeasti katoavalla vaahdolla. Tuoksu jouluisen luumuinen, toffeisen karamellinen, lakritsinen sekä aniksinen, vaniljainen ja jopa aavistuksen hunajainen. Maku vahvan lakritsinen ja aniksinen, vaniljainen, mausteinen ja hieman kaardemummainen. Aika hiilihappoinen, mutta samalla täyteläinen ja hieman alkoholisen lämmittävä. Pehmeää juotavaa ja mainio kokonaisuus. Joulun kynttilänvalon kajastamiin herkutteluhetkiin.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2016 2008 vintage shared by kermis. Dark caramel with a thin tan head. Notes of caramel, fudge, licorice, sherry. Smooth texture, medium body, low carbonation and a sticky sweet aftertaste.

Vintage 2008 bottle shared by kermis at cellar cleanout tasting at deansos. Sweet caramel malts, fudge, raisans, licorice, toffee. Big sweet, mild bitter. Full body, smooth creamy texture, soft carbonation. Great stuff. Age this!

750ml bottle: Pours a deep garnet red with a small tan head. Aroma of Christmas cake, spice and fruit. Tastes of cloves and fruit cake. Low bitterness with a full body. Low carbonation. Overall too much like Christmas cake, which Im not a fan of, however, should tick all the boxes for other peeps.

Bottle, 330 ml, from MBR, shared with Miro. Pours deep brown with tan head. Malty, spicy, caramel, licorice, bunch of spices, mint, candyish. Sweet. Reminds me of Bronhi - well known Croatian candy. Quite complex, medium to full bodied. Very good brew even though Im not a big fan of spices mix which was used.

Közepes, tartós hab, sötétbarna szín. Illata intenzív, nehéz, édes, fűszeres, amiből az ánizs egyértelmű. Íze édes, medvecukros, enyhén kesernyés és nagyon fűszeres, a csillagánizs dominanciájával. Intenzív, testes, nehéz sör, nénány korty is elég, hogy telítsen.

Bottle. Deep brown with a light tan head that mysteriously fades to ivory over the course of the bottle. Aroma of dried fruits, dough, spices - ginger, anise, nutmeg, licorice. Faintly rummy. Neither all that sweet nor all that heavy. More dried fruit than dough or bread and more licorice and spices than that. A bit too spiced for me, but theres a depth to the blend and the clean (says its bottle conditioned but Im not so sure) and _relatively_ dry malt flavours make it somehow elegant. BB 9/17 and might well have improved. Just wins you over with quality.

Odeur de pain dépices et à la dégustation pas de surprise du réglisse, de lanis des épices...je parle même pas de la couleur magnifique..Cest bière cest de la bombe...je lattends Noël avec impatience

ASPECTO: de color marrón profundo casi negro, se observa cierta actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma color marfil de buena retención, de burbujas compactas y algunas abiertas.

AROMA: Notas de anís de instante, notas de caramelo, azúcares quemadas, frutos oscuros maduros como higos.

SABOR: Caramelo, azúcares quemadas, melaza, que predominan llegando a ser empalagoso, notas de anís, de frutos oscuros como higo, dátiles. Retrogusto un ligero amargor, que queda opacado por lo dulce que es. Se siente el alcohol como sensación de calidez en garganta. 

SENSACIÓN: Cuerpo medio casi completo, baja carbonatación.

RESUMEN: Una cerveza de temporada interesante, aunque puede llegar a abrumar tanto dulzor.

Poured from bottle.
Aroma of licorice,spice and cream. 
Appearance is dark brown with lacing. 
Tasting anisette, nutmeg, vanilla, mint, plum, oak, malt, touch of smoke. Not tasting the hops with all the other flavors going on.
Palate resembles cream soda, which happens to work nicely in this case. 
Overall, a fine holiday sippin brew.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Bottle - Vintage 2012 - Sweet raisin and rum with nice sweet spice. Dark cloudy amber with a small beige head. Sweet raisin and nice dark malts. Really nice, especially for the age.

Pours dark copper brown with small light brown fizzy head. Aroma is molasses, anis, coriander, liqorice, nuts, toasted, raisins, alcohol, cola, cinnamon. High sweetness, medium bitter, longish sweet spicy, bit ashy aftertaste. Body is full, palate is oily, carbonation is average. Nice sweet yet balanced festival brew.

Look: dark brown-red with strong white head.

Aroma: fruits, fresh wild mushrooms, 
Taste: moderate sweetness balanced with fruity sourness.
Flavour: dark fruits, jam, some truffle-cheese-umami notes, liquorice, some warming spices.

Very good.

Strong Dark Ale deep dark ruby red almost garnet. Cloudy, compact and abundant carbonation. little bubble. Mousse of soft cream tone but poor retention as their 10.5º noticeable and do not help to hold the foam in spite of having a good level of carbon, which quickly disappears leaving a thin layer.
Very aromatic and complex. Malty character, sweet, fruity and spicy. notes of chocolate, licorice, anise, currants, berries, prunes and nuances of spices like cinnamon, nutmeg or yeast own appear ..

Nice chestnut red colour, clear with good beige top. Tobacco, licorice, malt, candy brown sugar caramel, anise, etc. Very nice taste, superb aroma. Distinguished Christmas beer. Sugar is high, but for Christmas it must be.

Yeasty, tobaccco, licorice, fruity, raisins, alcohol, brown/reddish colour, small beige head. 
Heavy sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, yeasty and warming, ABV evident. 
Fullbodied, lively carbonation, salty and warming sweetish finish.

Bottle 33cl. Opaque dark brown with red hue, small frothy tan head, settles quickly, light lacing; at first strong spicy aroma, licorice, anise, cinnamon, allspice, candy sugar; taste is heavy sweet, roasted malts, licorice, toffee, sugary, amaretto, with long duration, aftertaste is sweet, licorice, light roasted, burned caramel, alcohol; full-bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation; special and opulent brew, very spiced and certainly over the top.

Look; fawny beige top on dark brown-ruby body. 
Aroma; sugar, wheat, dough, liquorice, leaves, grass. 
Taste; fruits, anise-liquorice, brown malts, sugar, leaves -
sweet malty finish, liquoriced prunes. 
Feels well bodied, soft. 
Overall very sweet cough mixture. 
[33cl btl 10.5%abv BB.21.9.2018]

F: good, off-white, average retention.
C: very dark red to dark brown, clear.
A: malt, anise-spicy, caramel, yeast.
T: malt, very anise, orange, cloves, caramel, dried fruits, red fruits, brown sugar, liquorice, hint of plums, full body, good carbonated, very good beer worth to try.
2010 750ml bottle pours a dark brown with an off white head. nice Belgian yeast taste with a winter spice finish

Draught @ Zwarte Doos (Eindhoven). Dark brown clear beer with solid head. Very spicy nose, kardemom, cinnamon, caramel and malts. Taste a bit sweet but not overly so. Spices and malts nicely balanced. Aftertaste caramel and malts and pepper. Very long lasting.

Great Christmas beer! Good taste, and superlative licorice aftertaste.
Splendid foam and colour

DATE TASTED: January 10, 2016... GLASSWARE: Affligem chalice... OCCASION: a low-key, high-family Sunday... APPEARANCE: dark burgundy/brown body that releases light only when held to it...head is cloudy with a marshy topography... small bubbles and some lily pads, but more head than expected from a beer fronting a 10+ ABV... AROMA: heavy on the anise, with spruce also making this a formidable brew to encounter... fig, fruitcake, plum and some pungent scents too... PALATE: begins with a vibrant, virile rush at the teeth, before approximating cola mid-body... the finish is lingering with warmth and weight... TASTE: anise-heavy licorice, plum, dates and fig ramp up the sugar rush, while earthy hops allude to a brown ale base...some toasted elements add to a wintry feel... OVERALL: a veritable dessert in itself, this beer ponies up the fruit bowl and purees that into a sweet, sugary winter warmer...I made the mistake (?) of gifting two friends with this before trying it myself, but no mistake after all--the cork and cager delivers with strength and flavor... I would rate this higher, but its core flavors (see above) are not ones I seek out when eating or drinking--no insult to this brew...

Dark brown colour, with a red shne, and a nice creamy beige head, lasting.
The aroma is great, lots of ripe fruits, ripe banana, raisins, figs, candi sugar, and by warming up also toffee comes to the nose.
The taste is clearly sweet, again comes the raisins, figs, dried plums, but then the sweetness is well balanced by a licorice/toffee note.
Low carbonation, oily texture, and incredibly easy to drink, I dont feel at all the 10,5% alcohol!
Great, maybe the best Christmas beer I tried till now.

Liquorice and stone fruit on nose, rich sweet molasses maltiness. Dark brown, almost opaque with red highlights. Thin off-white head doesn't linger. Solid kick of molasses and well-rounded malty sweetness almost hides the alcoholic warmth. Finish is sweet but clean.

Le nez est un vrai pain dépice ! On sent parfaitement la réglisse, lanis, le caramel.
La bouche est moins riche : TRÈS sucrée et sirupeuse. Joli corps mais reste trop simple. Un dessert très sympa mais pas plus.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, dark fruit, liquorice and spices.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque ruby/dark brown beer with a slight/medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Heavy sweet and slightly bitter with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, dark fruit and liquorices; ends slightly dry with spices.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Had this beer during the winter, now having it during the summer. No matter when you have it, it is great. It is an amazing tasteful beer which is really complex, yet still fairly easy to drink.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a thin creamy beige head. Aromas of chocolate, toffee, raisin and whiskey. Flavors are vanilla, cream, cola, chocolate, dark fruits, toffee, whiskey and spice. Light and creamy mouthfeel. Noticeable booziness. Very nice.

Keg @ The Crown Inn, Wellington, Shropshire. First glass was pure line-cleaner. Unfortunately, despite getting a replacement I couldnt get the line-cleaner out my mouth. Poured very dark brown with a cream head. Aroma is aniseed, spice and line-cleaner. Taste continues with good dark fruits and spice. And line-cleaner. Ugh.
UPDATED: NOV 27, 2016 On tap. Dark brown with off-white head. Caramel aroma, strong sweet caramel flavour, ripe fruits, plum,

duft lakrids stjerne anis malt sød
smag: sød lakrids maltet anis sød maltet lidt karamel lidt ristet malt
Kastanje (mahonie) bruin bier met rijke wit-beige schuimkraag. Fruitige geur, zeste van sinaasappel. Smaak: zeer zoet, sinaas, zoethout, anijs. Zoete afdronk. Verrassende smaak en leuk voor ééntje.

26-12-2015, Delft, flink gegist

1 woord: bijzonder! Mooie donkere kleur met redelijk veel schuim. Je moet ervan houden maar heeft een enorme drop/anijs smaak. Persoonlijk vind ik dit weinig meer met bier te maken hebben maar bij speciale gelegenheid zoals kerst is het wel lekker en weer eens wat anders.

Robe brune foncée aux reflets caramel, col de mousse blanc et onctueux. Arômes danis, sucre brun, pâte à biscuit, baies confites, malt et figue. En bouche, goût prononcé danis et confitures de mûres et bleuets. Ensuite viennent de la cassonade, malt et sirop de maïs. Le haut taux dalcool est bien caché. Texture épaisse et soyeuse, corps bien rond, faible carbonatation.

Bottle from Johns with Christmas lunch. Dark brown, small beige head. Carmel and candy sweetness, some dark fruit flavors, semi-sweet finish. A little too colaish when first opened, but that mellowed out as it breathed/warmed.

Draught @ DØE (stored for 1 year). Appearance: pours clear reddish brown with good off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: brown sugar, orange, alcohol, spices, anise, dried fruits + raisins. palette: strong spicy and yeasty aroma, average to sparkling carbonation, full body, notable sugar sweetness, somewhat balanced by a medium bitterness, long duration and an oily texture. Overall: very good and complex Christmas beer - the 1 year storage rounds it off very well.

Pours a hazy dark red, light brown colour. Caramel sweet smell with some hints of alcohol. A sweeter taste and fuller strong body. Especially interesting are the hints of cinnamon and other christmas type flavours that are present. An interesting beer enjoyed around the holidays

December 25, 2015. Bottle, best before september 4, 2017. 
Clear dark reddish brown with a small creamy tan head. Aroma is anise, toffee, figs, fruity esters, spicy yeast and hints of alcohol. Taste is sweet malty and fruity, soft bitter. Finish is sweet with dark bread, figs, dates, licorice, dark sugars,light bitterness and some spices and warming alcohol. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. 
Good malty and quite licorice forward strong ale.

Pours deep golden brown with a thick creamy head. Aniseed dominates the bouquet. Plenty of malt sweetness on the front palate but aniseed is in abundance and overpowers. It lingers through to the finish.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Aroma: anise, dark fruits, 
Taste: malt, dark fruits, anise, 
Very complex and long lasting flavor, highly recommended

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of anise, flavour has liqourice, caramel, bread. Dry nice finish. Some candisugar in the finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at PaterMarcus. Pours dark almost black, with a thin beige quickly disappearing head. Aroma of licorice and anise, a bit maltiness. Taste starts sweet, followed by an intense anise-licorice feeling. Medium carbonation, 10.5% alcohol is well hidden. To be honest, i hate licorice, so this wont be any of my favourite beers but i can recommend it to someone who is not a big fan of beer but is looking for a sweet christmassy feeling. Its an interesting chritmas beverage.

Robe brune dense, mousse crémeuse. Nez puissant sur des notes chocolatées, mentholées, épicées et fruitées. Bouche à lattaque ample, épicée, onctueuse, milieu de bouche concentré et longue finale réglissée. Une bière puissante et onctueuse, typiquement ce que lon attend dune bière de noël.

Bottle. An almost flowery and spring-like aroma next to strong malts and sweetness. Some lime, some... Cough syrup? Thick and heavy taste, sweet, lively carbonized. Some liquorice, some anis. Beautiful!

Brown amber color with tan head. Aroma is ethereal schwarzbrot, anis, spicy (the bottle smells like Labello). Taste is anis, spiciness, liquorice, sweetness, but not a sugary one, more anis-like. Lively carbonation. Very good!

330 ml bottle at MS Rosella. Hazy brown with off white head. Fruity, dried fruit, caramel, candu sugar and candy. Semi sweet with low bitterness and medium carbonation. Very good with chocolate muffin.
Bottle at home, 21st December 15. Pours dark brown, the aroma is amassed, not liquorice, but more anis, taste is aniseed forward, some other spice, dark fruit, raisins. OK

Bottle 0,33l. Pours dark brown with a small offwhite head. Aromas of sweet licorice, spices, malts, caramel. Taste has fudge, lot of anis, sweet licorice, orange, malt, caramel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ Bishops Arms Hornsgatan. Very dark, slightly tanned rich lacing head. Licorice aroma with malt, caramel, molasses, dark dried fruit and toffee. Creamy smooth mouthfeel, medium carbonated. Big sweet licorice taste with toffee, roasted malt, molasses and milk chocolate.

Review from notes. Dark brown color with light brown head. Aroma pops with star anise / liquorice and dark sugar. Taste follows with the same liquorice note, dark fruits and syrupy sweetness. Really interesting dark sugar / liquorice profile. This is probably my favorite belgian Christmas beer from the ones I had so far.

Donkerrood helder bier met crèmekleurige schuimkraag die goed aan het glas blijft plakken. Overduidelijk aroma en smaak van anijs. Maar wel heel zacht en vol van smaak. Beetje kruidnagel, drop, zoethout. Nooit het gevoel dat je een bier van 10,5 % zit te drinken. Een lekkere sluipmoordenaar.

Bottled August 6th 2015.

It pours a clear chestnut with a small off white head of foam. 

The smell I noticed as soon as I removed the cork. Anise in abundance. Its hard to get past that. Some sweet candi sugar notes. .

Anise, candi sugar, quite sweet this is. Okay, now that palate familiarity has set in, I can taste some dark pitted fruit goodness. Plum and raisin. Despite the temporary reprieve from the anise, I reckon that this Noel is too 1 dimensional for the style. 

High end of medium bodied, lively carbonated, more than a little boozy, this doesnt bring out any Christmas cheer for me. Super glad that I got a chance to try it.
Karabijn rode kleur met een volle kraag. Ruikt drop, zoethout, kruiden Smaakt zoetig, drop laurier. Beetje kruidig, bitterkoekjes.

On tap @ Akkurat, Sotckholm - SE. Color: deep dark black beer with brown reflection, no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: high spicy anise nose. Caramel and rich sweet malt. Brown sugar finish. Taste: full body with ni caramel malt and anise with licorice finish. Very nice sweet spicy beer. Good attenuation. Belgian yeast. Not so much alcohol taste. Aftertaste: sweet malt and brown sugar and caramel.

Vloeibaar drop. Ik heb nooit bier op dat zo erg naar drop smaakt. En dan zou je denken dat dit dus geen lekker bier is, maar integendeel: verrassend goed. In woorden is dat eigenlijk niet uit te leggen, want hoe leg je nu uit dat vloeibaar drop goed te drinken is? Overigens moet ik er wel bij opmerken dat één glas van dit spul op een avond meer dan genoeg is.
Bottle thanks to Lukas. Pours dark brown with a small offwhite head. Aromas of sweet licorice, spices, malts, caramel. Taste has fudge, anis, sweet licorice, orange, malt, caramel.
From cervezasespeciales. In Teku glass. Watching Maze Runner 2. Lots of licorice in aroma and taste. Not of my liking
Echt wel een zwaar bier, zeer traag te drinken en van te genieten, ideaal voor op de Kerstmarkt.
Brown, clear, with light brown, nice foam. Aniz, gingerbread, vanila in the aroma. Aniz, liqruish, vanilla, chockolate. Sweet candy aftertaste.
UPDATED: FEB 17, 2017 God og lækker juleøl. Dejlig med sødme i smagen. Tilpas med krydderier. Pænt udseende.

Pours medium reddish-brown with a quick off-white head. Nose is potent and full of sugars and spices; frankly, it smells like the inside of a Belgian candy shop at Christmas (imagine that). Flavor is roughly the same and bursting with sugary sweetness and seasonal spicing (coriander and nutmeg lead the charge). Finish is quick and a little sticky. Alcohol is well hidden. This is basically a wintertime sweet dessert beer.

Rossa molto scura con riflessi color caramello, quasi nera anche se limpida, schiuma beige non molto persistente.
Aroma di cannella, più precisamente biscotti natalizi alla cannella o speculoos, toffee, liquirizia, frutta secca, forse datteri, alcool.
Al palato molto dolce, prevalgono il fruttato ed il toffee misto a liquirizia, nota di speculoos, coda amaricante erbacea che stempera un po' la componente dolce che per certi versi risulta stucchevole.
Il tepore etilico accompagna tutta la bevuta, dall'inizio alla fine.
Corpo pieno, carbonazione media.
Donkerbruin, troebel bier. Minieme beige kraag. Aroma van drop, anijs, zoethout. Erg zoet, iets te zoet naar mijn smaak. Prettig zacht, volle body en rijk palet.
Bottle from Real Ale Store, Newark. Dark Ruby black colour with no head. Ark a sweet fruity taste overly sweet.
Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours clear dark copper with off-white head. Aroma of anise, alcohol, caramel. Tastes quite sweet.
It is a great drink. I drank this one in a bar in Lausanne "Bruxelles café". It is a strong ale with a dark colour and powerful aroma. The taste is ginger bread and from the tap was perfect.
Probably the best Christmas beer I have had. Nice licorice aroma and taste. Reminds one of Christmas.
(6) Slightly above average. This means that I would definitely drink this beer again.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2016 Beautiful dark red. Very rich, with dark sugar, caramel, malt, spice and a good deal of anise. Full, sweet taste with a dry, alcoholic and lightly bitter finish. Medium body. Overall, a wonderful seasonal belgian strong ale. This sample is one year old, and hits the sweet spot with regard to the anise. Balanced, but still assertive. In fresh samples it becomes a bit overbearing. This is probably my favourite Christmas beer.

750ml bottle @Pikkulintu (thanks mjs & FatPhil). BB 08.10.2011. Deep clear copper color. Small size, beige head, stays. Sweet, caramel, wax, anise in aroma. Sweet, caramel, herbal, bit of licorice and some spices in taste. Spicy caramel in aftertaste. Aged very well. Brilliant brew.

Bottled 11/08/2011. Pours hazy brown with a large khaki head. Head retention is good. AROMA: spices, malt, fizzy, soda, molasses, brown sugar, peppercorns, dried stone fruit, licorice, herbal hops, hazelnut, alcohol, basement aromas, herbs, raisin, floral, light yeast esters and cinnamon. TASTE: spices, malt, fizzy, soda, herbal hops spice, molasses, brown sugar, licorice, dried stone fruit, peppercorns, hazelnut, alcohol, herbs, raisin, floral, light yeast esters and cinnamon. AFTER TASTE: herbs, spices, molasses and malt with a fizzy spices finish.
Pours brown with a off white head. Aroma of licorice, dried fruit, spice and malts. Taste is spices with heavy anise and malts.
UPDATED: AUG 16, 2016 Weinig aroma maar een overweldige smaak: zeer kruidig, drop, zoethout, caramel, zowel zoet als zuur met subtiele bitterheid.. Eindigend met een warm gevoel! Heerlijk!

12/10/2010 8:30:34 AM Bottle from Beer Planet. Dark brown body with puffy, pinkish head. Nose of malts and fruits. Taste quite sweet, wheaty and alcy. The whole thing is too much for me, too much alcohol and too much sugar. Overrated in my humble opinion.
Deep toffee colored pour. Big slight tan head. Plenty of lacing. Sugar and spice in the nose. Boozy mouth with notes of the sugar, plums and spice. Not bad.

Bottle from Dranken Pauwels. Very dark brown, thin beige head which dissipates quickly. Nose is very Christmassy. Reminds me of Sasparilla. Clove, liquorice, maybe coriander, very fruity, then the classic Gouden carolus: red wine vinous, dark chocolate, dark fruit, prune, raisin, fig, pine cone. Taste is liquorice, clove, coriander, prune, raisin, fig, dark chocolate. Dominated by the liquorice and something spicy and pine. Nice Christmas version of the classic.

Brune, belle carbo et collet epais et persistant.
Des aromes plein le nez d anis etoile, de reglisse, de caramel
Les epices ressortent egalement de facon vive en bouche. Le corps est bien rond et le taus dalcool un peu traitre car on ne le sent quapres coup.

After deep mahogany-brown pour with almost no head, strong liquorice and caramel aroma. Taste is similar, some additional herbals from somewhere, with dry finish that includes bitterness from a roasted malt. High carbonation. Complex, unhinged, nice.

Casi negra, casi opaca. Espuma reducida, cremosa. Aroma muy potente y sabroso. Puding, dulce malta. Textura excelente, baja carbonatación. Compleja y rica en boca con sabor de tono dulce y licor, con muchos recuerdos: higos, caramelo, chocolate y un final de vainilla que queda en boca, mezclado con el calor alcohólico de rico licor, muy equilibrado. Espléndida, norma de la casa

330 ml bottle. Pre 2008 vintage. Pours a very dark clear brown with huge white head. Aromas of earthy dark fruit and licorice. Flavors of flat cola, allspice, anise, leather and dark caramel. Interesting.
Nice Christmas seasonal. The herbs are not overwhelming but add a subtle touch to an already great beer.

Ruikt en smaakt zeer zoet, haast naar drop. Mooie donkere kleur, haast zwart. Echt een kerstbiertje voor de koude dagen. Dat is wel meteen het nadeel. Het bier is vooral zoet en zwaar. Je zal hier niet scherper van worden...

2011 vintage, 11.2 oz bottle. Pours a deep plum color with ruby highlights and orange edging, capped with a tall khaki head of foam that settles slowly to a ring and film, leaving a wall of tight foamy lace. Nose involves rum raisin cake, figs, cherries, lots of dark fruit, spicy esters, a light briny, vinegary quality, a hint of cardboard oxidation, some marshmallow, peaches, brown sugar, toast. Very sweet, somewhat bitter, lightly tart. Medium to full bodied, viscous and oily yet fairly actively carbed, with a long fruity sweet and tart warming alcoholic finish. Not terribly past its prime, but its just too sweet and unbalanced in general to be really enjoyable. Definitely a lot of interesting things going on, decadent and dessert-like, but just a bit over the top.
Dark brown colour with almost no head. Aroma is malty, little liqueuric, with lot of spices. Flavour is the same, with spice-liqueuric notes. Malty-spicily-alcoholic aftertaste. Complex beer.

75cl bottle. Wow! This is fantastic seasonal strong belgian beer. Dark brown pour with a thin tan head. Sweet malty aromas with dried fruit, spices. Sweet flavors of brown sugar. I know what Im buying next Crhistmas

15.12.2014. Color of cola. Aroma is very sweet, intense anise, liquorice, spices. Taste has strong sweet liquorice, also anise is still there. This is good but sweetness and strangeish notes are too strong. Some taste of alcohol also in aftertaste.
750ml bottle of 2013 bottling. Pours a black color with a lot of frothy head. Mildly sweet caramel and some licorice spice. The spice balances nicely.

Smooth and malty. Very high alc. 
  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from systembolaget. Pours dark amber with a medium beige head. Not really a rich smell though some raisins, malts and what I guess are fusel alcohol. Taste is strong and complex. A sweet and fruity taste. Palate is relatively thin though it is quiet drinkable. Overall a decent Christmas beer

Birra stappata dopo oltre un anno dallacquisto. Marrone con leggeri riflessi rossastri, schiuma beige cremosa ma quasi assente. Intenso aroma di spezie, al palato molto dolce, caramello, liquirizia. Carbonazione media, alcol molto in evidenza. Finale pieno e caldo. Una splendida bevuta per le fredde serate, da gustare a piccoli sorsi.
ntense and complex nose; esters, port, dried fruit and banana. Reasonably dry and malty with lightly bitter finish. Quite hard on the spices but i liked it. Gonna cellar for some years

This beer was too much on the alcohol side and not enough on the flavor. It's profile was masked by how strong it was, overall not a big fan.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl teku. Pours an abundant tanned beige head, nice, creamy very dense; brown almost black colour, ruby reflexes. Smells important and wrapping: big anice aroma, spices, dried fruits, clove, vanilla, cinammon; a complex sweet spiced simphony. Tastes dried fruits, anice, sweet licorice, brown sugar, maple syrup; medium to high sweetness, moderate to medium "licorice-ish" bitterness. Medium to full body, soft/moderate carbonation, creamy texture. Quite drinkable for being 10.5, similar in some notes to the keizer blue, extremly complex. One of the absolute best xmas ales

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours clear dark brown with tan head. 
Aroma spice, anise, licorice, caramel, brown sugar. 
Taste anise sweets, spicy bitter. 
Mouthfeel creamy, some carbo. 
Great beer.
*Old rating, best before 19.11.06.  Intense dark fruity caramelly beer. Smooth and round for the 10.5%. Dark dried fruits, malty intense body, great!

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2016 Bottle into tulip. Good thick foam on dark beer. Strong anise aroma and dominating flavor. Sweet caramel and dried fruit. Pairs well with Christmas pudding. Re rated 2012 vintage opened in early 2016. Ruby almost black. Still lots of head. Aroma of molasses and dried fruit. Anise still there. Metallic aftertaste which is not so pleasant. Eaten again w Xmas pud Ã°Å¸Ëâ¬. Rating applies to cellared beer.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2015 Bottle, 33cL. Home. A sparkling dark brown beer ; medium off-white head with a good retention ; good lacing. Spicy roasty aroma (licorice, star anise), toast, herbs, alcohol. Medium to heavy sweet, light to medium dry bitter ; round. Voluptuous body, medium texture, average carbonation, sweet spicy warming lasting finish. Overall, a really good spicy christmas ale ; wonderful.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown colour with a thin beige head, strong malty aroma with some burnt sugar, taste is sweet at first then comes comes bitterness with a dry finish.

25/01/2015 @home, 33cl (2013) bottle from Bierhalle Deconinck.
Full dark brown colour with nice tanned head. Aroma : dark fruits, caramel, spices. Taste licorice, dark fruits, caramel. Nice thick mouthfeel. Way better than last year, it was too alcoholic then, way more balanced now. Buy this and put it away for at least 1 year. Curious what it will be with one more year aging.

Strong licorice aroma, caramel maltiness 
Pours a murky brown color with small wispy off white head
Licorice flavor with bread, caramel, a tad boozy, sweet. Cola like. 
Full bodied, med CO2, some alcohol warmth, lingering bready sweetness in finish
It's an enjoyable sipper. Well balanced, but not all that complex. Licorice or anise that was added overpowers a bit. Would go well with a hearty dinner

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[Tap] Chestnut brown pour with a dense beige head. Sticky caramel, brown sugar, gingerbread and licorice in the nose. Flavors of nutmeg, dark rum, cinnamon, fruitcake, more licorice, sweet molasses and allspice. Lighter cocoa and port hints. Sticky mouthfeel. Lingering sweet finish cuts the alcohol down to barely noticeable levels. Rich.
Afrutada, agradable, sabor a regaliz y anís. Muy rica. La segunda mejor que hemos probado

Osservazioni: Si presenta di color tonaca di frate, limpido; la schiuma è color ocra, molto persistente, a trama fine, cremosa. Laroma è pulito e molto complesso: al variare della temperatura nel bicchiere possiamo trovare zucchero a velo, canditi, spezie da lievito, glassa, banana matura, prugna, uvetta, ciliegia, mirtilli rossi. Un ottimo bouquet che crea grandi aspettative in bocca, dove arriva con un corpo da medio a pieno, carbonazione contenuta, consistenza oleosa. E morbida e gradevole, regalando subito note di toffee e frutta sotto spirito, datteri, prugne ed uvetta; limbocco è molto dolce ma già a metà percorso emerge una nota amaricante di liquirizia a bilanciare; allaumentare della temperatura il livello di liquirizia cresce notevolmente, diventando un po il sapore dominante. Ha un finale abbastanza secco; il palato è abbastanza pulito per assaporare un retrogusto caldo e morbido, abboccato, di frutta sotto spirito e liquirizia.
Pours a deep mahogany with a thin white head. Almost a brandyesque aroma. Taste is quite alcoholic but good.

750ml 2014 years vintage brown corked and caged bottle with a nicely designed Christmas themed label, poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is clear dark mahogany with a large frothy beige head that settled quickly, leaving a little lacing. Aroma of spices, syrup loaf and orange peels. Flavours of spices, syrup loaf, orange peels, dates and liquorice. Taste is medium-light sweet and medium bitter. Palate is full bodied, soft texture and average carbonation. Gouden Carolus Christmas is a great seasonal brew, its strong and flavorful, with traditional seasonal spices and just the right amount of sweetness.

Pours a dark brown color, topped with a decent beige colored head. Sweet and malty aroma, notes of sherry and some spices. Taste starts sweet, a little flat, some wintery spices in there, but quite malty. Not my favourite.

Pours a very dark brown with a two finger tan head. Aroma is sweet. Dark fruits, licorice, nutmeg and biscuits. flavor is also very sweet. Spice, dark cherries, dark rum, black licorice. alcohol is not overpowering but is present. full bodied with a syrupy mouth feel. Dry,sweet boozy finish. Definitely a good beer on a cold night.

A cm of creme-brulee head, medium-fine, frothy, on top of a very cloudy medium-brown liquid with chunks of sediment afloat therein. Aroma is light caramelized raisin, bread, cinnamon, nutmeg, cherry, clove, touch of pine, hint of cedar. body is medium-heavy, syrupy, moderate carbonation, coarse, medium-light burn. Flavor is spiced candy, bread and toasted corn muffin. Holly. A touch hot. An OK Noel - Im not a huge fan of the spicing. I wish it were cut in half or to a third, even. A bit cloying in terms of sweetness in the flavor. Additionally, the body is excessively heavy for a Belgian style. Perhaps the beer should have been more highly attenuated in fermentation.  I dont feel like finishing it...

Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, torkad frukt, honung, örter, kanel, anis, brunt socker, ljus sirap med toner av julkryddor. Söt, rund och len med fin beska. Välbalanserd och väl dold alkohol. Hade tjänat på att lagras.

Lakritsdoft. Lätt sirapslimpa doft. Smaken är god men tunn. Inte lika bra som deras påsköl. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle; pours dark amber with a thin beige head; sweet aroma of licorice and dark fruit with hints of caramel and spices; taste is also sweet with caramel, dark fruit and licorice with hints of yeast, malt and spice; finish is dry with a little more spice; alcohol is well hidden; pretty good beer

Color ámbar oscuro con escasa corona de espuma que mantiene una fina capa en copa; aromas a caramelo, azúcar candy, ciruelas pasas y anís, en boca entrada media con notas dulces y a especias; el alcohol está presente; cerveza de Navidad con buen cuerpo, carbónico ligero y muy dulce y alcohólica.

Deep broown colour, with red reflections to the light. Medium beige head that does not hold for too long, but leaves a good lace. Smell of earth, spices, maybe pepper, vanilla, cinnamon, clove, dried fruits, candy, anis, licorice... Medium body and carbonation, it felles great in the palate, creamy and rich. Taste of licorice, dried fruits, clove, vanilla, cinnamon, caramel. Great.
Bue en bouteille de 33cl. Au nez, caramel, alcool, rhum. Légère amertume au palais. Sucre candi en finale. Pas mal.

This is a as complete a Noël beer gets, with the lovely sweet nose, but deviating from a typical Belgian ale with a bit less in bubbles department, leaving it softer, sweeter and spicier. They really nailed what otherwise could have been a very heavy feeling beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2015 Bottle at home. Deep dark brown colour, beige foamy head. Sweet aroma and taste with herbs and spices like clove and cinnamon, ginger, dried fruits, light anis, but mainly cough syrup and liquorice. Firm body, medium carbonation, oily mouthfeel. Well executed Christmas ale (which is not my favourite style of beer apparently).

Herbaceous. Plum. Date. Tons of dates. Raisin. Something earthy... Like oregano. Almost like a subtle peppermint. Bubblegum. Grape. 

Looks... Ummm gross? Sort of like a hazy brown like... When you drink too much coffee.... And then eat a really spicy burrito.... And also have the flu. You know. 

Taste is better than the smell. More balanced. Dates. Sweet. Ginger. Boozy. Licorice! Thats what it is. 

Palate is smooth. Dry. Nice finish. 

Overall not as good as other Gouden carolus beers but still solid. Licorice is overwhelming. And I dont like licorice so this isnt the beer for me. Still a reall well executed beer.
This beer is straight black licorice aroma appearance and flavor. Really unique and interesting went great with the salmon we had with raisin caper butter

Reviewed on 26/12/14. Bottle, 330ml. A chestnut beer with a small white head that fades away quickly. Intense aroma of anis, dried fruits and caramel. Bittersweet taste with a strong alcoholic finish. Heavy chacarter that reminds me a lot of anis. Strong astringency and moderate carbonation. Not very drinkable. Good, but at the end the anis in the aroma and the taste is too much (and Im a person who loves anis). I dont think I could finish the 750ml bottle.
Very dark with a good Head. Smell has roasted malt and caramel. Carmel is very dominant in taste. Nice sweetness.
fairly good beer, only drawback was the licorice flavor that was very present. otherwise very good winter belgian ale. if i liked licorice, this beer wouldve been near perfect
Red-brown color, small beige head. Candi sugar nose, cough drop, anise, ginger, dried fruit, hint of alcohol. Sweet fruity taste, Belgian yeast, candi sugar, licorice. Full body, soft carbonation.

75 cl, flaske, 10,5 % ABV, 2013-version BB 23/10/15, købt i SuperBest på Østerbro, 30. december 2014.
Mørk kastanjefarvet ufiltreret belgisk juleøl á la Strong Belgian Ale med fin moccafarvet skumtop på 1-2 cm, som svinder til kant og overflade efter et par minutter. Roligt glas øl.
Skøn vinøs aroma af blomme, rosin, portvin, alkohol. Sød- og syrlig på én gang.
Smagen er overvejende sødlig, men øllet er samtidig komplekst med en en fin balance mellem det søde og det bitre. Syrligheden spiller også fint inde.
Opsummering: solid kraftig sødme, medium bitter og let syrlig. Intet salt/umami her.
Stor fyldig krop, men en karbonering der - til min smag - er et nøk for kraftig. Øllet skummer meget i munden og vinder meget ved "afbrusning". I det hele taget kan det anbefales at åbne øllet i rigtig god tid og stå og lade det få de 12 grader før servering. Konsistensen er cremet til klæbrig og fedtet og eftersmagen dejlig lang, bittersød og gær'et.
En sød, men mesterlig juleøl fra Het Anker.
Comes off a little sweet. Really has a nice taste of space. Is a good winter beer but probably best in small doses.

Clear, dark mahogny colored beer with a two finger high, offwhite head. 

Nose: licorice, herbs, toth-paste! (I know its crazy), peppermint, milk and ice-cream. 
Taste: Licorice, salmiak, peppermint, honey, syrup, brown sugar and sugar, sugar, sugar.... This is SWEEET!
Body: Medium body with a light, crisp, carbonation. The sweetness is overwhelming. The ABV: 10.5% is well hidden. 

WTF is this? Im not shure if I like it or hate it... Not what I expected. Almoust like a big bottle of Jägermeister. Well I have to decide... For this money you can buy great beer - This is not great, it is strange... I dont want strange... So conclusion - Buy something else!

Bottle, 33cl. Deep mahagony with a foamy to minimal tan head. Intense aromas of anis, dried fruits and alcohol. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Sharply sweet and bitter, with the anis off balance and overwhelming. Robust and complex, but more than a few sips and it becomes unbearable. Excellent on specific occasions.
Klar, mörkt brun-röd med ett kraftigt orange skum. Doft: Lakrits och salmiak hals tablett, salva, örter, turkiskpeppar koncentrat utan sprit. Smak: Samma som doft + bröst socker, must.

750ml bottle bottled 06/08/12. Pours a deep ruby with a thin, off white head that leaves a coating in the glass. Aroma has great notes of candies dark fruits, spice, candy sugar, and Belgian yeast. Taste is balanced. Candies raisin and dark fruits, candy sugar, and some spices. Medium body with a medium-high carbonation. Clean in the mouth with an effervescent carbonation and a dry finish. Overall a really nice brew for the holidays.
Not too much of a fan of this beer. The first couple of sips are alright but after a while the ginger-bread hint in the aroma started to annoy me incredibly. Didnt even finish it.
Dark ruby colour, beigr head. Aroma of anise, candy sugar, clove, red wine. Taste is Medium sweet, slightly bitter. Medium body, slick texture, soft to average carbonation.

Bottle from Dranken Verheyen in Poppel. The beer is dark ruby red and has a nice and large cream colored head, with a lot of CO2. The aroma is particularly complex in the nose, first show of wet grass and earth, later also smells of fine roasted malt and a lot of anise. A nice beer that is midway between alcohol warmth, spices, caramel malt and with that typical Mechelen acid trait, subtle. The finish is also warming and a little alcoholic, but thats what make it a perfect beer for Christmas.
11.2 ounce bottle purchased at Total Wine Pembroke Pines FL for $14.99/4-pk Very good!

Bottle at home. Pours a clear reddish brown with a beige head. Sweet aroma of spices, malts, dried fruits, alcohol, licorice. Taste is sweet, spices, dried fruits, malts. Alcohol is well hidden. Warm, sweet, malty spicy aftertaste. Nice.
Aus der Flasche, dunkelbraun mit hellbraunem schaum, malzig, Kräuter, Alkohol in der Nase, warm im Antrunk, viel Kohlensäure, leicht hopfig bitter, alkoholisch, warm im Abgang
Een typisch kerstbier maar de niet echt mijn ding, De smaak van anijs is voor mij té overheersend.

Aroma: intense caramel, cough syrup, cloves, spices, very malty. Appearance: clear, dark amber, small, creamy, beige head. Taste: heavy sweet. Palate: lively carbonation, sweet carry on, intensify, very syrupy, caramel, toffee, spices again. Overall: quite a nice Belgian Strong Ale, intense aroma, maybe a bit heavy on the cough syrup! Bottle from Beers of Europe, Kings Lynn.

@ Havregatan 141221. Bottle (750 ml) from Systembolaget. Malty and spicy, caramely with liquorice notes, really sweet, candy sugar, cumin and dried fruits, medium body with a watery texture. The finish is dry, spicy and sweet.

Beer tasting @ Havregatan 21/12-14. Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma: Licorice, fennel, anise, cumin. Taste: Dito + dried fruits, candi sugar, sweet. Body is medium, the finish is sweet with licorice.
Pours deep brown with white head. Nose is liquorice, liquorice and liquorice! Very nice. Taste is sweet and again, lots of liquorice. A little watery finish.
Flaska från SB. Brunsvart vätska med tjockt skum. Doftar massor av russin och dadlar samt en hint av fänkål. Len och fyllig munkänsla med eldighet. Så här skall en julöl smaka!

How: Draught.
Where: NK Bar, Stockholm.
Appearance: Amber colour with an off-white head.
Aroma: Dried fruit, alcohol, spices, caramel.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, alcohol, sugary, fruit, spices, some caramel.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2015 Flasche (75 cl; MHD: 08/2015) von der Brauerei in Mechelen, 2 Jahre im Keller gelagert. - Tiefes Kastanienbraun, trüb; kaum Schaum. - In der Nase zurückhaltende Aromen von Rumtopf und Spekulatius und eine fein säuerliche Lakritz-Note. - Antrunk weinig schwer, mittelsüß und schwach herb mit einer dezenten säuerlich-fruchtigen Note. Lakritz, Anis, Pflaumenmus. Angenehm mild rezent, nicht so brauseartig wie andere Gouden-Carolus-Biere; schlanker als von einem Bier dieser Stärke erwartet. Im Abgang milde, schwach holzige Herbe. - Angenehmes Weihnachtsbier, das aber nicht entfernt an Cuvee van de Keizer heranreicht. Durch die zweijährige Lagerung hat sich eine komplexe fruchtige Säure entwickelt, die untypisch aber nicht unangenehm ist; aber die Lakritznote ist für meinen Geschmack zu deutlich ausgeprägt. Bewertung: 3,3 
Neuverkostung: Flasche (75 cl), 2-3 Jahre im Keller gelagert. - Sahniger Schaum. - Eine deutliche aber geschickt eingebettete säuerlich-fruchtige Note lockert die schwere Süße (Rohrzucker) auf. Die Lakritznote ist noch vorhanden, aber dezent und nirgends störend. Etwas leichter im Körper als vergleichbare Starkbiere. - Großartiges Bier, das von längerer Lagerung spürbar profitiert.

Tap at Brasserie V. Pours raisin-brown, minimal mocha head. Licorice on the nose in a big way: just black Twizzlers, on and on. Taste is similar, but with some dark chocolate and clove notes as it warms. Nice beer, more tempered than in the bottle.
Really smooth for such a strong beer. Extremely strong licorice taste. Quite

Bottle at Mr. Goodbar in Buffalo, NY (good beer club). I just did not care for this at all. Super super heavy on anise in both the smell and taste. If you like black licorice, youll probably love this. Didnt feel as boozy as it is. Good texture to it. I can tell its a well-made beer, just not my thing.

Bottle BB 2016. Very dark ruby red, big foamy off-white head, full lacing. Aroma is black-jack sweets, apple, sasparilla, aniseed. Body is medium, foamy, low carbonation. Taste has lots more sasparilla cola, sweet and malty, no real bitterness, breathy alcohol. OK, a little too sweet and boozy to be great.

Cloudy brown color, thin white head. Aroma of malts, mint, spices, brown sugar. Taste is the same plus caramel and some fruitiness. Full body, soft carbonation. Alcohol is nicely hidden. Very good winter beer.
UPDATED: DEC 14, 2014 Brunt utseende. Lavt skum. Aroma av lakris og malt. Smaken er lakris, karamell, brunt sukker og malt. Lakris dominerer! Søt! Medium konsistens.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 Dark brown opaque body with huge creamy off white head, nice lacing. Aromas of icing, amaretto, plums and raisin, some chocolate. Very sweet, more light bodied than expected. Well integrated alcohol. Very pleasent.

Lukt: Fin duft av friske frukter, lakris, kanel og noe annet kydder.
Utseende: Fin mørk rødbrun farge
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende brunt skum.
Smak: Nydelig smak av lakris, krydder og frukter.

Kommentar: Kort sagt et nydelig desert øl som gjerne kjøpes igjen.

Pours dark brown Amber with a very thin off white head. Aroma is prunes sweet candy more prunes. Flavor is all prunes and raisins. Very sweet. Nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the Turbacci Xmas fest nearby Rome-ITALY. Pours reddish dark brown with a medium low off white foamy head. Nose: anise blast! Sambuca liquor. Mouth: round anise forward, Ballantines feel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. No head. Deep dark ruby, clear. Liqourice, spicies on aroma. Very strong, liqourice, cyrup. Oily thick palate with some carbons. Very rich and complex. Long bitter sweet after taste. Portwinesh. Very dominant liqourice.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2015 Shared bottle at annual yule beer tasting on board Fridtjofen 06.12.14. Clear nutty brown. Aroma and taste of herbs and star anise. [4/3/5/3/9]

Rerate 03.12.15 after storing bottle for a year. Foamy and persistent head and lacing. Lots of liquorice in taste.

Bottle. Brown, beige head. Liquorice clearly dominates the aroma. Rather full body, medium carbonation. Taste mainly liquorice again, some chocolate. Nice beer objectively, the liquorice domination is a bit troubling for me personally. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
In bottle; heavy aroma of black liquorice with some spice. Taste was very similar ... good beer, and quite different compared to some of the other Belgium Christmas ales ...
Overpowering smell of liquorice here. I usually love this type of Xmas beer with the extra spicy notes but the liquorice theme is too much for me.

Bottle 0.75l taste sample at Gouden Carolus stand Horeca Expo Ghent Belgium 2014.Pour it dark color with medium white head.On the nose candy.Taste and aroma of negro candy, spices, mint, sweet, yeasty.Interesting but something missing to be all around.
Lätt genomskinlig, coca-cola färgad. Inte mycket skum, vitt sådant, lågmält. Behaglig kolsyra, inte särskilt tung.Mild lakritsdoft och söt lakrits smak. Karamell. Lite dadel. Väldigt söt.
330ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours dark brown with a thin off white head. Aroma of liquorice, raisins, fruit and mint. Sweet finish. Intense. Will get another one for Christmas!

Couleur noire, reflets caramel, mousse qui disparait. Nez malt grillé, caramel, épices ( dont anis étoilé), alcool. Gout caramel grillé, épices (anis, cardamome, anis étoilé) et pain dépices, note dextrait de vanille. Corps cremeux et rond en bouche. Super
Tapp på bishop örebro. Svart med vitt skum. Doft av salt lakrits. Smak av söt lakrits.
Fat på Bishops arms örebro. Doft av lakrits anis och belgojäst. Bitter lakritssmak med julkryddor
Dark liquid, little head. Aroma of licorice and fruits. Full body, little carbonation. Taste is sweet and bitter and a bit salt, like licorice.

DAA; Bottle 33 cl/ 330 ml. Pours dark brown with a moderate frothy to creamy, lacing, tan head. Nose and taste is heavy malt, heavy licorise and herbal, total "King of Danmark". Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to avarage.

Bottle from Del Haize Supermarket in Brussels. I can't yet describe the beers like you guys and Het Anker is one of my favorite and I had high expectations with Christmas beer but no I didn't like it. I don't know what it is but one of the aroma is like the taste of coughing syrup! I'm really sorry Het Anker...
Dark brown, beige head. Spicy aroma, sweet bread, anis and salty liquorice (salmiakki). Flat carbonation. Sweet. Same kind of taste as the aroma with less salmiakki. A bit weird in my opinion.

Classic Belgian Christmas ale with light beige, creamy head, thinnish and slowly receding, over a deep wine-red to bronze coloured beer, clear. Strong and perfumey bouquet, utterly spicy, peppermint, eucalyptus, liquorice, cinnamon, coriander and allspice attack the nose, after which less obtrusive aromas appear: chocolate, banana, raisins, gingerbread, vanilla, caramel candy, candied orange, amaretto, figs, redcurrant. Taste begins with a strong candi sugar-like sweetness, candied dates and candied cherries, medium carbonation, soft and chocolatey malt backbone upon which the mixture of ethereal spices is built: retronasally the peppermint, allspice, eucalyptus and so on return in all their glory, almost like cough syrup, after which a yeasty, malty, boozy finish develops, with a slightly coffee-like touch and some herbal hops. Its the candi-sweetness and the aromatic cough syrup spices which remain the longest, though. This is over the top even for a spiced winter warmer, but it has a kind of opulence making it worthwile to seek out. I normally do not like overly spiced or overly sweet beers, but an ale this complex can count on my sympathy: this is liquid Christmas cake and liquid Belgian chocolates, so it does serve its own purpose perfectly.
