Nice and good aroma. Sits pretty good even thought it's a 10%. Dark color with little head. Goes great with cheese and cured meats. Not so great with chips and salsa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
One Of the World Best Christmas beers. Great tast and Nice colur. So if you have tried it, then Please Do, and you Will be gladly supprised

An incredible beer. Like nothing we have had before. Pours a deep brown with a tan head. Smells of sasparilla and anise. Taste is black licorice all the way, completely unique, with some herbs. Damn good. Tasted at the BevMo Holiday Beer Fest.
Una discreta strong ale belga, sopra la media. abbastanza strutturata e alcolica, ha però una buona beveribilità

0,33 l bottle from Biervana 
licorice, licorice, licorice, brown, hazy, frothy, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish,
a lot of licorice notes, appear dark red with a fast dissapering brown head. taste medium sweet, light bitter, and the palate is a bit thin, but with a fine carbonation.

Bottle at the poechenellekelder, nov. 2014. Very dark brown-red with a lacy beige head. Malt and christmas cake aroma of raisins and cinnamon and clove and candy sugar. Sweet and heavy in the mouth, as christmasy as it gets - cake-like taste. Full body, cinnamon and vanilla aftertaste. Nice and warming.
Dark brown with medium yellow creamy head. Licorice aroma. Malty caramel with licorice taste with moderate sweetness and bitter touch later.

This beer has definite hint of Christmas spices. Not a daily drink but appreciated during holiday season. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2016 2013 vintage so about 14 months old. Pours dark brown with beige head. Aromas of licorice, ripe fruit, caramel and alcohol. Very nice lacing. Aroma reflects in taste. Too much anise for me but beer is nice and mellow for 10.5 percent. 
***
Same vintage, now 3 years and 4 months old.
Mostly slight licorice aroma. Low carbonation, possibly loose cork. Very mellow and medicine like. I guess fusel alcohols creation in place. Didnt improve much.

2008 vintage bottle shared thanks to Deanso. Pours cloudy dark brown with a thin beige head. Aroma of licorice, toffee, Christmas pudding, raisins, overripe dark fruit and caramel. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation. This has aged gracefully without changing too much from the base, I would have expected the licorice to soften off but its still the strong. Very nice.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2014 330ml bottle served in a chalice glass. 
A: Pours a dark amber color forming a medium and big bubbled light yellow head. Low retention and practically no lacings formed or left in the glass. 
S: Strong notes of sweet caramel malts. Plum and grapes. Dark dry fruits. Spices. Bubblegum. Booze finish. 
T: Sweet malty upfront. Caramel and crystal malts. Plums and raisins. Quite sweet in overall. Light hops bitterness. Bubblegum again. Booze. 
M: Heavy molasses body. Medium to low carbonation. Sweet malts in the aftertaste. 
O: Good drinkability. Strong Belgian character.
[ BA Review @ 1/15/2010 ]
Donker roodbruin bier met schuim. Smaak is een zoet licht bitter en een explosie van anijs, drop en vanille, in de mond, enorm intens. Voor mij absoluut een topbier. Blijft redelijk lang hangen.

"Arich, tasty Christmas beer. Spice-heavy in the aroma. with the flavor having a little more bready earthiness. Still spicy, with some dark fruit shining through. The yeast is there, but restrained, like i like it. Good stuff."

75 cl bottle that had been sitting in my fridge for 9 months or so. Chestnut/mahogany color, tan head. Stingy nose of grappa. Aroma of raisins, roasted malts, dark fruits, licorice. Boozy, winey. Full bodied, ultra strong.
Dark reddish brown w/ thick white head. Chocolate/coffee aroma, strong alcohol taste, semi-sweet chocolate and malt.

Served on tap in a snifter

Appearance  Pours a chestnut/mahogany color with a two finger tan colored head. The head has a good level of retention slowly fading over time to leave a great level of lacing on the sides of the glass.

Smell  The aroma has a big spicy and roasty aroma. There is a strong roasted bready aroma mixed with notes of Christmas spice (cinnamon, nutmeg, anise and licorice). These stronger aromas are accompanied by notes of dark fruits, a lighter yeasty smell as well as a moderate presence of a boozy smell.

Taste  The taste starts with flavors a blend of roasted malt breadiness and some dark fruit flavors of raisin and prune. Spice flavors of nutmeg, licorice and anise then come to the tongue. At this point the tastes create a rather smooth flavor on the tongue. The breadiness and sweeter flavors of the dark fruits start to fade. A more red wine like flavor then starts coming to the tongue. It starts out light and smooth, but gets more tannin like in flavor as the taste moves to the end. At the end, the boozy taste is quite strong and with all the flavors it leaves a nice warming aftertaste that tasted somewhat like a mix of warming spiced mulled wine fruity brew to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the brew is on the medium side in its creaminess for a brew of 10.5 % with a carbonation level that was a little on the higher side. for the style it was rather nice creating a good drinkability but yet keeping one in check of its strength.

Overall- This is a rather nice Belgian Christmas brew. It has a decent boozy flavor, but yet is still very flavorful and pleasant to drink.
Een goed kerstbier zoals het hoort te zijn. Steekt er niet bovenuit tussen de kerstbieren, maar is gewoon een hele goede.

Egészen sötét, vörösesbarna színű ital különleges, negrós, medvecukros aromával, melyek egészen fantasztikus módon ízének is meghatározói. Minden korty egy újabb élményt jelent, melyek során idővel kisimul az íze, de ez az ánizsos vonulat mindvégig alapvető jellegzetessége marad, és kellőképpen egyedivé varázsolja a főzetet.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.
Bottle at home. Pours black, liquorice, aniseed, sweet sugar, dry, fruity, berries.

Gouden Carolus Noel has a thin, cream-colored or beige head, a medium-brown, appearance, fierce bubble streams, and some thin lacing left behind. The aroma is sharp- sweet, rich, spiced bread, licorice, alligator pepper, fruit, and other assorted herbs and spices, which I cant pin down. Taste is similar, with an overriding licorice aspect. There is even a menthol note upon inhalation and exhalation. Mouthfeel is medium to thick and somewhat prickly, and Gouden Carolus Noel finishes mostly dry and decently drinkable. Alcohol is not picked up, except faintly in the background. Overall, this is a super beer! RJT
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en www.biirkonnen.com. Color marron oscuro, casi negro. Sabor a malta, regaliz, alcohol.

11.2 oz bottle from Coconuts, dated 30/07/2013, and poured into a tulip at home. Brown/black appearance with an off-white head and light lacing. Aroma of mint, black licorice, spices, dark malts, molasses, herbs and light alcohol. Similar flavor, strong, spiced, dark, herbal, mildly sweet and lightly boozy. Medium body with ample carbonation. Kind of fun to sip on, not really my thing, though.
My 2nd favorite offering Gouden has for us. Brilliant xMas spice notes mixed into a full Belgian sweet brew. Dank!
Pour is dark brown with large bubbly off-white head. Aroma and flavor of anise, plums, smoke, and licorice. Flavor is on the sweeter side, high carbonation level.

Smells terrible: artificial orange-flavored sno cone syrup. Imitation orange concentrate + mediocre Belgian spice = bleh. How does this have a 3.83 avg rating?!?

Edit: as it warms, this loses all its sweetness and develops an intensely bitter black licorice flavor. Fking awful.

33cl bottle. Pours dark brown/red with a moderate, fast diminishing head. Aroma is complex; sweet, milk chocolate, malt alchool, anise. Flavor is also complex, it has sweet malt in it, anise, some alchool but way low than you would expect from a 10.5% beer, sweet malt, some chrismas spices,dry taste. I really like these Belgian Chrismas brews.
Trübes dunkel röttlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig süß, überreife Früchte, hefig, würzig, Karamell. Geschmack malzig fruchtig, reife Früchte, leicht alkoholisch, würzig.

Je n ai pas aimé, le gout de réglisse est trop intense, trop sucrée....
:)

2014/03/16 - Pours a dark brown cola colour with a thick, two finger, frothy, khaki coloured head that reduces quickly and leaves moderate lacing. Aroma is spice, toffee, black licorice, tobacco, vanilla and dark fruits. Taste follows nose: tobacco, black licorice, dark fruits and spices. Mild bitterness and lots of malty sweetness. Mouthfeel is thick and sticky with smooth carbonation and a sweet, boozy, warming finish. Not too shabby. Paired nicely with beef stew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Small but dense and creamy head. Great dark color, smoky and chocolate nose. Actually a bit too sweet in taste - milk chocolate and caramel. Some subtle spice, not much hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: Clear dark ruby brown with ruby highlights and finger thick ivory/tan head.
Aroma: Aniseed, vinous, spice, spiritous note, butterscotch, toffee note, liquorice and vanilla.
Taste: Medium bitter and sweet with low/medium sourness.
Palate: Thick coarse texture, light body, average carbonation, dry lingering aniseed, liquorice, vinous, spiritous, alcohol note and warmth with underlying butterscotch.
Comments: Very good and glass lace.

(75 cl bottle from Kervans; BBD: 11/12/15; 12110) Pours dark brown with medium, tan head that fades to be mostly surface film after a few minutes. Nice lace. Aroma has notes of banana, chalk, licorice, spices and dark fruits. Im generally not a big fan of spices in beer but to be fair it seems well integrated here. Creamy, pillowy texture, medium carbonation, full body and a salty, warming finish. Flavour is remniscient of nice, soft licorice. Quite pleasant.
Prachtige donkere kleur, met mooie volle kraag. Volle smaak , koffie , cola achtig smaakt naar meer . Gaat vlot binnen ondanks de 10,5 % . Weeral een fantastisch bier van brouwerij het anker !

Dark ruby with light brown lacing foam head. Aroma is sweet caramel with nutty tones. Taste is sweet, some small biiterness, nuts and riasty. Long lasting aftertaste, turning more bitter. (Velp 201402)
Pours a dark copper brown. Smells and tastes of dark fruits and spices. Very strong and complex flavors.

On tap at Bottleworks, pours a deep dark amber brown with a medium beige head. Aroma brings out rock candy, rubber, and bubblegum. Flavour tastes a lot better than it smells, with notes of bubblegum, candied sugar and some Belgian yeast. Quite sweet, but not cloying. Well-rounded, but not very elegant. Solid beer.

Draft at Max?s Belgian Beer Festival. Pours dark copper brown with a fizzy white head and some lacing. Tastes slightly sour, fizzy, like grape juice, raisins, caramel, tobacco, and alcohol. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like raisins, sweet syrup, buttery nut, and booze.

Tap at Maxs. Pours cola brown with creamy off-white head. Aroma is cookie and bready malts, caramel, faint spice, fig, raisins, floral notes, and faint nutmeg. Flavor is chewy bready malts, plenty of dark fruit sweetness, faint vanilla, faint spices, and faint floral notes; dry finish. Medium/full body and medium carbonation.

Pours a dark brown red color with a tan head. Aroma is wonderful dark fruit, brown sugar, and some kind of spice. Taste is sweet malty, toffee, raisins, cherry, plum and spices such as clove and light pepper. Mouthfeel is slightly thick, slick, and oily. Carbonation is on the high side like many Belgian beers. Alcohol is well hidden. A beer definitely on the sweet side but that is just my style. Great beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Got a 4 pack on sale after Christmas at Total Wine; split a bottle. Delicious dark ale. Flavor of molasses, brown sugar, raisins, roasted malts. Warming. Watch the high ABV, because this is easy to drink.
Backlog fra Cardinals crazy juleølsmaking. Jeg ticket alle de øllene, men så at de da ikke kom med på Statistikk, så nå blir det sånn ca...
Raisin & brown sugar. Heft of Belgian Dark, drinkability of Brown Ale. Should be more available than holidays, because this gives reason to good cheer.Delightful!

Wow! Taste is perfect! Aroma is light oak and faint banana. Appears reddish brown, with foam on the rim and white lace. Taste is brown sugar and toffee with raisins and cherry, sweet, but not too sweet, very very nice. Palate is a little fizzy and somewhat thin overall, the taste makes this a very good beer!

P: Dense mahogany body with bright ruby highlighted edges. Minimal silky khaki head that dissipates to a cola like roof. Beautiful lacing that climbs the glass. 

S: Licorice bomb! Notes of candied malt, oak, caramel apples, pepper and a pinch of cayenne. 

T/M: Taste follows the nose but more aggressive spices and spiced rum soaked figs. Full sticky body with spicy numbing carbonation. Finish is dry with lingering smoke, aggressive booze, apple peels and pepper. 

O: I was let down with this one. The licorice was way too powerful and the customary flavors were faint and hidden. Once it warms it become much easier to drink but is still far from great. A hot mess of a BSDA that is not one to hunt down.

750 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 8/6/2012. Pours lightly cloudy very dark reddish brown color with a 2 finger dense khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with moderate streaming carbonation. Aromas of big raisin, cherry, plum, prune, fig, licorice, molasses, toast, candi sugar, brown bread, herbal, light clove, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great complexity and balance of dark malt/candi sugar and fruity yeast ester notes; with good strength. Taste of big raisin, plum, prune, cherry, fig, licorice, molasses, candi sugar, toast, herbal, light pepper, clove, and yeast earthiness. Lingering notes of raisin, plum, prune, fig, cherry, licorice, molasses, toast, candi sugar, pepper, light clove, herbal, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible balance and complexity of dark malt/candi sugar and fruity/spicy yeast ester flavors; with a great malt/yeast balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a moderately slick, smooth, and slightly syrupy mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warming present after the finish. Overall this is an outstanding Belgian strong dark ale. All around awesome complexity and balance of dark candi sugar malt and fruity/spicy yeast ester flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the big ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

Bottle at home on 31st January 2014 - Christmas gift. Pours deep brown with pale brown head of lacing foam. Strong aromas of aniseed and Christmas fruitcake. Fruity and spicy in-mouth with fruitcake, nuts, roastiness and citric tang. Rich earthiness and nuttiness in finish. Plenty of body, noticeable carbonation and clinginess of texture. Splendid bottle.

33cl bottle from Willems. Dark brown pour, almost black with reddish tint, solide creamy tant foam. I could smell anise while pouring it. Aroma is quite herbal, lots of black licorice, rich malty caramel notes, molasses, fruity alcohol esters, very nice. Taste is rich, sweet, molasses like sweetness, toasted malt, black licorice, cardamom. Palate is full bodied, strong carbonation. A great BSA, a very cozy sipper.

1.5l bottle shared in a Trappist glass. Pours a dark brown with good viscosity and lively carbonation for such a strong beer. The taste is much the same as the Van Der Kaizer Blauw but is even more malt dominated. The only issue I have with this beer is the overpowering aniseed flavour - it really is too much. The flavours are all excellent and well proportioned but the aniseed takes over. However, it is probably the most Christmassy beer I have tried.

Gouden Carolus Christmas. Bottle 330 ml at home, into a tulip glass. ABV 10.5%
Deep brown red colour on the body, with deep red ruby shades when hold against the light. Two fingers of thick beige head with very good retention. Heavy lacing left around the glass.
Aroma of spices, anice, light alcohol, light caramel.
Taste is sweet with malts, caramel, fruity notes as well, even some bubblegum on the finish. The spices present again but quite subtle. The high alcohol is very well hidden, its presence given away only by a warming feeling on the body. Really good!
Medium to medium thick body, the carbonation on good levels.
Overall a very tasty beer and a great warmer, I got much more than I expected.
UPDATED: DEC 12, 2015 -Backlog- My favorite Christmas beer of 2011. Too much cherry and medicine in 2015....

Anise, plum, smokey aromas.
Liquorice flavor, grape, caramel malt, peppery finish.
Very smooth xmas brew despite the alcohol content, good way to keep yourself warm while enjoying lovely anise flavors.

Very dark brown, small bubbly tan head. Liquorice, spices, speculaas, caramel, salmiak. Taste is sweet, but with a slight tart finish and I swear I taste salty salmiak in there. Medium-light bodied, average carbonation, way thinner than I expected. Hmmm, bit weird stuff, but not bad.
Spicey and malty christmas beer. Yet, it is not overwhelmingly sweet, which is nice.

Colour: Deep brown, coffee coloured. Hint of a beige head.
Nose: Very strong anise aroma. Underlying tones of spices, licorice, cough syrup, roasted malts. Anise overshadows most other aromas.
Flavours: cough drop, caramel and candy sugar sweetness. Dark chocolate, coffee, pastis-like anise flavours. Dark fruits and seasonal spices. Very complex.
Finish: Long, warming, spicy, alcoholic. Quite strong.
Verdict: Very good Christmas ale. Nice.
Ruby red in colour. Aroma is fruity with dark cherries, chocolate. Flavour was peppery, yeasty, with some alcohol. Finishes with some mild bitterness and dry.

On tap at Birratrovo in Como
Anise both in aroma and taste. Very well balanced. Full body. Great beer

Rating #883 - January 5, 2014 - Live Rating - nth day of #beermas 2013 - 750mL bottle, 10.5%. Clear, dark brown pour, bubbly tan head that fades to a ring in my St. Ambroise chalice. Aroma is treacle tart, cherries, black licorice, toasted fennel. Taste is alcohol, toffee malts, licorice, fennel, cherries. Quite good.

Bottle from Y Delyn Wine Bar, Mold. Pours a dark brown with a long lasting off white head. Aroma is marzipan, treacle and dark fruits. Taste is sweet treacle and slightly spicy. Slight bitterness that comes on the back. Nice carbonation and warmness from the alcohol, a real wintery treat!
Pours a dark brown with little head. Smells of dried fruit and a little spice. Very smooth with a hint of licorice. Tasty but not my favorite. Ill age the other bottle and see how it is next year.

Draught at Lobbes. Dark slightly reddish brown with a small off-white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Medium sweet- and bitterness. Spices, chocolate, dried fuits, licorice, caramel and alcohol. A tad too spicy for my taste, but overall a nice winter brew.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Dark brown beer with small beige head. Aroma isnt as strong as I was expecting, some dark treacle and dried fruit. The taste is dark treacle, rich dark fruits, spices, sweetish malts and some alcohol. Quite chewy with some oiliness. Very nice.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bu en bouteille de 33cl, belle couleur, sans mousse, goût très prononcer de caramel/ anis /Réglisse, trescbien proportionnées.. excellentes bières de noël....

Bottle 0.75L.
Brown body with a huge, frothy, tan head, mostly lasting with nice lacing.
Complex aroma: moderate-to-heavy malty (caramel, slightly roasted) character with notes of red fruits(cherries), raisins, alcohol realated spices and light licorice; liquor sensation is also felt.
Intense sweet flavour with moderate bitter character more evident in the finish. 
Full body with velvety texture; soft carbonation.
Poured a dark brown with a small off white head. Aroma of spicy red fruit and liquorice. Full body, flavour is quite alcoholic, sweet fruit with some bitterness which lingers.

Very dark red/brown colour; light off-white head; sweet coffee/chocolate aroma; rich and warm flavour with chocolate, licorice, spices and more; warm, alcoholic aftertaste. I absolutely loved this one!
Heerlijk christmas bier, mooie kleur, zoet, een bekende smaak naar trekdrop, als je daar van houd is dit jou bier

75cl bottle (shared)
Appearance: Dark red brown color with medium beige head
Aroma:Chocolate,dried fruits, caramel, alcohol
Taste: Huge Liquorice, Spices (Anise), caramel and a bit of alcohol. Quite like Cough Syrup. Dry Finish.
Syrupy texture,High carbonation, medium body

Bottle from my 2nd Secret Euro Santa box, many thanks.  Dark red brown color with medium beige head. Aroma of dried fruits, banana, syrup, candy, alcohol. Candy, licorice, grapes, licorice, molasses, cinnamon, ginger and other Christmas attributes. Alcohol is strongly recognizable. well, I know, this is Christmas beer, but I didnt like it so much.

Botled. A hazy brown beer with a large tan head. Aroma is malty, sweet, notes of caramel, belgian yeast and dried fruits. Flavor is malty, spicy, notes of caramel and licorice but with a very dry finish. High carbonation and medium body

330 mL bottle from SoHo Organic Market (to replace an earlier review that was not under the best circumstances). Muddy light brown pour with a frothy khaki head. Aroma of Belgian candi sugar and dark fruit with occasional nutmeg and allspice. The taste is certainly on the sweet side of the flavor spectrum with heavy amounts of brown sugar, light chocolate, figs, anise, and sweet raisin. Moderate alcohol warming. This is without question a sipping beer but your patience is rewarded. Recommended.
Bottle->taster at Dominion W&B. Dark brown with moderate tan head. Dark fruit, caramel, holiday spices, licorice. Sweet, but not too sweet. Great beer.
Mørk brun farve med beige skum. Lukt av malt, lakris og anis. Smak av malt, lakris, anis og frukt. Vinmonopolet.

Bottle from Hammelhus, Hammel. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Brown sugar, caramel, dark fruits, berries, chocolate, notes of licorice, lots of spices. Great mouthfeel. Strong complex beer. Lovely.

Brune foncée, effervescence moyenne-faible, mousse tombe rapidement. On est de suite assailli par la réglisse et lanis qui ne laissent pas le temps aux malts de se laisser découvrir. Pour le reste, douceur et quelques fruits sont au rendez-vous, ABV se fait moyennement sentir. A laisser dans la cave durant un certain temps...
Interesting. A bit too sweet and boozy for me but the herbs and spices in the flavor are nice. Some star anis, cloves and licorice. Good for a cold winter night.

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Hogerdijk, Culemborg. Black with a beige head. Aroma of bay leaf, star anice and liquorice. Very sweet taste. Round, creamy, slightly boozy but above all cloyingly sweet. The oversweetness makes it hard to finish the whole bottle; not because its a bad beer but its just too much. Sipping material for sure.
Liquorice, anise. A strong full bodied Christmas beer, but the alcohol its well hidden. Special, but not for two in a row

Brune et très opaque avec des reflets acajou, cette bière festive très populaire ne mousse que très peu. Au nez, la réglisse noire et la menthe nous donnent la vive impression de boire des cannes de Noël liquéfiées.On retrouve les même esters en bouche, mais je trouve que lanis est vraiment trop présent, moi qui napprécie pas tant ce goût davance. La bière devenait tout de même un peu plus équilibrée avec la chaleur, le malt ressortant un peu plus pour atténuer la forte dose dalcool en bouche. Bien content de lavoir essayé, mais il ny aura pas de seconde expérience.

bottle @ home. schiuma beige, fine e abbastanza persistente. birra ramata, riflessi rubino limpida, con lieve velatura. aroma intenso, fruttato di amarene sotto spirito. lievito belga, zucchero caramellato, leggera tostatura. gusto dolce amabile, poco amara, lieve acidità. gusto caramellato, un po di pera, e con note di miele dacacia. calda alcolica, quasi liquorosa. poco corposa, poco carbonata. equilibrata e armonica.
Bottiglia da 75cl. Birra scura molto forte, retrogusto di liquirizia. Regalatami per Natale, molto buona

Bottle from the Bottle Shop, Bruges. Pours a deep ruby colour with a big fading cream coloured head. Quite sweet with red berries, sherry, fruit cake, chocolate and liquorish coming in at the end. Quite spicy too. Full mouthfeel. Tasty stuff.

Bottle shared with Edgar. Snifter. Pours a dark brown completely opaque with a light fluffy head. Great sporadic lacing. Aroma of anise, black jelly beans, dark fruits and Belgian yeasts. Taste is powerful with spices such as anise, dark fruits, dark candies, dark breads, cloves and alcohol. Medium to full in body, some carbonation. Finish is really anise. A winter warming beer for sure.

Dark brown, a small ring of foam. Plums, liquorice, yeast, anise. Extremely sweet, semi-full palate, alcohol comes through. A strong and complex one, resembles a barley wine in many ways, a very nicely warming winter drink.

Bottle 75 cl. Pours dark brown in color with a frothy tan head. Notes spicy 
herbs, anise and fresh licorice in aroma. Licorice, anise and spices in taste. 

Smooth and tasty, theres just something about these gouden carolus beers which 

make them so good and tasty. Licorice and anise spicyness, quite longlasting in 

aftertaste.

Keg at Six Degrees North. It pours darkest brown with a medium light tan head. The nose is massive liquorice character, toast, earth, spice, candy and cola. The taste is sweet liquorice, candy, cola cubes, caramel, Xmas spice, earth, rocky road and brown sugar with a bitter-sweet finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Hides abv very well. Very big liquorice character indeed. Decent, but gets a bit sickening after a while...

Bottle. Pours very dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is mostly liquorice, sweet. Liquorice comes through strongly in the flavour, some citrus and chocolate to balance it. Very surprising beer and very little alcohol taste.

Cerveza color caoba con escasa espuma. Olor especiado, a regaliz. Sabor en primer momento a menta, hierbabuena, y sobretodo a romero, pero a medida que vas tragando se transforma en regaliz. Es ligera y muy bien equilibrado el gas, lo que hace que sea fácil de beber. Cuidado que no se le nota la potencia alcohólica y su alta graduación.

Drunk from 75cl bottle bought at delhaize. Lovely dark, christmas ale with hint of liquorice flavour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2013 Tap at the Rake. Pours very dark brown with a small and firm tan head. Nose is full of bright spice and liquorice. Absolutely huge aniseed and moderate milk chocolate. Touch of citric zest. Taste is practically as if you had blended together liquorice candy and sambuca with a hint of spice. Unique stuff. Slight warmth but alcohol is hidden for the most part. Spritzy carbonation to help it flow. Really quite decent stuff. Enjoyed it
UPDATED: DEC 30, 2014 75 cl. champagne-flaske. 10,5 %. En. Suveræn god juleøl der passer perfekt til en juleaften. Stærk smag af lakrids. Re-rated 30/12-14. Suveræn lakridssmag

Very sweet caramel toffee smell, dark brown colour, strong taste, a bit much caramel toffee taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JAN 8, 2014 Dark brown. Almost no head. Notes of stone fruit. A pretty solid beer, but far too fruity, even for a Christmas. Good, but not great.

Dark Brown beer with beige and long head. Fruity aromas (berries), anis and licorous nuances. In mouth it has an intense flavor with sweet and roasty retronasal aromas. Initially sweet taste but bitter and long end. It is a quite warm beer due to the alcohol. Low carbonation and full bodied. Good beer but alcohol is not completely integrated. Filip
Denne øl er en fantastisk højtidsnydelse med en meget kraftig og mættet smag af blandt andet lakrids uden at være for klam og for sød.
This one poured a dark red color witha beige head. Aroma was very vineous, red wine like, and some dark fruits and brown sugar. Flavor was light spice, red wine, brown sugar. Different for sure.

Taster poured at local shop during their regular Friday tasting. This bottle had huge amounts of anise/licorice on the nose and the palate. Not liking licorice, this was not very good. The balance of the beer was off because of it and wasnt great to drink.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2014 Bottle at home. Dark brown pour, thin off-white head. Fennel and aniseed aromas, some clove and cinnamon. Very spicy, bit too spicy on the taste. Too much liquorice as well. OK, but will save one for next year to see if it mellows.
12/21/2013. 750 ml. bottle. Dark brown pour with a thin tan head. Sweet malty aromas with dried fruit, spices and Belgian yeast. Sweet flavors of brown sugar, spices and fruit. Awesome seasonal beer.
Wow i was suprised with this one! Bottle at home poured a black colour with a thick tan head. A ton of anise, drop, spices, caramel. Some special beer! Verry Nice to drink with these cold days

Poured from a 750ml bottle into a trappist glass, dark brown with red hints no head to speak of, the aroma is sweet and candied fruits, the taste is licorice, clove, raisin, carbonation is smooth, sweet on the back end too sweet in all honesty and warm going down.

Bottle at the Essen OBER Kerstbierfestival 2013. Poured a deep mahogany with a thin off white head and lots of lace. The aroma is big liqourice with some red berry fruit and spice. The flavour is medium bitter with a strong alcohol liqourice bitter aniseed palate and a short bitter finish. I liked this because I like liqourice but if you dont like liqourice you wont!

Bottle. Pours clear very dark copper brown with shaeds of ruby and plentiful, airy but stable beige head. Dark aroma of caramel malt, cinnamon and aniseed, with touches of chocolate. Sweet flavour of malt, caramel, sugar, aniseed, gingerbread spice and fruit. Warming alcohol presence. Sweet finish. A real Christmas beer. Very nice.

I tasted this little gem in the Brewtique in Macclesfield. The taste was just terrific and it lifted above the other ales on trial. It is a lovely, spicy dark brew. I think I detected a bit of cinnamon. The ale came in a 330 ml bottle. Upon pouring it into the glass, I was perhaps bit too cautious and there was not a great thick head on the ale, though I think that is as it should be. A real winter warmer. There is sweetness to the ale. Full body, thick-ish feel, flat, with long finish, I thoroughly enjoyed the ale and will definitely drink this ale again. I would also recommend my more adventurous friends to try it. The only thing to be aware of is that it is quite strong!

Dunkelbraunes BSA mit mächtig viel Schaum. Würzmalziges Aroma nach Spekulatius und Anis. Leicht spritiger Antrunk. Viel Würze, etwas Lakritze und ein langer trockener Abgang. Etwas sperrig, aber voller Aromen. Ein Bier zum nippen und genießen.

0.33l bottle. Reddish dark brown body, light brown head. Aroma of anis, caramel and a hint of coffee. My problem with this beer is that it has a huge anis character, and I dont like that spice at all. The beer is very well made. It has a nice sweetness, medium/big body and a cool creamy texture, but because of that bloody anis it doesnt work for me.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2013 Bottle from Craft Beer Base, 600 yen or so. 10.5% It pours a very dark brown with almost no head. It has a rich wine like flavor with figs, plums, spice. However, you can totally feel the alcohol, its somewhat boozy. Dec. 2013 10.5% from Ohtsuki Saketen. A dark mahoganey brown with a beige head & some lacing. A sweet boozy flavor of figs, candied plums & spices with lots of warming as it slides down your throat. Pretty good but boozy.

Medium sized head with strange vegetable flavor, fennel, sage or celery. Body is dark amber. Tastes also sage or fennel, with some herbal liquor aftertaste. Quite surprising for Christmas.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Caramel, caramel, bread, toast, roasty, coffee, bread, herbs, citrus, citrus, barnyard, roasty, herbs

Sampled @ Kerstbierfestival Essen 2013. Dark brown, deep dark red colored beer, small light brown head. Smell and taste malts, lightly sweet, liquor, slightly alcohol, caramel. Medium body and carbonation. Nice!
Pours a ruby dark red beer with a good white creamy head. Smells mint, licorice, laurier and anise. Tastes laurier, anise and licorice. Average carbo, medium body and a sticky texture.

Bottle from Alko Järvenpää, courtesy of K0mpsa. Hazy dark brown color, light brown head. Aroma is strong, full of licorice and finnish salmiac liqouer with hints of spices. Balanced sweetish body and strong but smooth finish.
Pours a dark colour, taste is of liquorice and spice, quite rich and oily on the palate

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2014 bottle from BarleyWine, Cph - pours a dark brown with subtle dark reddish colour in there as well, lovely initial puffy brown to slow diminishing head. Dark malts, brown sugar, syrup, caramel, complex dark fruits, lots of nice spices in there. Lovely. (D17)

Caramel brown in color... Aroma of evergreen, anise, black licorice... Flavor is black licorice, anise, sweet malts, spicy notes on the finish... Decent 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2013 Reddish brown beer with big blond head leaving lacing on the glass. Aroma first reminds me of latex. Later on I can get anise and licorice from the aroma, but cant get the image of latex plastic off my head. Flavor is a bit better, still very anisey and licoricy sweet with herbs and sugar sweetness. Medium full palate with much carbonation but still being soft. Pretty short finish with no hops to speak of. Has a good base for a Belgian Strong Ale and the alcohol doesnt come through at all, but its not my thing really.
Bottle 33 cl. Dark brown copper color with brown lacing head. Notes of anis, candy, sweet malts, licorice, Belgium yeast. Nice full oily body. Goes down smooth. Very nice.
Donkerbruine kleur met een stevige beige schuimkraag. Ruikt naar drop, anijs, hoestdrank. Complexe smaak, erg zoet.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2015 Gran bellaroma, per questa birra, con il Malto che si espone in prima linea grazie alla presenza dellodore del caramello, il caffé, il tostato e lievemente il pane. presente anche laroma di frutta sotto spirito, ma meno forte e presente. Distinto lodore di prugna. Visivamente la birra è bellissima, con una schiuma fine e persistente che gradualmente va a compattarsi restando sempre però sofficissima. In bocca media dolcezza, bilanciato da una leggerissima amarezza, senza che sia presente lacidità. Il sapore a me ricorda le castagne, le frutte e luva passa, il tutto molto ben speziato. Veramente una gran bella birra, fatta come si deve e ottima da bere.

Brune au reflet rouge. Nez: anis. Caramel. Malt. Fruit confit. Menthe. Bouche: onctueuse. Très sucré. Épicé. Dominance-anis. Girofle. Bien caramélisé. Riche. Vanille. Fruité. Figue. Un vrai bon dessert de Noël!

Bottle. Pours opaque brownish black with small offwhite head. Aroma is heavy mint, light licorice (licorice cough drops), anise, dough, malt, caramel and hints of metal, ripe fruit and caramelised figs. Taste is light to medium sweet, light bitter and light acidic. Body is light oily with sparkling carbonation. Finish is long with notes of brown sugar, caramel, cinnamon, mint, cardamom, coriander seeds, sweet licorice, anise, hints bitter grapefruit. Very good complexity yet well balanced.
Intense aroma of liquorice. Brown with large long lasting head. Taste of liquorice, smoke & syrup. Medium body with creamy texture & soft carbonation.
Very punchy with an aniseed spirit flavour. Very complex flavours. Would have again. Not a quick drinker
Bottle from alko järvenpää. Hazy dark brown color, light brown head. Aroma is strong licorice and salmiakki, spices, sweet notes. Balanced sweet body, licorice, salmiakki, spices.

330ml bottle @ #HPJ-13, thanks dlite. Pours a dark brown with a decent, off-white head. Aroma is a whole load of aniseed. Liquorice, dark malty bread. Taste is quite sweet. Loads of aniseed, liquorice, salty liquorice. Dark breadiness as well as dark fruits. Prunes and dates. Full, quite carbonated.
Super strong ale, duft af anis og tipas alf i smagen. Gem den et par år og julen bliver ikke bedre

Dark brown color with a dense mocca-coloured head. Toffee-like odor. Flavor anise, liquorice, liquorice pastilles
 with a spicy aftertaste. Surprisingly delicious.

Bottle. Dark brown/black colour with medium white head.
At first, huge anise and liquorice on aroma. Then comes malt, bread, dried fruit, banana, herbs and hint of mint chocolate.
On taste anise moves more background, as sugary sweetness, dark, dryed fruits and plum comes up more, as well as liquorice. Warming alcohol is there too. 
Taste does not quite match to aroma imho, too much dark fruits for me.
Fullbodied, sticky and bit oily mouthfeel with medium, soft carbonation.
In finish there is more sweetness, dark fruits and alcohol. 
Leaves behind strange anise/minty/menthol like "freshness" in your mouth.
Fireplace ale, do NOT rush with this :D

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2015 Pours a dark brown, almost black, with a tan head. Spicy aroma of licorice, anise, dark fruits, caramel toffee, yeast, herbs. Some alcoholic warming going on. Somewhat oily texture. Very good winter brew.

Shared a 75cl bottle from Delheize (Luxembourg). Pours a very dark brown colour with a thin creamy off-white head. Aroma is sweet, licorice and alcohol. Average carbonation and a full creamy body but a slick feel. Taste is strange at first, with some sweet notes with resemblances with a liqueur and anise. Not so pleasant. But it gets better at the second sip. Overall, a nice beer but a bit quite heavy. Good for a Christmas night by the fireplace.

The color of this beer is an opaque brown with a large and creamy off-white head, and the aroma has a strong anise scent mixed with booze. The taste has a slight umami, a slight sweetness, and a touch of sourness, but these flavors balance out really nicely, and the palate combines a creamy texture, medium body, a licorice finish, and a soft carbonation.

Bottle @ home, aged two years. Pours coke-brown with a beige head, nice lacing.
Sweet aroma with lots of toffee. Notes of dried herbs, clove, clementine peel and some licorice. Theres also fennel and dry wood that balances the sweetness in a very nice way. Some higher alcohols.
Mouth feel is big with good carbonation.
Sweet toffee taste a bit sugary. orange, licorice, grass followed by hints of spruce leaf.
A bit to much alcohol is shining through in the aftertaste, but as for the rest the ending is really nice with moderate dry bitterness balanced by dry sweet fruits, toffee and anise.

Så er der blå Gajol. Meget lakrids og sød, mørk øl. Fin øl. 

Mest velegnet til nydelse uden mad. For kraftig lakrids til et måltid. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Reddish brown beer with big thick head on top and lots of lacing sticking to the glass. Ripe fruits, salty licorice, berries and spices in the aroma. Taste has ripe fruits, berries, spices and tannin. In the end there is some bitterness too. Alcohol warms you up. Full body and medium carbonation. This really is for slow enjoyment, but it rewards your patience.

Bottle @ home. Dark brown, big tan head that settles nicely, good lacing. Aroma, malty, yeast, licorice, fennel, vegetables, some alcohol. Taste, malty, licorice, fennel, yeast, vegetables, dark fruits, brown sugar. The aftertaste is really good, with dark fruits, oranges and a sugary candy like taste. Really nice Christmas beer. Oily mouth feel. Soft carbonation.

0,33l bottle from Alko. Pours very dark red with a low creamy tan head. Aroma is malts, alcohol and liquorice. Flavor is sweet malts, liquorice and alcohol. Very creamy but a bit too sweet even for a dessert.
Good Belgian ale. Taste of anis and liquourice was really strong, almost overwhelming. Splitting a 33 cl bottle was friend was enough therefore.

brown colour with reddish notes; aroma of green apple, anise, caramel, slightly roasted malt and some alcohol; taste of caramellized malt, fruits, (a bit too much) anise, mint, brown sugar nad alcohol;excellent belgian strong ale

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2015 .33l bottle @ Vihreä Haltiatar Pours clear dark reddish brown with low head. Aroma is liquorice, alcohol, malts, fruits. Flavor is mostly same. ......
Rerate. 9.12.2015. 2 year old bottle (2013) is loaded with anis. Something like. 747314 3.5

Bottle. Dark brown, hazy, small to average and fully diminishing head. Moderate to full malty and sweet aroma, caramel and spiciness (aniseed and some licorice). Body is medium to full, malty and sweetish flavor, some caramel and light fruitiness together with spiciness and alcohol. Finish is average, malty and sweetish, some caramel and lots of aniseed and some licorice, light alcohol. Sweet strong ale with way too much aniseed. Quite one-dimensional.

Dark brown. Lots of dark head. Sugar, malt, alcohol, wort nose. Brown sugar, anis, malt, dried fruit aroma. Sweet and bitter. A bit over medium mouth feel. Good carbonation. Warming. Way to much anis aroma ruins an otherwise good beer.
Bottle. Dark brown color with a medium thin head. Aroma of salty licorice and syrup. Sweet taste of caramel with some bitterness.-- via beerbasher/winphone

330ml bottle. This beer has a clear, dark amber colour and a tan head. The aroma is quite complex and has notes of spices, anis/liqourice and some caramel/sweet malts. The taste is moderately sweet with a mild bitter finish. Full-bodied with a quite oily texture and soft carbonation.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2014 Tap: Deep, deep murky brown color with some ruby hints about; off-white, nearly beige cap sits on top leaving little bits of wet, dripping lace behind. Aroma is totally unique, incredibly hard to decipher. Sweet malt-y notes, chocolate, plum, raisin, raspberry, sweet toffee & caramel, nutmeg, ginger, faint anise/licorice, light mint, cinnamon bread, brown sugar? Smells like a Christmas time potpourri or festive candle. Taste is just as complex with spice & sweetness all over. Sweet red fruits, sugar coated plums, dates, cranberries, brown sugar, booze-soaked cinnamon & raisin bread, coriander, anise, plentiful earthy & dirty esters... Never sure where this thing is going, but I like it. Big bodied, lightly sticky. Really nice holiday ale from Belgium.

Nose is candy sugar, orange creams, anise, mint and cough syrup; very strange. Taste is very sweet, cola, cream, cherry, malt, leading to sticky dark fruits, handfuls of raisins and a slightly medicinal herb note in the in the finish which lifts the beer. Mouthfeel is a slick. 

An interesting if not exceptional xmas beer.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2013 Pours a translucent dark brown with a thick tan head that lingers and laces well. The nose is of dark sweet malt with a hint of dark fruit and chocolate. Medium bodied and well carbonated. This beer is full of flavor that masks the 10% alcohol well. Extremely well balanced. The taste is dark malt, with chocolate undertones, blended with spice and licorice with a very slight alcohol finish. Finishes clean with a burst of dark malt against spice and alcohol. An excellent Christmas Ale. I just did a side by side against St. Bernardus Christmas ale, on 12/4/13. Gouden is far superior in terms of body, complexity and flavor.

bière de couleur marron foncé, mousse assez fine, nez sur le café le cacao, un soupçon de fruits rouges, mais beaucoup moins que dans la Van der Kaizer. Un peu plus épicée. Alcool moins bien intégré, plus écoeurante. Moins de longueur, mais ça reste correcte.
UPDATED: NOV 23, 2013 Sweet, Bitter, Citrus, Alcohol, Sour, Earthy, Pungent, Nice Lace, medium to medium light, full flavor, Liquor

beige head that disappears fast with lacing. coffee coloured. aroma sweet, spices, rotten cherries, anise, dried fruits, boozy. taste like aroma finish bitter, liquorice, sweet. medium body and carbonation.  bottle 33 cl / bbf sep-2016
dark amber with ruby hints, cream colored head. massive orange peel nose. sweetness prevails, licourice, spice, orange peels and some citrus. medium body. sweetness becomes cloying.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2014 Bottle from Alko, Helsinki (bought 12/2013). A color of dark brown, almost black with a medium-sized, dense head that leaves only little lacing. The aroma is heavily centred around strong notes of licorice and anise with sweet malts and spices adding depth. Taste is expectedly sweet and spicy, anise and licorice being the strongest elements. Hints of ripe fruitiness, toffee and marzipan. The palate is delightfully smooth and full bodied. Hops do not have a role in this ale; malts and yeast are the dominant players here. Alcohol warms in the background but does not influence the taste much. The anise/licorice -centred theme is a bit peculiar but I did not mind that much; very original and rich tasting experience all in all.

33 cl, bottled. Shared. Pours clear dark ruby with a small beige head. Aroma: Fruity, caramel, yule spices. Taste: Sweet, roasted bitterness at background. Slight sour component. Citrus. Soapy malt. Raisins. Palate: Medium body, quite moderate carbonation. Pretty good.

Bottle from Alko. Dark brown color, beige head. Bittersweet taste with lots of toffee, dark fruits, syrup, licorice, a bit of alcohol, spices, cookie dough and earthy notes. Bittersweet finish with toffee, citrus and warming alcohol. Excellent belgian strong for the winter season.

33cl bottle. Dark brown, lacing, lasting white head. Strong medicinal aroma, anise, licorice. Flavor has anise, licorice, sweetness. Long sweet finish with anise lingering. Alcohol warmth. Quite tasty, very spicy brew.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle (33cl). Dark chestnut colour. Really nice aroma- a deep belgian double- like sweet malty, slight plum raisiny, yeasty background with a nicely balanced anis/fennel front. Full thick oily body, some sweetness, but with enough bitters in the finish to wipe the palate clean. Good malts, some candi flavours. A bit of a strange vegetal thing too, but kept on a leash. This is just an awesome sipper for a cold winter evening. Id probably get tired of the fennel after a while, but right now it feels great.
101113. Bottle at home. Pours clear dark ruby/brown with a nice head. Aroma sites, Belgian yeast. Slightly sweet tooth pa paste like taste. Much more balanced than the Easter beer. Not Bad.

Bottle:
Pours cloudy, dark brown with a thick tan head.
Spicy licorice aroma.
Licorice, dark fruit, raisin and mint flavor.
Creamy vanilla, malty.
Very nice.

Dark brown, clear with beige frothy head that leaves lacing and stays nicely. Strong aromatic aroma has salty licorice, medical herbs, anise. Medium body, lots of warming alcohol, Belgian yeast, herbs, long finish, soft carbonation. Really much herbs and flavors with nice nuances also, tasty.
Really dark brown color with nice lasting head. Aroma is dark fruits, licuorice. Flavor is sweet, yeast, dark fruits, warming alcohol.
bottle 33cl @ home. Pours hazy dark ruby red with a small head. Spices, licorice, aniseed, butter in the aroma. Spices, dark fruits, aniseed, sugar,licorice. Seems more balanced than the easter beer.
Kor of liqurish notes.- appearblack without a heavy. Medium taste a fine appere ce

Medium brown color with a good sized head sittin atop. Muted dark flavors with black licorice, plum, raisins, and some cherries. Noticable alcohol with some balanced hops.Very weard spices used, not my cup of tea.

Lovely Christmas with a very reasonable price! Nice 75cl bottle. Nice deep red - brown color + good head. Creamy texture. Complex taste of spices, caramel, dark fruits, vanilla with an long lasting aftertaste.

BOTTLE 33CL.

Head: beige, big, creamy, above avg. retention. Colour: dark ruby, clear. 

Aroma: dark fruit, burnt sugar, vanilla, mild fruity alcohol. 

Taste: rather sweet, dried fruit, burnt sugar/dark caramel, phenolic spicy alcohol.

Nice rich aroma and flavour. Body a little thinner than would like.

From a 11.2 oz bottle at least 6 years old, although Ill rate with respect to new batches.
Poured in a Duvel mid size glass.
Pours a dark brown with large amber head and lace.
Aroma of dark roasted malts, toffee, light spices.
Modest carbonation and medium mouthfeel.
Flavors of dark roasted malts, milk chocolate, toffee, molasses, caramel, prunes, raisins. Overall very flavorful and full bodies, easy drinking and tasty. This particular batch has a touch of oxidation but overall very impressive.

330 ml bottle purchased @ Julios about a year ago. Dark brown color; no head. This brew has a huge licorice and peppermint aroma. It really does remind me of the Christmas season. The flavor is oddly much like Jägermeister. Licorice and peppermint with a large amount of spice. Oily texture. Well, it does fit the winter season. You better like Licorice to enjoy this brew.

33cl bottle from cervezalandia. Dark brown to red color with medium head. Taste is high sweet and medium to bitter. Also some sourness. Carbonation is ok but its there. Aroma is caramel, malt, light fruit and alcohol. A little too unbalanced in the taste in my opinion.

Bottle at bierhuiske
Pours dark brown , small white head 
Smell is sweet , caramel malts 
Soft carbo . Very sugary sweet . Very typical , not worth seeking out at all ...

(Bottle). Sweet and very fruity nose with aromas of pear and apple. Fruity taste with a hint of tangy yeast, lemon and licorice. The alcohol of 10.5% is most noticeable as a warming element in the flavor. I really like the interesting notes of lemon and licorice in the taste, and the balanced element of alcohol. A palatable and impressive beer!

Brune opaque, ayant une mousse timide, toutefois persistante. Un nez on npeut plus garni, très prononcé par plusieurs épices: en loccurrence la muscade, lanis, le clou de girofle et le gingembre et jen passe sûrement. Un goût de punch des Fêtes. Anis étoilée, cannelle en bâton, réglisse noire. C,est du bonbon. Elle ne me semble pas aussi ronde que ce à quoi je me serais attendu, elle fait quand même un bon travail. Un beau cadeau de Noël. Merci ma blonde. (715-290613)

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2013 Unusual beer. Has faint resemblance to Christmas spices like nutmeg, but also an odd smokiness. Too weird to be great. 
Re-rate. Must have been something off with the first pour. Tried again a few days later and was much better. Ratings adjusted accordingly.
Strong Plum smell thats sweet...taste is much the same except slightly milder than expected...which is good...ever so slightly bitter mixee with lightly sweet

bruin met schuimig bruine kraag
aroma: moutig, chocolade, toffee, caramout, rozijnen, banaan, sterk anijs en overrijpe fruiten
smaken: medium/zwaar zoet, licht bitter, sterk, rozijn, banaan, vijgen, kaneel, caramel, droppig, chocolade, en met name anijs
volle body, romig, lage co2
heerlijk complex, mooie smaken, alleen anijs iets té overheersend.

33cl bottle.
Appearance: dark brown beer, light brown nice stable head.
Nose: burned malts, somewhat citrussy? wood, some caramel, molasses, lots of bananas.
Taste: some acidity, fruity, alcohol warming, cinnamon. Also lots of anise (thx mathieu87 for pointing that flavor out)

Geruch fruchtig-süß, Malz, Schokolade, Feige, Mango. Süßfruchtiger Antrunk, liquide. Mitte gewürzig, Traube, Malz, Schokolade, alkoholisch. Ausklang malzig-süß, fruchtig-prickelnd, wärmend. Tolles Bier.

Pours clear dark red with a long lasting and light lacing frothy big beige head. Aroma is complex, spicy and very estery with anise, raisin, plum, roasted malt, caramel, bubblegum, pear, strawberry, red apple, apricot, banana and candy. Taste is medium sweet with a tiny acidic note. Body is medium, texture is light creamy and oily, carbonation is moderate. Finishes sweet.
Spicy aroma of caramel and roast chestnuts. This beautiful dark beer has a sweet taste of caramel and peppermint candy cane. Smooth texture.

Dark cider/brown color; Medium slightly cream body; Aroma of sweet malt, yeast, rich anise/licorice, & fruit; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, caramel, dark fruit (notably plums & dates), and licorice; Nicely balanced and complex; Overall, nice aroma - very good.

En fût à lAutre Oeil. Couleur brune-noire, mousse beige. Arôme danis, café, malt, torréfaction. En bouche, malt torréfié, alcool, anis...anis...épices. Finale épicée avec lanis qui reste en bouche. Très grande qualité mais personnellement pas mon top...trop danis.

Hail Christmas !!! This beer is a great choice to drink before the feast of Christmas Eve. The aroma is complex, but with presence of caramel, bread, nuts, and a little coffee touch. Great influence of toast. Hops giving a presence of resin, spruce and herbs, very woody indeed. Some touches of dough and ginger. A great appereance, with a black/brown color, a hazy but sparkling liquid, and a minimal but creamy head, a little frothy too.
Awesome taste, with presence of medium sourness, light sweetness and a little bitter. The sense to palate is great, full body, creamy, medium thickness and a little oily. Soft carbonatation and a long and little bitter finish. One of the greatest beers ever brewed, and with a rich flavor like christmas, literally like christmas.

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. brown bottle set out on the counter for a bit and served in a trappist glass.  Pours dark brown with big fluffy light brown head.  medium small bubble lacing, medium body, well carbonated, and dark fruit aroma.  Taste is sweet dark candy sugar, some dark fruit, and a hint of alcohol.  Pretty good, but sweet.
Pours dark brown. Aroma has notes of raisin, dark sugar, toffee and plum. Very sweet taste with figs, plum, raisin and some spices. Good balance with a pretty sweet finish.

Bière de Noël, oui, bière aux épices, assurément, bière festive, encore oui. 
Mais on va aller un peu plus loin.
Conditionnement superbe, étiquette, collerette, bouchon, lettres dor (normal
pour la « Gouden » Carolus!!!), tout y est pour la fête.
Couleur roux profond quasi opaque. 
Bulles par milliers partout dans le verre (jai choisi un Straffe Hendrik en forme
de tulipe assez relevée), très vives.
Superbe mousse beige caramel qui tient à 1 cm et dune texture très crémeuse.
Arômes de malt, tourbe, pointe danis très prononcée, associée à de la réglisse,
avec une pointe de cannelle et de candi noir.
1ère bouche quasi veloutée, où on a perdu un peu danis mais on a gagné du 
pruneau, des fruits confits, une pointe de pomme de terre verte et du malt à 
whisky...
2ème avec de labricot confit, ananas confits, et une pointe de kirsch.
3ème avec une belle complexité mais lanis domine, avec une pointe dun houblon
aromatique, un genre de myrrhe et de la réglisse.
La longueur développe une ampleur, mais lanis touche à leau de rose !!!! (aïe, aïe, aïe..)
La levure est complètement intégrée.
Lalcool, très fort, aide à la longueur.
La finale est danis  réglisse, anis  menthe, anis  muscade, anis  cannelle !!!!
Cette bière finit donc sur un excès, et dans les bières, un grand principe est :
point trop nen faut .
Le mélange dépices, méritoire puisquil y en a 6, est trop orienté sur lanis, ce qui
nuit à lensemble. Les houblons (4) bien quaromatiques sont noyés par les épices...
Cote très difficile donc, puisque cette bière est techniquement parfaite (bulles, mousse,
texture, alcool de 10,5 % qui participe à la longueur, etc.), mais beaucoup trop orientée
sur lanis quoique de saveurs complexes .
Si on aime lanis, ok, sinon plongez sur la carolus van de keizer bleue  (un vrai chef
doeuvre complet celle-là .) Cest le même brasseur, donc il ne men voudra pas !!!

Sugary, thick spiced cake-like aroma, candied fruit, and some smoke. Ruby color. Initial is quite sweet; mid allows some tang to develop; final is tingling and satisfying. Primary notes are of a very ripe and rounded fruitiness.
Love it. Deep red brown with beige head. Aroma of raisin, plum and malt. Taste is medium sweet caramel and raisin with a creamy feel.

Bottle BB. 2015-10. Pours clear dark red with a long lasting and light lacing frothy big beige head. Aroma is complex, spicy and very estery with anise, raisin, plum, roasted malt, caramel, bubblegum, pear, strawberry, red apple, apricot, banana and candy. Taste is medium sweet with a tiny acidic note. Body is medium, texture is light creamy and oily, carbonation is moderate. Finishes sweet.

Pours dark brown with a nice fluffy light brown head. Aroma: Dark sugars, spices, caramel, some toffee, dark fruits, raisins, dark booze soaked fruits. Smells nice! Taste: big sweetness with notes of dark fruits, figs, raisins, caramel, dark sugars, christmas spices. Nice mouthfeel with small tickling bubbles. A very nice brew! 2011 bottle.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2015 Color marrone scuro con schiuma beige chiaro mediamente spessa. Aroma ricco e maltoso, sentori di toffee, vaniglia e banana; gusto mediamente dolce con note di zucchero caramellato e un lieve tocce di anice. Corpo medio-abbondante, struttura setosa, un ottima birra natalizia!

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2013 Pours a clear dark amber brew with a big beige head with regular to good retention, aroma is moderate to heavy sweet and low bitter with notes of caramel, anise, apple and fruit, médium to robust bodied, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate to low bitter with notes of caramel, anise, apple, fruit, alcohol, good balance, bittersweet finish.

Au nez, réglisse et épices (muscade, cannelle). Beau collier de mousse beige tenace. En bouche, cest le bonbon aux épices, le sucre dorge et la menthe qui ressortent. Un délice absolu, bien sucré et parfaitement balancé et somme toute accessible. Une des bières qui réussit le mieux à décrire la période des Fêtes selon moi.

Mousse royale sur une bière sombre avec des reflets cuivrés. Nez de girofle et danis (principalement). En bouche, le piquant des épices (muscade, cannelle...) sétale en laissant le côté aromatique se dévoiler en finale. La présence de lalcool est un peu trop vive, mais on pardonne. Une bière grandiose et festive pour les occasions qui le méritent.

75cl bottle.
Anise, licorice, sweets and some banana in the aroma.
Didnt like the appearance. Dark brown, with a quickly faded head.
The licorice, anise and sweetness return in the flavor with some spices.
In my opinion there was too much anise in the flavor.
Aroma is surprisingly faint compared to the very strong taste. I also did not like the appearance; it looked like muddy water. Not my favorite, but not sacrilege like Corona.  Bah. Humbug.

Pours a very dark ruby tinted brown with a very large head and lots of lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is sweet with lots of banana and some odd cooking spice. The bouquet contains plenty of grapeyness, some raisins and lots of alcohol. 

The flavor is sweet, not horribly so though. There is a fair amount of grape kool aid, and some dark fruit notes. Mild roasty maltiness is fairly subdued... most of the "robust" character seems to be coming from booziness in general. 

The beer is lively on the tongue while being pleasantly viscous. 

I love a whole lot of what this line of beers offers, but this one just doesnt do it for me the way a lot of them do.

Date code 06/08/12, 12071 @ 57° into Stölzle 13.75oz Berlin

Pours mahogany-tea into a deep brown body with amber highlights. Light khaki, tightly structured, two finger head dissipates to a half sheet with thick ring and peninsulas of lace.

Nose is very complex; plumbs, raisins, figs, vanilla, red and black liquorice, dried red and light fruits, spice, fruit cake, cola, light caramelly chocolate notes.

Tatse follows in a slick, but nicely carbonated mouth, which becomes creamy as it rolls around, approaching the heavy side of medium, spiced drying finish to cut all the sweet characteristics. Cola, vanilla, and spice dominate the aftertaste with light fruit nuances finishing out.

An exceptional dark strong - right up their with Rochefort 8 and De Dolle Oerbier from my perspective.

11.2oz bottle. My bottle is labeled 10%, with the stamp "L0870". Dark ruby red / purplish color. Good thin khaki head, leaves some decent lace. Nice nose of dark fruit, berry, red grapes... Kind of like a sherry. Chocolate in the flavor. Black cherry. Light on the spice. Bigger body, smooth lighter carbonation. More dry finish, no viscosity. Sweet taste, some bitter taste, and light bite. Alcohol pretty well hidden with the flavor. Noticeable, but not like youd expect from 10%. Soild, tasty Belgian Noel ale.
330 ml bottle. Pours hazy dark brown with small head. Aroma of dark fruits, liquorice, banana peels and dark sugars. Taste of alcohol, dark fruits, heavy liquorice and fruits. Very nice beer
33cl bottle. The rest I dont know because my girlfriend took the only bottle I had of this brew from my cave and drunk it .... She said it was good.

Dark brown body, khaki head. Arom has some pepsoden toothpaste and Dr. Pepper. Flavour has some chocolate, but overall this beer is really strangely spiced and alcohol is the only clear thing that I can pick up.

Pours brown with a big, fluffy, off-white head. Sweet malt aroma with dried fruits fig and apple. This beer is thick beer with heavy on malt, semi-sweet with alcohol coming through. Fairly complex, good for sipping on a cold night.
Cervezaca impresionante, un aroma afrutado con toques de plátano, y un sabor dulce que no empalaga, sino que deleita. Quiero otra ahora mismo!!!

Erg mooie fles, hele mooie donkere kleur met mooi donker schuim. Aroma is erg overweldigend zoethout/drop. Ik vind dit teveel overheersen en niet lekker. Goed mondgevoel en daarom een middelmatig cijfer.

Pours a large frothy light brown head that slowly diminishes. Lacing is fair. Body is flat and sparkling. Color is ruby to black. Aroma contains roasted malts, molasses, flowers, spices, dough, raisin, plum, forest fruits, cherry, tawny port, toffee, honey, alcohol and licorice (zoete drop, zoethout). Flavor is sweet, with light acidity and a warming alcohol and slight bitter finish. Body is medium to full, with syrupy (a bit sticky) texture and soft carbonation.  Another great Christmas beer! Why couldnt it be Christmas every day?

Pours cloudy brown with a small tan head that leaves decent lacing. Aroma is candy canes, caramel, spices, clove, yeast, fig. Flavor is about the same, medium sweet with a warming body and finish. Quite spiced, but it works well in this beer. Full bodied and rich in the mouth.

Great dark beer. Top fermented. Great taste og liquorice and salmiak.
The AROMA is somewhat dissapointing, so the first impression is rathet bad. Just sont wait to taste it. Its superior.
Especiada, caramel, galeta.Molt agradable, lleugerta.

Reddish brown colour, beige head. Aroma of iron, malts, red fruits, liquorice and salmiak (salty liquorice). A lot of liquorice/salmiak in the flavour, laurierdrop, light bay leave, honey, some sweetness. Finish liquorice with some sweetness and a light sour touch.
(Draught @ Provoosthuis, Bergen op Zoom, The Netherlands)

AROMA: licorice, vanilla, 
APPEARANCE: brown, minimal head, 
TASTE: light sweetness, lightly bitter, 
PALATE: full body, slick feel, lively, long finish, 
OVERALL: licorice dominates but in a pleasant way, good body and balance of tastes, ABV rarely noticeable, one of the best Noels.
Draft at the Pine Box, Seattle. Deep black brown, peppery black licorice. Winter candies, rum, berries. Deep caramel, salted chocolate, syrupy. Great holiday character. Very good.

On tap. Hazy brown with a medium head. Aroma of licorice. Sweet malt licorice with a hint of banana. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy brown with good head and lacing aroma of black licorice and dark fruits.  Black cherry with notes of licorice and spice from alcohol.  Sweet with no bitterness.  Full mouthfeel and perhaps a bit thin but finishes fairly clean.  Not bad but not my taste.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours nice dark brown with some crimson edges.  Tan head.  Aroma is heavy on the black licorice with cherry and other dark fruits with some banana on the tail end.  More cherry on the taste with a little licorice and spiciness. Mouthfeel is warm and thin.  Okay.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Kaatuu lasiin tummanruskeana/mustana ja keskikokoisella isokuplaisella vaahdolla. Haju on vahvan aniksinen. Kuivattua hedelmää, rusinaa, mallasta, suklaata, lakritsia ja joulumausteita löytyy myös joukosta. Maku on aniksinen, suklainen, luumuinen, hennon rusinainen, lakritsinen, maltainen, hieman belgihiivainen ja joulumaustetta on myös mukana. Suutuntuma on täyteläinen ja hiilihapot jäävät kielen reunalle kutittelemaan. Kokonaisuutena tämä on minulle the Olut, ensimmäinen, joka räjäytti tajunnan. Aniksisuus uppoaa meikäläiseen hyvin.

750 mL bottle.  Pours almost black with a thick off-white head and good lacing.  Aroma is dark fruit, candied sugar, and yeast.  Taste is dark licorice, candied sugar, and some dark fruit with a dry and slightly boozy finish.  Very good Belgian.
Dark in color, foamy top. Very malty and caramel/minty flavor to it. Great Christmas beer all around.

Dark colour. Mint in aroma but even more pronounced in its taste. Not everyone's thing but it charmed me.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle poured medium brown color with no head to speak of. aroma is of fruit, dark fruit and some mild spice. the flavor is of the same but oh so good. medium body with that mild spice and lots of dark fruit and what i think currants/white grapes...just had that feel to it...but none the less very good..
In my search of the best Christmas Ale, this was a surprise. Nice foam on top, wich remains long enough. Lot of things to explore there: malty, sugar, liquor Amazing taste!!
Smells like sweet St Fuillien with spruce.  Dark brown, maroon.  Tastes like liquorish.  I wouldnt for a Christmas gift, but this is tasty beer.  Soft thick texture.
On tap at The Forge in Fort Collins on 12/22. Pours a deep brown color with white head.  Malty, raisin, candi sugar, licorice flavors.  Interesting strong belgian ale.

Bread, caramel, fruit, tobacco, and alcohol in the aroma.  Flavor is sweet, bready, and strong.  Alcohol, spice, and a little fruity bitterness in the finish.  Definitely over the top, but in a good way.
Bottle 75 cl. Shared. Short lived light grey foam. Red brown colour. Vinous bouquet with hints of nuts and coffee. Taste of liquorice, coffee and dates. Supreme Belgian X-mas ale.

Roughly a year since purchase. BB 07/09/14
Nurtured over time.
Dark fruit date nose. Rich creamy glossy magnolia head on top of almosty opaque deep brown body. Very smooth & slightly medicinal this is a luxuriously  vinous beauty in the mouth. A light momentaly fizz in the end too.
Dark amber/deep red body with a creamy, persistent beige head. Aroma of riep fruits, yeast. Taste is spicy (anise overall). Slightly bitter finish, with hints of licorice.
Buenísima esta cerveza de navidad, de las mejores que he probado. Color negro y con muchas especias, de las que pude distinguir el anís.

Dark brown body with a quite large, creamy, light-brown head that laces the glass excellently and never reduces further than a thin layer. The aroma is very pleasant quite strong with sweet fruity notes of the dark and dried sort, like raisins, but also some surprising hints of banana in the back. Also yeast, caramel, dark candi sugar and spices. The taste is moderate to heavy sweet but also moderate bitter, so it never feels cloyingly sweet. The finish is long and filled with very strong spicy flavours, mainly anise seed . Also liquorice, dried fruits, dark candi sugar and yeast. The alcohol is well integrated as a slightly vinous feel. Full body, oily texture but also a bit dry (at least considering the massive sweet taste) while the carbonation is rather lively. A very nice brew! 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 3 years before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Online]

Bottle 0,75L. Deep amber mahogany colour with tiny light brown head. Aroma of dark fruits, anis, caramel, nuts, cherry liquor. Flavor is moderate sweet and gets a note of bitterness in the aftertaste, but sweetness still dominates.

Very nice winter Belgian ale. Thoughtfully murky brown color that seemingly changes as you ponder it. A superb malty base with perhaps a fruity backbone. Overlaying all of this is a robust dosing of spices, which somehow compliment one another as well as the base, with anise most identifiable. My only complaint would be the over abundance of carbonation, though that encourages you to let your glass linger awhile longer before taking another sip of what is a quite high ABV ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

25/12/2012 - In bottiglia. Come la ricordavo(già bevuta in precedenza) birra ricca di sentori di frutta scura sciroppata e spezie, che si esaltano quando la birra si scalda un pò(consiglio di non berla troppo fredda per apprezzarla a pieno).
Perfetta per me da abbinare con dolci "frolli".
Impegnativa quanto basta la metto sulla "falsa riga" di una Rochefort 10.

Bottle shared with Veitafan. Is pretty clear and has a deep brown colour with a medium beige head. Lots of anis in the aroma with wood, leather and a good dose of spices. Theres also much of the anis in the flavour as well but feels more belgian with dried fruit in addition, and is pretty sweet. The mouthfeel is rich and smooth, and has a light bitterness. The beer is pretty dominated by spices, and feels a bit unbalanced when fresh. Im looking forward to taste one after a couple of years in the beer cellar.

75 cl. bottle, shared. Deep, deep amber colour with a big, fluffy tan head. Sweet aroma with lots of liqourice, caramel malts, brown cookies, dark berries, bananas, cloves, nuts, candid sugar and dark, dried fruits. Taste is sweet.  Full bodied with a super creamy texture and soft carbonation. Finishes fruity, spicy and with huge licorice notes. Impressive Christmas beer, that overpowered the otherwise hearthy Christmas dishes. Really good and tasty.

Lovely aroma of black cherries, raisins, dates etc with a flavorful bouquet of fruity malts with yeast funk to balance out the sweetness along with the flavor hops. This brewery continues to impress me and is underrated.
Deep rich and dark. Excellent for a cold Winters night sitting by the fire. Sprinkled with spices this beer is great for holiday cheer. A pure delight to drink.
poor dark amber. nice white, thick head. A sweet and amazing liquorice flavour.

Nice dark brown color, a little tan head that lingers around the rim. Anise smell along with, dark fruits cherry, mint, some funk in the background. Black cherry in the taste with a little of the anise but not overly. Spicy at the end, not much sweet as I hoped. Decent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From the caged, corked 750 ml. bottle. 2012 batch stamped 08/09/11-11066. The pour is a deep dark brown with a silky, but short-lasting beige head.  The aroma is vibrant with dark malts, Belgian sugars and yeast, cherries, cranberry, pomegranate, and licorice.  The body is bold.  The taste is sweet and pungent with a dark fruit juiciness and a moderate lingering finish. Home for the holidays.  Everything about this beer is strong and memorable.

Bottle. Pours cloudy brown with a small tan head that leaves decent lacing. Aroma is candy canes, caramel, spices, clove, yeast, fig. Flavor is about the same, medium sweet with a warming body and finish. Quite spiced, but it works well in this beer. Full bodied and rich in the mouth.

2012.12.24 - 750ml bottle (09/08/11) in goblet.  Pours a hazy medium dark tan, looking and smelling quite like Gouden Carolus Classic which bodes well. Not much head, settles to a creamy ring and island.  Aroma is candied fruit, similar to Classic.   Taste is definitely in the ballpark of Classic, but probably less sweet overall.  

A bit more of a boozy warmer bite, though mild, balancing the sweetness.  Less obvious plum/date/raisin tones than Classic, more a general sweetness. 

If pressed I would say that Classic appeals more as an everyday proposition but Noel holds its own and performs well as a holiday winter warmer while still being similar to Classic.

Merry Christmas! What a beer! Pours very dark brown into the glass with a small tan head. Awesome aromas of malt, yeast, and some notes of spice. Wonderful mouthfeel with the abv creating a warming sensation and increasing the complexity. Nice fireside sipper for sure. Absolutely delicious!

Poured from a 750 ml bottle that has been cellaring for several years. An amazing ruby color with a thin head. The aroma is malt dominant, notes of raisin, fig, prune, caramel, dark stone fruits, slight spicing at the end. Very nice holiday brew.

Bottle. 2006 vintage, as "Gouden Carolus Cuvee de Noel." Thanks to KyotoLefty. Sugary, thick spiced cake-like aroma, candied fruit, and some smoke.  Ruby color. Initial is quite sweet; mid allows some tang to develop; final is tingling and satisfying. Primary notes are of a very ripe and rounded fruitiness. Amazing stuff. It has matured so well over the six-seven years.
Bottle.  Pours dark amber with thin beige head and minimal spotted lacing.  Aroma is banana, buttermilk, yeast.  Taste is banana, anise, sour cream.

Tap @ The Forge Fort Collins. Pours a hazy dark brown appearance with a creamy tan head. Spicy, black cherry, toffee, rich candy sugar aroma. Berry, cherry, orange fruity, chewy burnt sugary, caramel flavor. Lots of dark fruits. Pretty tasty.
Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is big fruity malt with shitloads of christmassy spices. Flavour is big caramel malt and huge taaitaai/speculaas kruiden. Probably god but not my thing.
Bottle @ tasting. Clear amber pour, thin off-white head. Aroma of loads of spices, speculaas, brown sugar and cardamom. Flavor is very sweet and spicy, caramel and sugars. A bit too sweet and spciy.
Rich an alcoholic and thin body. Has an EnglisH personality. Excellent yeasty appeal. Awesome corky aroma.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2012 Two year old 330ml bottle, reddish black with almost no head. Thick caramel, burnt toffee and something I dont like the taste and smell of - aluminium, rubber? I dont remember this from last year with a bottle from the same batch. Fennel, chocolate & liquorice, just a hint. I loved this beer at one year old, not so much now. Take 2 - another bottle from the same year. Candy sugar initially mellowing to a well rounded fruity brew with bitter chocolate & molasses with that lovely liquorice at the end. Thats more like it.
A special beer, very strong licorice. Smooth, full-bodied, creamy, alcohol well-hidden. Delicious. Had to order a second one. Clearly one of the best Belgian Christmas beers.

csakajosor.hu
 Sötét, rubin piros színe van, ami egy hatalmas méretű, sűrű, bézs színű és pitbull kitartású hab trónol. Amikor nagy nehezen kiszabadulnak az illatok a brutális hab alól, akkor érezzük a tipikus, erős belga ales sörök alkoholos, fűszeres, élesztős, komlós, gyümölcsös aromákat, kiegészítve egy kis mézzel és malátával. Íze tele van aszalt déli gyümölcsökkel, olyan fűszerekkel, amik a mézeskalácshoz kellenek a mézzel együtt, medvecukor, szilvabor és komló. Elég testes és szénsavas. Utóíze keserédes, fűszeres és kissé száraz. Nagyon jó, igazi karácsonyi söröcske, ami kellemesen melegít és zsongat.

La mia bottiglia aveva qualche annetto di maturazione alle spalle. Si presenta nel bicchiere con un bel colore bruno tendente al nero. La schiuma è abbondante e mediamente persistente. Aroma fruttato, dolce con un leggero accenno di liquirizia. Ingresso in bocca caldo, avvolgente, alcolico. Dominano le note dolci. Incredibilmente corposa e vellutata. Una buona complessità di sapori ma pur sempre gradevole, differente per intenderci da quelle abbuffate di spezie sontuose e stancanti di altre birre natalizie. Quello che stupisce di più è il finale, assolutamente inebriante e gradevolissimo. Fino ad adesso la miglior birra natalizia mai assaggiata.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2012 Appare come una Perla Nera nel bicchiere, dallaroma zuccherino, di  liquirizia. Allingresso in bocca si schianta con una leggera punta di acidità ed equilibrata frizzantezza, per poi avvolgere con dolci tentacoli di liquirizia e caramello le papille gustative, affondandole in un caldo e calmo mare dalcool e cioccolata al latte. Ok stavo guardando i Pirati dei Caraibi...comunque ottima birra natalizia e bevuta incantevole!

33 cl bottle. Delicious aroma of caramel, bread and licorice, very malty. The taste is smooth, I dont notice the 10.5%. Sweet and warming taste, with medium to full body. The sweetness is not overbearing, which is key. The carbonation is medium. Long and malty/yeasty finish. I really like the aftertaste of this beer, its plain delicious and nourishing.

330 ml, bought in the Norwegian Vinmonopolet. Pours black with an offwhite  head. Nose of sweet malts and ripe banana. Aroma of sweet banana, fruit, hints of licorice. Tastes nice, very special, have never tasted anything like it.
750mL bottle, Thanks Brett! This is a sweeter beer, with good spice strong belgian profile and a syrupy but well developed mouthfeel. thick and warming.

On draft at church key in DC.  Pours an opaque dark brown with a thick bubbly off white head.  Carrots and caramel sugar in the nose.  Smooth mouthfeel dominated by sweet toffee and licorice.  Superb.

nice foam, orange/brown, caramelly tast, oily texture, sweet taste with a bit of licorice, nice caramelly aftertaste
delightful
UPDATED: DEC 25, 2016 Van de tap. Donkerbruin ,medium kraag. Smaakt naar wat hoestsiroop met vage kersensmaak, engelse drop, zoetfruitig.  Lekker zoet kerstbier.

An exceptional Belgian strong, and easily one of the best Belgian (or any other) Christmas Ales.  Malty, rich, near syrupy in texture. This beer is a must on an Christas beer list and was a part of the Winter beer tasting in Lawrence, Dec. 2012.

Bottle, 75 cl. Hazy deep orange brown with a huge beige head leaving laces. Intense and complex aroma: dark malty, plummy, estery, port wine, dried fruity. Quite som star anise in the mouth, but some how it works. Finishes rather dry dry and malty with lightly bitter finish.

330 ml bottle @ home.December 15,2012.
Bottle bought @ Vinmonopolet Storo,October 29,2012
Dark brown in color.Aroma is malt, molasses,fruit and some yeast.
Very sweet taste and aftertaste.Medium to full carbonation.Not my style and type of beer.

750 ml bottle. 12092. BB 13/10/15. From Germany. Courtesy of Brandman. HHOKXII.
Dark brown colour. Toothpaste and Dr. Pepper in aroma. Not a very good combination. Strong malt, syrup, molasses and some yeast in flavour. Bad. Total disappointment.
Aged Bottle from Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Colour is reddish dark brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours are raisins, plums, sweetness, caramel and malts.

On Draught @ Lucky Baldwin's in Pasadena.   This beer is exquisite dor the season.  Enjoyed with a chicken/cornish 'pastie' ... azong

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
