Dark brown with reddish highlights, pale tan head, spotty lacing.  Nose is sweet malts with prunes, caramel, brown sugar, and booze.  Flavor is similar with a candy-like sweetness.  Medium bodied, appropriate carbonation, finish is a bit sweet, and boozy.

150cl bottle shared with Steve.Deep red brown pour which looked very inviting in the large sized glasses we served it in on a cold December afternoon.Lovely aroma of roast malts and fortified wine,fruit and spices with yeast notes,cherries and a little chocolate.We drank this one slightly warm and detected a lot more to it than the previous years 75cl bottle.
All of the above in the taste with the unmistakable aftertaste of the Gouden Carolus range.Nice warming alcohol,so glad we had the 150cl bottle with just the two of us to "sample" it..Dark,strong and spicy and next to Lambics,my favourite style of beer.
Deep ruby in color with lots of of fruit notes. Almost no head and little lace. Fruity taste and malty with strong alcohol notes.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2013 330ml bottle. Nice sweet, caramel, roasty and anise aromas. Pours dark, some amber tones, with cremay tan head, some persistance and lacework. Medium body, average carbonation, oily texture. Taste is smooth, sweet, some caramel, fruity, spicy, with a long and sweet aftertaste. very balanced despite the wide range of flavours. Quite enjoyable. Possibly my fav. Xmas beer.

Got a bomber of this for my birthday from a good friend. I really liked it. Great aromas of fruit and licorice. It reminds me a lot of glug (I probably spelled that wrong) that my wife makes every year at Christmas. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap 4 oz. pour at Churchkey in Logan Circle neighbohood, Washington, DC.  Churchkey offered vintage pours from 2009 through 2012.  It would have been nice to compare all 5.  This is the 2009 vintage.

Hazy golden straw color with off-white head and good lacing.

Aroma of yeast, spices, fruit and caramel. 

Taste of spices, yeast, caramel and fruit. Spicy hot finish. 

Medium/full body and medium/low carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle, corked and caged. Pours a murky reddish brown with a one finger khaki head. Nose full of aroma including, prunes, raisins, dates, licorice and chocolate covered cherries. Much of the aforementioned comes throught in the flavor as well. It is sweet, yet acidic at the same time. The alcohol is not distracting, but it is there. Full bodied with nice carbonation. Interesting Christmas treat. Glad I shared it with the wife as a whole bottle would have been a bit much.

Bottle shared by jayhawk73. Thanks Jeff.

The beer appears dark chestnut brown with a formidable khaki head. Ample lacing and lasting head retention. The aroma offers malt, sweet spice, brown sugar, dark fruit, alcohol. Sweet breads, dark fruit, spices, malt, brown sugar, and Christmas cookies in the flavor. Quite sweet throughout - I am glad to be splitting this bottle. Licorice, candies, decadent holiday sweets, fruitcake. Complex and well done, though a bit cloying for my taste. The feel is thin to medium bodied with adequate carbonation. Overall, a bit too sweet, though well done and enjoyable. Best in small quantities.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-16-2011

aroma: licorice, caramel, alcohol, 
apparenza: brown, brown foam, cloudy, 
gusto: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
palato: medium body, soft carbonation, creamy, 
ho dato 9 allaroma per la persistenza e per il buon profumo di liquirizia molto decisa,mista ad altre spezie..speravo di non ritrovare la liquirizia in maniera così intensa anche nel gusto,ma non è stato così..troppo ma veramente troppo pronunciata,mista ad altre spezie che la rendono una birra dallaroma e dal gusto complicatissimo,ma riuscirei a berne solo piccolissime quantità.

Bomber courtesy of wardo22503. Pour is a thick dark red/brown color. Strong aromas of licorice; almost Ouzo like, with anise and some dark fruitiness. Tatse is sweet & malty with the belgian yeast making its way in. Raisins, plums, licorice, alcohol. Full bodied dark winter ale. Not my favorite style though.
user_location: Menasha Red Light District, Wisconsin, USA

text: Dark with a lot of white foam. Nose of spices and liquorice. Tastes very sweet: dried fruit, chocolat, sugar. Interesting but too sweet.

Wonderful bottle conditioned texture.. Smooth, round and creamy.. Almost like a cream soda in many regards.. Wonderful aromas and flavors of vanilla, spice, licorice, cola, and dark, dried, candied fruit... A wonderful, warming, adult beverage for the winter time.. Blurs the line between beer and soda... Mmmmmm... Yummy! Great complexity and uniqueness.  

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Wonderful christmas beer. Taste is raisins and plums, with some spicy notes. A bit candy flavored as well. Carbonation is Belgian :-) The high alcohol percentage is hardly noticeable. Great complex beer.

Bottle: pours opaque, gingerbread brown, dense off white head that recedes to a tight ring. Cola, cinnamon, black licorice, cab wine barrels on the nose. Gingerbread, cinnamon, black licorice, dates, some boozy cranberries, nice and warming in the belly. Solid carbonation and a perfect winter warmer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Prune juice on steroids. Lots of dried fruit in the aroma and taste of this seasonal. High ABV comes through in the small (burns the nose) and taste as acidity/tartness. A sipper for sure, good for the cold, wet months of winter...

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ after a day's brew. Black brown. Small head. Sweet dark fruits. Roasted malty notes. Sweet dry long spicy finish. Fine x-mas brew.

Thin head with a reddish/brown colored body.
Smell is a hefty dose of licorice and chicory coffee. Heady but nice.
Taste is licorice also. Quite sweet overall. While its good, it lacks complexity.
Texture is sticky, medium to thicker body and low carbonation.
A warming ale for sure but the licorice was a bit strong for me.

Aromas ligeros en donde destacan notas dulces a caramelo, chocolate y ligeramente madera.
Cerveza obscura con tintes rojizos a la luz. Cuerpo medio, carbonatacion ligera y corona de espuma pequeña con muy poca retencion debido a sus 10% de alcohol.
En boca sumamente sabrosa. Se perciben sabores dulces, principalmente caramelo, asi como una buena potencia alcholica ideal para las tardes frias.

Al paladar en primera instancia se percibe dulzor agradable en lengua. Posteriormente sus 10% se perciben de forma abrupta pero agradable en garganta dejando un final intenso y largo. El amargor practicamente no se percibe, sin embargo el equilibrio es genial disfrutandose al tomarse en la ocasión adecuada!

En general creo que se trata de una excelente Christmas beer que aun cuando en aroma y apariencia no son la mejor, en boca y paladar se diafrutan ampliamente!

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2012 Aroma - ooh, nice.  Like raisin and cranberry pie.  Pretty pungent and boozy.  Very distinct and memorable.  After sitting for a couple of minutes, it took on an entirely new, vinous aroma - I passed it around to others who were incredulous it was the same beer!  Wowzers.  Talk about complexity in the scent.  Appearance: beautiful head and lacing.  Nice dark red-brown color.  I have been admiring this things aroma and appearance for several minutes before even trying it - I sure hope it lives up to the expectations.  Allrighty, here goes: strong acid, raisins, cranberries, wine, booze.  Fruity and sugary in the finish and after-flavors.  Okay, not quite on par with the aroma, but a nice beer.  Actually tastes more like wine more than any beer Ive had before.  ADDITIONAL NOTES, 11/27: Another new aroma came about today - licorice!  There is a new aroma almost every time I smell!  Too bad I cant keep this beer around as a fragrance.  Uprating the aroma to 10 - never have I had a beer with so many different and interesting scents.
Bottle at home. Aroma ; anis, lachris, sugar. Alcohol. Dark brown color white head. Very rich taste, anis, lots of sugar, warm from the alcohol. Relly nice

On tap at Macgregors.  Very dark ruby brown. Soft carbonation. Minimal beige head, mostly diminishing. Brutally intense aroma of licorice. First taste is of the sweet. The body is thick and a bit oily. Pleasent bitter aftertaste.  Not as good as other Christmas beers of the night.
Bubbly thick head, dark orange.  Festive.  Thin taste in palate, slight booze and yeast tang.  More oranges in the palate.  Interested, I slightly preferred the Delerium.  On tap at McGregors.

2011 bottle shared by rschnake...thanks Rob! - Pours mahogany with a thin light tan head. Nose is sharp booze, oak, and a big maltiness. Taste is fruity and sugary, with some menthol and oaky malt on the finish. Thinnish body with soft carbonation.

Looks amazing in the glass as you would expect from a Gouden Carolus beer but aroma and especially taste of very sweet liquorice is a bit too much for me, even in a festive brew. I also get some rubber/latex which is all sorts of wrong. I struggled to finish it.

Shared bottle at Cardinal. Dense, two fingers thick, light brown head on a clear chestnut-orange body. Aniseed dominate the aroma like a rustique toothpaste. Caramel toffee is added in the mouth. Full bodied and syrupy.
La tomé en Tilburg en un bar. Es exquisita un poco más contundente que la clasic.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2015 Fra flaske på Cardinals juleøltreff nov-12: mørk og aromatisk i dubbel-stil, men enda kraftigere. Kaffe, karamell og svisker/fiken etc i aroma og smak. Litt krydderraffienement i tillegg. Kraftkost for viltre krabater! Superdejlig. Flaske delt med Ovesen på Holmens juleverksted: rubinrød med flott skum. Mer lakris og stjerneanis enn det jeg noterte meg sist. Men fortsatt en dejlig vinterøl. Ned fra 4.0 til 3.7

Draught @ Fairbar, Århus
Pours clear deep reddish brown with a creamy off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, chocolate, caramel, brown sugar, dried fruits, licorice and alcohol. Taste is heavy sweet and light bitter with a long warm, sweet and chocolate finish. Body is full, texture is sticky, carbonation is soft.

Bottle.My Christmas beer no 11 2012.Dark brown colour with medium head.Aroma of christmas spices,most like anis and also prune,good full body and nice well balanced taste overall one of the best christmas beers i guess.

Bottle at home. 
Aroma ; anis, lachris, sugar. Alcohol. 
Dark brown color white head. 
Very  rich taste, anis, lots of sugar, warm from the alcohol. 
Relly nuce c. Ale   

Bolton Brew Rocks !!

Bottle (330 ml). Thanks Patrick for this one! Brown with a small beige head and good lacing. Aroma of malt, spices, dark fruits and candie sugar. Taste is sweet and about the same as aroma. Warming alcohol. Good belgian strong ale but theres a spice that I dislike and Im unable to tell what it is.

(From notes) Tap. The aroma holds all sorts of spices. Regrettably I cannot discern them, especially a certain spice that stands out from the overall aroma. Flavor is sweet and spicy. I liked this beer quite a lot. This is a sipping beer, seeing how the spices might get overwhelming otherwise.

This is your standard Belgian Strong with light spice addition that is a christmas ale!  Pretty good and very nicely deisguised as a lower abv beer.  Nutty, dark fruits, and spices with a bit of abrasive metalic flavor that didnt recede like metal flavors normally do in beer.  Pretty good though,
2009, The spices have faded a decent amount here. Run of the mill safe belgian quad. Cork shot out.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2015 33cL bottle.  Great aroma, almost no head, practically black color.  Taste is, wow, overpowering.  Too much, even.  Licorice is the predominant taste.  Alcoholic.  Maybe Ill try another at Christmastime.

Rerate: 750mL yeah its still strong as hell, with a licorice taste.  Still too strong for me, but well-made

Ar: Strong anise - some plum, raisin, and a bit of smoke.
Ap: Deep red-brown, clear - medium tan head with decent retention, leaves some sudsy lacing.
T: Anise flavor up front, some smoke and phenols - plum, prune, and raisin - medium bitterness with very herbal character - sweetness is medium - finishes smoky with continuing anise notes - alcohol well-hidden.
P: Medium body with medium-high carbonation - finish is dry.
O: Substantial holiday ale - anise flavor is a bit strong, but, otherwise, a nice mix of fruit, spice, and sweetness.

Dark brown pour with a medium tan head. Big malty nose sweet plum and apple flavors. No hops, full bodied

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is Chirstmas in July for me, been saving it.  Dark fruity malts with brandy in the nose.  Lots of strong flavors,  Dark cherries, liquorice, cola , followed by bubblegum, lots sweetness, and boozy.  Great winter warmer, with heat in the finish.

3 finger beige head that sinks to 1/2 finger, brown body with a red tint. Nose: Anis, licorice and bubblegum. Aroma: Anis, sweet licorice, bubblegum, salty licorice, brown sugar and raisins. Vinious. Semi-long ending with little bitterness.
Bottle. Color dark brown with medium head. Aroma sweet, fruits, caramel, alcohol, spicy. Taste sweet, fruit, spicy, alcohol.

Molto complessa, frutti rossi e noci in evidenza e spezie, scura con bei riflessi rossi e una abbondante schiuma color nocciola abbastanza persistente, alcolica ma alcol decisamente nascosto, molto beverina, aroma forte particolare di frutti rossi e maturi! Gran birra!!!
Fruity and rich and the strong alcohol content is hidden nicely in an explosion of flavors. Is somewhat reminiscent the Jägermeister.
A beautiful red beer with a thin off white head. Strong toffee aroma with alcohol and spice. Fruity flavor matched with a medium body. Good ripe finish that reminds me of the holidays.

Pungent nose full of brown sugar, dark cherry, yeast and licorice schnapps. Thick brown appearance with expected suspension. Flavor is heavy semi-sweet and perhaps smokey. Also very boozy. Thick and heavy, and the yeast are palpable. Great winter beer...looks like I grabbed it too late this year.
From the nose I am about to drink a big sweet caramel toffee beer (hints of liquorice).  Which is what I got.

Appearance: a soft khaki head blankets dark woodsy browns with mahogany and cherry wood highlights when help up to the light. Head fades soft and bready, leaving patches of lace in its wake. Swirls with fluff and some bubbles.

Nose: cherry and chocolate powder. Nutmeg and allspice. Fig and date cake  dense with fig newton designs. Vanilla extract. Candied pineapple and cherry candies without the saccharine sweetness. Root beer candies.

Palate: root beer, cherry, and pineapple gummies. Maraschino cherries. Dried and sweet figs and dates. Spice in the finish  allspice and nutmeg. A gentle warmth of mulled sweet red wine. Plums. Fresh black cherries. Chocolate somewhere, nowhere, and everywhere.

Final Thoughts: delicious dangerously drinkable. I now have a new favorite Christmas seasonal to look forward tountil another ousts the Gouden Carolus Noel from its wintry throne.

This is a review of the 2008 brew which was stored at the brewery for two years and opened at the 16th Essen Christmas beer festival 2010.

My bottle review wasnt overly kind to this beer, what a diffence a couple of years in a cask makes! That review is at the end of this if youre interested.

The liquorice flavours that almost ruined my bottle review were almost completely gone, to be replaced by blackberries and plums.

The aroma was Port like with sweet molasses and Christamssy spices added, as was the rich taste and mouthfeel. Someone mentioned cough sweets in the beer tasting notes at the festival and that is a good choice of the words too. That liquorice flavour from my bottle review now coming back into play as the mouth dries giving the beer an alcoholic, malty, cough sweet sort of taste.

Anker matured this specially for two years, I thank them for that. 1st Review: Brown 33cl bottle, best before Nov 2009, drank Apr 2007. 

Poured into a Brugse Straffe Hendrik chalice. 

Lovelly dark ruby red, sadly the biege head soon departed leaving a scum, or if you like, a wisp on top of the body. 

The aroma was of sweet liquorice, nothing else could get past that smell in my bottle anyway. 

The taste was also of liquorice, but tempered with plums and Christmas spices. A sort of alcoholic liquid Christmas Pudding, with somebody adding liquorice. 

The flavour of liquorice stays forever, the mouthfeel is clingy and almost sickly, I had to have some Brie and salted biscuits half way through the beer to help me see it off. 

A warm fire and cold night beer, the liquorice almost ruined it for me, but it is never-the-less, a good Christmas beer. 

I think I have won the world record for mentioning liquorice in a beer review, please beermail me if you know different!
This is a big one... my first rating where Id use the word complex. I was smashed when I drank it though... but I clearly remember thinking of aniseed. Enjoy it.
My GF thinks this smells like Pine Sol - I cant disagree. This is STRONG in both smell and taste. It actually does taste like a Christmas tree... interesting.

33cl bottle. Dark, red Brown colour. Sweet aroma: malts, dark fruits and candy sugar. Taste is rich and sweet: herbs and definitely some alcohol. Heavy mouthfeel.
Excellent beer

leather, grass, cereal, ginger, butterscotch, basement aromas, orange, sparkling, rocky head, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, full body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, bitter,

A hardcore alcohol smell with some serious desert sweetness.  Really hard taste, almost like jagermeister. Tastes like its been fermenting many a dark moment in dungeons under Flemish churches.  I swear I smell jager.  Bottle at The Rhino.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2016 33cl bottle.
Clear dark reddish brown with a thick beige head that lace.

Sweet vinous malty aroma with plum, raisins in liquer, dates, karamel, burnt sugar, clove, glue stick and lots of anis that reminds of ouzo.

Sweet and malty flavor with lots of dark fruits and spices. As the aroma, but also some orange peel, cloves, cinnamon, anis. Dry vinous end.

Soft and "cool" but big mouthfeel with soft velvety carbonation.

A truly great beer, but I think the anis is too prominent. At least for me.

From a 33 cl bottle in Motala december 2011. Dark brown beer with a beige head. Licorice, breadspices and dries dark fruits aroma. Licorice, caramell, chocolate and spicy flavour. Nice a bit different beer :-)

Bottle 33cl, a clear dark amber beer with good creamy head. Nose is on spices and caramel malt. Aroma is on creamy sweet caramel with licorice and cardamom notes, some anise hints too. Fruit notes are on apricot and dry grapes, good body, well done beer a bit too much anise in this one.

Aroma is dark fruit/plums with a hint of alcohol.  The flavor is similar to the aroma along with a candy sweetness, almost like bubble gum.  Its difficult to screw up a BSA, this didnt, it was pretty good.

On cask at the 2012 NWAF, Manchester. Pours a dark ruby - brown colour with a thick, light tan head. Aroma of liquorice, caramel, alcohol, Christmas spices, plums and rum and raisin chocolate. Liquorice flavour upfront with alcohol quite prominent and plums, rum and raisin chocolate and caramel notes. Moderate carbonation with a great chewy mouth-feel and light CO2 prickle. Amazing!
Poured dark purples with thick head for 10.5.  Smelled fruity slight oak and licorice.  Tasted licorice, plums, and oak with alcohol aftertaste

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2012 [ ASPETTO ] 			
color marrone scuro, con riflessi porpora, velata			
[SCHIUMA]			
color beige, buona presenza, compatta e  media persistenza. residuo resistente			
[ OLFATTO ]			
buona intensità con note caramellate, zucchero, un consistente contributo dato dai lieviti ed un fruttato che si mescola con sentori alcolici			
[ GUSTO ]			
un dolce iniziale, con sfumature di malto, caramello e forse cioccolato, segue un fruttato complesso con note di frutta secca e con un acenno di atringenza che mi mescola con uno speziato finale a cui contribuisce in buona parte una alcolicità  fino ad ora ben nascosta. Retrogusto persistente, con ancora qualche reminiscenza del dolce ed un piccantino sulla lingua, frutto degli abbondanti 10 gradi; accompagna un leggero amaro tendente allerbaceo, che lascia una sensazione quasi legnosa.			
[ TEXTURE ]			
corpo medio, mantiene una certa morbidezza, media carbonazione,  percezione alcolica (sorprendentemente) media, concentrata soprattutto nel finale			
COMMENTO FINALE			
natalizia intrigante, dinamica, non stopposa. Alcohol allapparenza contenuto, che interviene quasi come comprimario e solo nel finale da la stoccata decisiva. un delizioso pourporri di note fruttate, lievito e una maltatura solida; nel complesso mi è apparsa più equilibrata e facile da bere di altre natalizie super blasonate.

Bottle poured into tulip.  Exquisite appearance, dark ruby red/brown in color with a substantial slightly beige, frothy head that lingers long.  Light yet aromatic aroma of yeast, dark fruits, hint of oaky vanilla.  Soft and slick on the palate.  Spicy, fruity, and sweet upfront before a nice dry bitter finish laced with fig and plum.  While not mindblowing, a very solid Belgian holiday seasonal.

[330ml bottle, Appellation Wines, Edinburgh] Hazy golden amber pour, decent white head. Sweet liquorice aroma, star anise quite prevalent. Flavour of chocolate malt, before the aniseed comes out on the finish. Sweet but never cloying, a really good Christmas beer  the balance is superb, as is the hidden alcohol [15122011]
bottle. dark copper pour with nice head.  brown sugar, spice, rasin, fruit cake.  nice balance of sweetness, alcohol and carbonation.  medium body thay makes this an enjoyment.  great beer.

On draft at Issacs. Another great Belgian beer. Big spice aromas. Nice mahogany pour.. Tastes of spice, raisin, bread, brown sugar and rye.

Fantastic.

About 2 year old bottle received as a gift. Pours very dark ruby brown, beige head, good lacing. Sweet aromas of dried fruits and herbs. Very balanced taste of malts, dried fruits (apricots?), some hops in the aftertaste. Awesome!

Medium biege head dark burgundy pour aromas cinnamon alcohol clove aniseed dark fruits yeast carbonation mild medium flavours aniseed cinnamon clove port plums raisin brown sugar candy real cherries good yeast charater mild bitter creamy vanilla touch sweetness is superbly done good mix of fruit and spice and all things that taste good over christmas  so well done by Het anker a lasting aftertaste of goodness throughout one of the best Christmas beers you can get simply beautiful

Bottle.
Dark reddish brown, beige head leaving lacing.
Aroma: dried apricots, bubble gums, some licorice.
Taste: lots of candy, bubble gum, licorice, brown sugar, caramel, some kind of spice, some chocolate, warming, but the alcohol is well hidden.
Full-bodied.
Nice Christmas beer.

11.2 ounce bottle. Pours a reddish brown with a medium off-white head. Aromas of Christmas fruits and caramel. Flavors of caramel, brown sugar, dark fruits and slight alcohol. This is an awesome winter beer and one of my favorite Belgium Cristmas brews.

Very dark brown pour, with a silky head and generous lace. Delicate bouquet of disparate aroma notes. I got cherry pie, musk, brandy, orange zest, fresh bread, spice and a light hint of soy sauce - but this more than most beers may be open to interpretation. In the mouth its a bit more robust: loads of dark malt, bread, molasses, clover honey and some boozy alcohol, with the delicate muskiness and spiciness coming through in the finish. High candi-sugar sweetness, and a low but noticeable bitterness. Very interesting beer - hard to believe it isnt spiced.

Serving: 750 ml. bottle from State Line Liquors.  It pours a very deep amber with a large frothy, off white head.  Great head retention.  The nose is a bit boozy with sour apple, dried fruit, and date notes.  The flavor is sweet and spicy with some apple, tea, candy sugar, brown sugar, and alcohol.  The alcohol isnt overbearing but does a nice job of drying out the back end.  Medium bodied with average carbonation.  A very tasty holiday beverage.

Pours a dark ruby red with an offwhite head that fades quickly.  Sweet, malty aromas.  Spicy and sweet attack which fades to a very sweet, alcohol finish.  Very nice spices, a great cold weather brew.

Very dark ruby brown. Soft carbonation. Minimal beige head, mostly diminishing. Brutally intense aroma of licorice. First taste is of the sweet. The body is thick and a bit oily. Pleasent bitter aftertaste. A good medicin for Christmas.

Draft. Murky brown colour. Little head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts and dark, ripe fruits. Could have detected more if only I had the chance. Flavour is full bodied and balanced. Some full bitter sweetness of the roast, great balance. Could drink this all day, too bad of the heavy alcohol.

bb2014 version  poured into leffe goblet   - almost no head at all    pleasant aroma - fruit cake with brandy notes  deep clear brown ale almost black  . luscious taste   boozy fruit cake  juicy ending with alcohol warmth showing through  good depth with modest carbonation    could drink with christmas pudding although I enjoyed on its own      one to savour     ideal festive ale   one of my favourites
Pours a dark brown with a thin off white head.  Aniseed, caramel, spices on the nose.  Tastes of Christmas cake - fruity with a hint of alcohol.

Olut on tumman ruskea, hieman punertava ja jonkin verran läpinäkyvä. Vaahto on valkoista. Tuoksu on huikean yrttinen. Ihan kuin tässä olisi rakuunaa ja anista. Tuoksu on myös hedelmäinen. Maku puolestaan on yrttinen ja hedelmäinen. Suutuntumaltaan olut on pehmä lempeästä hiilihappoisuudesta johtuen. Kokonaisuudessaan oluesta voisi sanoa, että se on mielenkiintoisen mausteinen yskänlääke ja hyvällä tavalla sellainen.

Sötétbarna színű főzet némi rubinvörös beütéssel. Közepes méretű bézs habja viszonylag hamar összeesik, vékony fátyolt hagyván maga után.
Illata édes, aszalt gyümölcsös.
Fanyar aromáját is az aszalt gyümölcsös jellegek uralják, melyekhez nyelvet enyhén csípő likőrös ill. medvecukrot idéző ízek társulnak, testessége szirupos és kissé nehézkes.
Gyógyszeres és száraz befejezése hosszan tartó és szeszes, citrusokkal, ánizzsal és némi komlóval, amely egy fanyar utóízt hagy maga után.
Érdekes, komoly, tetszett.

Aged a little over a year, 2010 bomber from Norms in Vienna VA,  Good dark fruit flavor alcohol is well hidden.  The strange thing is that theres nothing on the front side of the palate at all.  Starts tasting like almost nothing, damn near water, then the sweet dark fruit (raisins, dates, plums) come on for a sweet slightly malty finish.  Body is very strange, but pleasant as well.

Location/Date:2010 Bottle split with Dave on December 25th, 2011.
Appearance: Pours a dark brown-black.
Aroma: Aroma is of malt and dark fruit.
Taste:Taste is similar to the aroma, very sweet, no bitterness, decent amount of malt.
Palate:Medium body, slightly sticky mouthfeel.
Summary: A one year old version of Carolus Noel, very interesting beer, sweet, tasty.
Murky brown with nice head and lacing. Sweet candied fruit (fig, apricot , plum ??). Very satisfying.

Poured a cloudy brown color.  Generous frothy head that lingered on.  Aroma has raisin, orange, honey, licorice , cinnimon, belgium candy yeast, and more raisin.  
Medium sweetness.  Light bitter.  Creamier texture.  Med bodied.  A very complex beer.  Lots of flavors going on.  Nice beer. Slight alcohol finish at end.  Would say this is just a good belgium strong rather than a xmas flavor/style.

Bouteille de 33cl. Couleur rouge foncé-marron, mousse importante de tenue moyenne. Un nez qui sent lamande avec en bouche, un sublime arôme de frangipane, des notes de réglisses et dautres fruitées et épicées, sucrée à la perfection. On ne soupçonne pas une seconde les 10,5% d alcool. Texture agréable, pour chercher la petite bête, je dirais quil manque un tout petit peu de longueur mais dans lensemble, cest une exquise bière de noël. Trouvée à vanuxeem - Ploegstaert.

330ml bottle.  Pours a very dark caramel with a medium head.  Aroma is aniseed malt and root beer.  Taste has aniseed to start, fennel and raisin malt finish.  Good level of carbonation in the finish.
750ml bottle from a trade. maroon with a tan head. very sweet and malty. not overly drinkable. no spicing. pretty meh.

33 cl bottle, Dark brown with a fantastic foamy lightbrown head. The aromas are malt, licorise, and some spices. The taste is sweet malty with a licorise and dark fruits ending. High alc, but you do not sence that to much,. Nice one1
Day before Christmas, what is better than having a nice Christmasbeer.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours clear deep ruby brown with a nice creamy tanned head leaving lace. Aroma is malty, sweet, spicy, cloves, yeasty, caramel, licorice and fennel. Flavor is sweet, malty, spicy, licorice, alcohol and bitter; very nice indeed. Finishes sweet, spicy and bitter.

Very Dark beer with a thick heavy head.  It smells like most other Christmas brews that I have had this season. It is slightly sweet and spicy from pepper. It has a very strong boozy finish which I do enjoy in my Christmas beers. Overall, although it is a good beer, It is a one and done.  It just doesnt have enough sweetness or spice for me.
(Bottle 21/12-2011) medium beige head, clear dark brown color, smooth taste, slightly alcohol taste. BB date 14/10/13.

330ml bottle.
Pours a deep brownish amber, with a beige head.
The aroma is spicy and very estery, caramel, bubblegum, licorice, candied sugar, dried fruits, figs, chestnuts, walnuts.
Quite sweet, full bodied, not more than medium bitterness, creamy CO2.
Rich taste, lots of fruity esters going on, candied sugar, dried fruit, faintly hoppy, caramel malt, Madeira wine, licorice, maple syrup, dark cherries.
Long, sweet, alcoholic finish. Very good now, lay it down for a year or two, and the sweetness will be more balanced. (2011-12-20)

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2013 From the tap at the brewery. Dark red brown with small beige fluffy creamy head. Aroma is lots of liquorice, lots of sweet and roasty malt, bit of fruit cake. Taste is much the same, bit more pronounced dark fruit and the liquorice is still there but a bit less overpowering. Big warming alcohol feeling further down the glass, with less liquorice and more malt and fruit. Lovely.
Had it again and it smelt like blue cheese. Great stuff!

Bottle (33cl) from Vinmonopolet, Oslo. Half-inch beige head that settles as a ring with some lacing. Clear, dark reddish brown colour. Complex aroma of Belgian yeast (esters), malt, dried fruits (fig, raisin), caramel, candy, licorice, alcohol. Sweet taste, well-balanced by fruity acidity, mild bitterness and even a salty sensation in the finish. Full body, but very drinkable at this ABV. Mildly fizzy carbonation.

Bottle.  Complex with lots of holiday spices in the aroma.  Palate was not as carbonated as I have come to expect from a Belgian Strong.  So, I was a little let down there.  A good amount of licorice comes out in the flavor, border line overpowering once it warms.
750oz in a snifter. Pours dark ruby red with beige head. Nose is licorice. Aroma is caramel malts and licorice.  Taste is sweet. Full body and long finish. Mmm twizzler.

This bottle was from 2008. The pour is a dark, purely opaque brown with a thick two finger beige head. The head is thick and pillowy with some light carbonation. A nicely roasted malt with a noticable note of cocoa powder and a big Belgian yeast on the nose. Some spicy yeast notes and a hint alcohol. Tons of beautiful dark and candied fruits and nice sugary sweetness. The taste is sweet, fruity and well malted with a highlight of candied plums, raisins and cherries. A hint of chocolate amidst the nice robust roast and light yeasty spice. Nutmeg, coriander and allspice are predominant spice characters. A warm alcohol on the finish with some light bitterness. This beer is full-bodied and smooth drinking with a nice creamy mouthfeel. Light carbonation on the tongue. Gouden Carolus is one of my favorite Belgian breweries and this did not disappoint me at all.

My every new years beer.  If I was going to make a crappy new years movie with a bunch of crappy actors that no one will remember next new years, and had to forget how crappy it was, Id drink a case of these.

Bottle from systembolaget. It poured a dark amber liquid with a big head. Spicy smell with liquorice being the strongest. Lots of liquorice in the taste as well, also some more sublte spices. Im having a hard time with the liqourice which is to bad because its a nice beer besides that. Hard to put a rating on this.

Brownish-ruby colour, minimal yellowish white head. Very strong herbal and spices fragrances, reminds me more of herbs-based hardcandies than usual Christmas cookies. Anise, bitter liquors, alcohol. I found these aromas strong and intensive but not too harsh or nauseating so I can say this is a good brew not only for the fans of herbs-flavoured liquors but anyone who enjoys some interesting aroma.
UPDATED: NOV 29, 2013 Dark brown with red glow and small beige head. Nice warming full bodied winterbeer with a lot of licorice.

75 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100718.
Pours dark ruby red colour with small head. Aroma of ripe fruits, plum, spices, caramel malts, yeast, brown sugar and syrup. Flavour of ripe dark fruits, spices sugar candy, malts, caramel, yeast, earth notes, lots of liquorice and some toffee. Full-bodied and flavourful brew with a nice warming alcohol burn. Excellent.
6326

Belga Sörök Háza, Budapest. Sötét vörösesbarna színe, és kevés krémes sárgás habja van. Illata nagyon édes, cukros és rágógumis, illetve már erősen kibontakozik az egész sört meghatározó fűszeres, gyomorkeserűs, orvosságos, ánizsos-likőrös vonal. Íze ezzel megegyező, de jobban érződik a maláta és a karamell, de az egésznek van valami köptető jellege. Nagyon testes, szirupos állaga van, alkoholos és édeskés, de a szénsavassága segít leküzdeni. A barátaimnak nagyon tetszett, de engem meg éppen taszított ez a gyomorkeserűs-orvosságos jelleg, amiben én semmi karácsonyit nem fedeztem fel, ugyanakkor rossz sörnek sem tartom.

On tap at BXL Cafe west 43rd street NYC.  Deep rich brown, but not opaque in the glass.  Nice head, nutty overtones with slight bitternes or spiciness of a coffee tinge. Smooth yet warming with no alcohol overtones, beautiful variation of belgian strong ale. So glad I made THIS the first beer of the afternoon, as it was remarkable.

d: lakrits och hostmedicin
s: mycket söt lakrits, kryddor, lite tunn och artificiell
Typical flavors and aromas of belgian yeast. Beats most of the other christmas beer at systembolaget. Nice round palate and finish
bottle thanks to someone.  poured amber with an off white head.  aroma was licorice.  flavor was licorice and dark fruits.

Bottle. 

Dark reddish/brown with a small creamy head. Dried fruit, chocolate, toffee, malt and spices. Quite warming with a thick mouth feel. I am qoing to age a couple of bottles just to see what happens with the beer.

Bottle pours dark brown with off white head. Smells of raisin and sweet grain and sugar. The taste is big and sweet with candi sugar, fruits similar to grapes raisin figs and more. Light on the tongue and sparkly but rich and strong throughout. There is a slightly creamy finish and a lasting sweetness with a but of grainy bitterness.

Best Christmas beer so far! Pours dark brown with a medium tan head. Nose is winter spices (carnation), gingerbread, licorice, belgian yeast and a bit of nutty malt. Taste is sweet with the licorice and gingerbread coming through, and with a lot of sugar. Complex and well nuanced. Body is full and creamy. Carbonation is fairly low but present.
Bottle. Pours ruby red to black. White head which dispersed. Bold nose. Aniseed. Tastes very much of liquorice. Charred liquorice. An amazingly complex flavour. Great festive fare.
33cl bottle. Pours hazy brown with Ã  huge brown head. Smells licorice and malty. Tastes sweet, licorice, chocolate malty with a smiliar finish.

750 ml bottle.
Pours a dark brown colour with a thick head. Aroma of sweet caramel malts, Christmas spices, anis and lovely toffee. Strong flavour of caramel malts, spices, dark fruits, gingerbread and nuts. Alcohol is well hidden. Full bodied, thick mouthfeel and a long, fruity and quite spicy finish. Really a treat.
Bottle. Complex winter warmer with notes of dried fruits, anis, milk choclate, soy and port wine. Elegant, and with a quite light body for a super complex 10,5%ABV beer. Just great!

Bottle from systembolaget, Christmas beer tasting. Helsingborg, November 2011. 

Sweet caramel aromas of aniseeds, liquorice, toffee and dark sugar. Beneath that some fruity esters and a dash of warming alcohol. Soft texture and full body. Moderately sweet flavours of syrup, bread, spices, Belgian yeast and dried dark fruits. Very tasty.
Pours a nice dark reddish amber color. Aromas of fruit, and some other hints, maybe some spices, maybe caramel. Flavor is a bittersweet, malty, and a hint of hops with a nice bittersweet finish.
Som en extas av smaker. Ett fyrverkeri av sinnlighet. Gouden Carolus Christmas är ett berusningsmedel i fler betydelser än vi är vana vid. Om salighet är ett recept är det nu funnet.

Bottle enjoyed at home
Pours dark brown with a red hue, thin lasting beige head. Smells powerfully of anis, aksi caramel, clove and belgian yeast esters. Full malt body, great sweetness, christmas spices, caramel and roasted malts. Also some raisins comes by past the end. Oily on the palate and finished off with some nice malt bitterness
Bottle.  Cherry toffee malt aroma.  Medium brown color with large head.  Sweet toffee malt and light alcohol flavor.   Light spicy finish.  Very nice - tasty malt.

0.33l bottle. Finally got a hold on this one after several attempts. Anyhow, this little thing pours a lightly clouded deep deep ruby-red body with a small and sidesticking just off-white head. The aroma is really sticky-sweet! Lots of candy but also a strange really herbal touch over this one! What could it be? Its kinda medicinal - in a herbal and good way. Really different for sure. And "snus"! Lots of it! It has a average carbonation level and a sticky to oily mouthfeel. Flavors also really strange! Lots of the same herbal-medicinal tones found in the aroma. Also its really sweet. A interesting and quite different beer.

250ml (7.4 oz) draught at the Brick Store.  Liquid chocolate (mud) passing red/orange lava light.  Head dissolves to light sandy cover.  Lacing covers.
Aroma is anisette, booze, and zest.  
Taste is of well-crafted liqueur or cloying beer.  Leaning toward saccharin.  
Palate is average carbonation, and a fairly long, sticky finish. 
Overall, its a well-crafted beer but too sweet for me.

Lakritssvart öl med fint ljust skum. Fantastiska dofter av socker, lakrits och honung. Mycket alkohol både i smaken (vilket drar ner betyget en aning), dessutom mycket lakrits, ljus sirap och sött bröd. Ledordet här är lakrits, söt sådan, som ni förstår. Jag älskar lakrits, jag gillar den här ölen mycket, mycket.

750ml bottle brought back from the brewery.  Clear, ruby body with a medium, frothy, light tan head.  Plum is punchy in the aroma followed by cinnamon, clove, a little allspice, and a dash of alcohol.  Dark fruit flavors with a some burnt brown sugar and mulling spices.  Alcohol is more prominent than in the aroma and borders on hot.  Fairly light body for the gravity with playful carbonation.  Malty, but well attenuated.  Alcohol seems to tame after a few more sips, but is still quite warming.  Lingering spice, but otherwise clean finish.  Overall a fun winter warmer that is just a bit rough around the edges.

330 ml bottle bought @ Systembolaget and consumed on November 28. Pours very deep chestnut brown with a fizzy grayish white head that slowly dissipates leaving a small amount of trace on the glass. Smell is very sweet with figs, dates, yeast and some alcohol. Theres also a spicy smell dominated by cloves. Taste is sweet and very spicy with cloves, nutmeg, ginger and some cardamom. Theres also dried sweet fruits like figs, dates, prunes, raisins and finally some metallic notes. Everything is then bound together by a taste of lightly roasted sweet malts and alcohol. Finish is slightly sweet and slightly bitter and lingers for quite some time.

33cl bottle. Pours translucent caramel with a slim layer of lace. The nose has liquorice and sugar, really sweet liquorice. The taste is incredibly rich and liquoricey. The palate has a lovely a rich structure and a rich texture but such a delicate finish. Overall, a gorgeous beer.

Tap. Dark ruby brown, thin eggshell head. Ginger all spice, spruce, toffee and rich dark fruit sweetness. Taste has some solid spice notes,very holiday in nature, pretty sweet...almost too much. Medium syrupy body, sift carbonation.

Dark brownish amber with nice large off-white head. Very rich in both nose and mouth. A lot of nice notes, Belgian yeast, raisins, alcohol. But also a chemical detergent kind of strange note in the mouth that bring it down a bit.

Wee bottle from SB cons 2011-11-20 Göteborg
AR: ooo it is like that Finish licorice in choclate or the  licorice that you find in a swedish "Twist" bag, the yolk is smelling similar but sweeter
AP: hazy oliy dark ruby colored body - thick and sugary, head is wee and beige in color
F: warming feeling, rasins,  licorice, caramel, wee choclate, dadels, sugary nd oliy feeling, the warming feeling is lasting

33 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Really deep amber, clear liquid with big, fluffy cappuccino head. Aroma feels belgo with notes of caramel, dark berries, banana, clove, nuts, candi sugar and dark fruit. Taste is quite sweet, fruity, spicy, a bit biscuity and light to medium bitter with huge licorice notes. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation. Wow, impressive Christmas beer. Really tasty.
UPDATED: MAR 7, 2012 Bottle. Amber colour with a enormous head that quick disappears. Very sweet nose. A bit "vinish" flavour, sweet caramel. Very well hidden alcohol taste.

75 cl bottle vintage 2008 @ home, BBE 09.10.2011
Aroma has anis, licorice, toffee and hints of butter. Flavour has licorice, anis and some warming alcohol  some sips even have too much alcohol. Spicy and sweet aftertaste with brown sugar. Smooth and rich palate. No signs of overaging  I might even say that this still has potential to develop to even better.

Bottle @ The BeerMongers...   Poured deep amber, ruby-ish with a beige head. Some alcohol warmth but still very drinkable.  Red licorice, red vine qualities. Black cherries, caramel tpasted sweetness, and dark fruit eaters. Some yeast spice. Super drinkable!
Strong licorice aroma and flavour. Somewhat of an alcohol burn. Some other spices in there.

Hasselnötsbrun öl med flyktigt beige skum. Först en söt doft av kanderat socker och torkad frukt och alkohol. Sedan kommer en doft av lakrits som tilltar. Smaken är mer av samma. Alkoholvärme och lakrits dröjer kvar i eftersmaken.

Cocacolaish with little head. Special sweet fruity aroma and with some chocolate, licorice. Taste unusual with sweet fruits, chocolate, licorice. Very notable alc. Full body. Finish of with sweetness and long alcohol.

33 cl bottle. Dark brown beer with tan head, creamy and persistent. Good lacing. Aroma is fruity, raspberries, cherryes and red rapes; caramel and candy sugar also present. Fruity flavour, dark fruits, with a final slighly sweet and lon. Soft carbonation, full body, creamy texture.
a very sweet beer. Fruity in flavour. A dark red colour with a creamy head. Good christmas beer.

From notes: Poured into a trappist glass, after pretty much exploding out of the bottle, a hazy, almost opaque nutty brown with a thick tan head.  Pleasant candied fruit aroma mixed with some yeast.  Medium-bodied, but with deep flavors.  Strong, sweet, fruity flavor up front giving way to notes of nutty malt and nutmeg in the finish.  Very good.

11.2oz bottle in a Trappist glass.  Pours very deep ruby/brown with a thick, lacy, beige head.  Aroma of spicy yeast, dark fruits and red grapes, caramel malts, a little floral hops, and a little alcohol.  Flavor about the same, with the beer tasting a little like wine.  A smooth texture.  A pretty good Belgian ale.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2011 one year old Bottle. Dark red/black colour, with a nice big head. aroma was dominated of anis, fruits, salty,lakris,Dark choclate.  Flavor is moutch a like the aroma part, complex ending with salt/lakris and vanilla, anis long finish. Big body. Nice

En ett år gammal flaska. Ett riktigt dessertöl med doft och smak av torkade frukter med mycket sötma och en anings syrlighet. Ska nog stå några år för sötman och styrkan ska gifta sig bättre men redan nu riktigt njutbart.
Dark red brown beer with an off white head. Has a sweet aroma with melon and caramel notes. Warming flavour with a spicy malty profile with licorice and dark fruits. Very nice.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2011 750mL corked bottle.  Poured reddish- brown with big long lasting off-white head and nice lace.  Aromas of chocolate, caramel and spice.  Flavours complex and nicely balanced with malts, hops and spice.  One of the best Christmas ales I have tasted.

Short review: 
Pours dark with an off white head (was at a dark bar so couldnt pick up hues). Smells of licorice, dark fruit. Tastes of dark fruit, licorice a  little spice. Booze is masked. Pretty full and smooth mouthfeel.  

Very, very good. Could write much more.

Reddish brown color with good head. Spicy and sweet aroma.  Flavor is very sweet, but as christmas beer its absolutte fantastic. A nice beer that warms wonderfully with his alcohol team and compact taste of raisins and caramel malt. Throw out the guests and forth with the rocking chair.

Had a 33cl bottle at Kulminator. Beautiful dark murky brown in colour. Aromas of molasses, chocolate and straw. Tasty sweet caramel with a hint of citrus, spices and a slightly nutty aftertaste. A great glass of Christmas cheer.

Nice copper color with a tan head, aroma of yeast, dark fruits, caramel, spices, and hard candy.  Smooth and somewhat thick mouthfeel added to the yeast gives it a bread like feel/taste to it, with spices, caramel and dark fruits.  Screams holidays in the nose and mouth.

Bottle sampled at Mondial de la bière 2011. Dark brown with a medium beige head and average retention. Aroma is anis, candy cane, alcohol, caramel, dark malt and sugar. Flavor is very sweet with anis, candy cane, brown malt, alcohol and brown sugar. Medium to full body with a liquorous mouthfeel.

Bottle. Dark copper appearance with a large beige head and light lacing. Yeasty, rich malt aroma with layers of licorice, ripe dark fruit and some spicyness. Sweet, caramel malt taste blends with flavors of plums, cherries, licorice and molassas. Smooth, full bodied, modestly carbonated mouthfeel with a warming, lingering, dessert wine-like finish.
(33cl bottle thanks to ericandersnavy) clear rich ruby, with a ring of off-white bubbles. Nose of caramel, vanilla and more caramel! Taste of vanilla, bready, caramel and chocolate with a thin body.
caramel, lakrids,red golden, clear, light brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice long sweet lakrids finish.
Dark brown with a light colored head.  Warm, rich, spice aromas; dry spicy finish.  Reminds me of Jubelale.
Love it. Candy sugar, dates and raisins, sticky sweetness...Belgian nose and flavors...great winter brew.

33cl bottle
Hazy red brown color with a white bubble head. The nose is very aromatic of herbs, cinnamon,  pepercake, caramel malt and slight hops. The flavor is spicy with a strong cinnamon flavor, light bitter, bastard suggar and apples. Medium body. A very balanced beer which is totaly different then the usual Gouden Carolus.

The beer pours dark brown with a light tan decent retention and lacing. 

The aroma is light with a little spice, same thing with the taste. 

The feel is ok, the drinkability is limited.

Overall, not a great the feel is to light, the taste is light and too much spice.

Thanks to Dan for this.  Pours a dark brown with a slightly off white head.   Aroma is a ton of licorice, sweet black licorice.  Taste is malty, licorice, sweet candy and raisin.  Great sipper on a cold night.
Similar to the easter, but a notch down. it is rich, malty, yeasty, spicy, just everything you want in a Christmas beer.

2009 Vintage [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, consumed Feb. 2011: very dark brown, cannot see through it, white head that leaves plenty of lacing, smells like dark fruits (including the typical Belgian raisins), sweet malt, toffee, tastes like pure liquorice, liquorice taste dominated so strongly that it was almost as if I was drinking liquid liquorice, also toffee, dark fruits, sweet malt, brown sugar, it is sweet to top it off, the body is on the heavier side, certainly not thick but somewhere in that direction, certainly up there for a Belgian beer, not a lot of carbonation to speak of, this is basically liquor liquorice to me, quirky once but could not even imagine drinking this ever once again but who knows

Reviewed from notes.

Pours a nice dark brown with some garnet hues. Nice of white head. The nose brings forward some dark fruits, booze, and quite a bit of wintry spice. Lots of black licorice. The taste is caramel, bread, dark fruit, dates, alcohol, and some nice nutmeg, clove, and a bit of other spices. Loads of anise. Overpoweringly so. Medium mouthfeel; a bit creamy. Drinks quite well and is a nice addition our holiday lineup.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-20-2010

amber, clear w/ steady bubbles
licorice nose
med body and slightly fizzy
nice licorice flavour that fades into caramel. this is fantastic! ive never had licorice beer before. i like it but it probably isnt for all the time

Botle, 33 cl.Red brown, with a small head. Aroma is herbal, raosted malts, caramel, raisins and a bit of milk chocolate. Bitter taste,full bodied, with a weird aftertaste, in between soap and alcohol. Lateron I taste less soap, but more cola like. Strange brew, didnt expect this from this beer. Maybe try another bottle later.

bottle.  Pours very deep brown with some reddish tones, and small off white head.  Aroma of molasses, caramel, definitely some spices.  Full bodied, thick, slightly syrupy body, but really quite smooth and creamy, abv hidden.  This, like the easter, is a big, sweet malt bomb of a belgian strong, and personally I find it delicious although others may find it cloying.  Tones of butterscotch toffee, caramel, and molasses lead to an almost minty spiciness, with some nutmeg and almost egg nog like flavors on the finish.

Pours Pours dark brown with red highlights and a small off white head.  Aroma of spice, wood, and caramel; kinda tough to pinpoint.  Flavors of cinnamon, licorice, caramel, brown sugar, maple, and black tea.  Finishes with more cinnamon spice, toast, wood and maple.  Medium to full bodied, neither all that creamy or slick, high carbonation and not much alcohol presence.  Good beer, but tends to come as too medicinal some of the time.

750ml brown bottle, corked. Best before 03/08/09, I think this bottle was intended to be consumed at Xmas 08? Poured a dark amber/brown colour, fairly clear with a few suspended yeast particles. Beige head faded fast leaving only a thin ring around the sides of the glass. Powerful nose, lots of toffee, brown sugar, alcohol and a hint of vanilla. Flavour has a hint of dark fruit, toffeeish malt, brown sugar and chocolate. Cherry and chocolate in the finish. Low, but noticeable dash of bitterness. Some alcoholic warmth and dryness with an almost woody feel on the tounge. Full bodied, nice fine beaded carbonation, all around nice mouthfeel. This has aged well.

Dark amber with a lasting beige head. Aroma is sweet, dried fruit, heavy malty, yeasty and spicy. Flavor is rather sweet. The finish is a bit dry and holds a warming alcohol. Full bodied. An excellent and very complex christmas beer. This is one of the few beers I have every christmas. It just wouldnt feel like christmas without it. 161209

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2011 Special brew every year for christmas.
Silver medal on the WBA 2002
Full of licorice, vanilla, cough drop, and alcohol.
Deep brown in color with a nice tan head that settles to a thin layer.  Brown sugar aroma with bannana and spice hints.  Moderately roasty and sweet.  A nice christmas beer.
Deep amber-red colour, slow dissolving light-beige head. Nose of light banana but lots of anise (!). Round body with warm alcohol and lots of sweetness, but I miss balance.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2012 Bottle. 25.4 oz. Pours a deep mahogany, bloody plum red-amber with a massive, meringue, creamy beige head. The nose begins with a rush of raisins, soft, buttery dough, and sweet yeast, following through on soft, warm sugar cookies, plums, dark cherries, figs, slight oak, molasses, toffee, Belgian candied sugars and finishes with subtle notes of nutmeg, cinnamon, and banana bread. The body is as huge, warm, round, and jolly as Ol Saint Nicholas himself. Heavy, warm, comforting, and as smooth and clean as the freshest winter snow. One of the best belgians ever

nice dark, redish beer with a beautiful creamy head... aroma has fruit, hops, some malts, caramel, nice but lacks intensity.... flavour is sweet, a bit of bitterness, hints of bread, caramel, hops... finish is long and bittersweet... very full beer, warming, thick, vast taste nice fine carbonization... very good one this is
Nok et deilig juleøl med tydelig belgisk preg av gjær.  Henger passe lenge i munnen, søtlig uten å være kvalmende.

State Line Liquors tasting.  Pours a deep amber with a white head that slowly disapates.  Aroma is big with malt, red apples, raisins, grapes, pineapples and stewed with spices.  Flavor is caramel, anise, toffee and peaches with a long chewy body. The finish grows drier as spices take over finishing with the growing heat of ginger combined with alcohol.
Bottle. Big anise aroma and light sweetness. Deep cola-brown with no head. Flavor is also very anise-heavy but balanced by dry fruit notes, figs and dates.

Bottled 75cl. Ordered from www.bierzwerg.de. It pours a beautiful brown beer with a ruby shine. Impressive, inviting aroma which is reminiscent of raisin, luscious malt, plum, faint coconut and port. Lovely yeasty accents. Creamy palate. Full bodied. Slightly sour. Warming on the swallow. Pretty lacework. The finish is remarkably nice, offering nutty minty notes making you eager to take another sip. Another great beer from this brewery.
Incredible.  Spicy belgian strong ale.  Sticky sweet with high carbonation.
30th December 2007  Dark brown beer. Moderate carbonation. Sweet caramel and a trace of wheat beer like bibblegum. Lingering saccharin malty dry finish. Smooth.

Today my bier sommelier delivery arrived. Helaas one bottle broken (http://m.flickr.com/#/photos/fortheloveofbeer but 5 still in tact. This is a great winter beer, thanks Ben.

Dark brown ruby colour, with a white head that dissappears quite quickly. A strong sweet caramel alcoholic aroma, with a slightly bitter, medium sweet taste. A slight lingering bitter sweet taste.
33 cl bottle Ruby brown with a minimal off-white head. Tastes treacly with a pronounced aniseed note. Really unusual and packs a punch.

Dark amber / light brown with a light brown head - good malty aroma - taste is of malts some lingering hop bitterness , some spiceiness from the yeast , and some nice alcohol heat - lingering spicy and alcoholic finish - very good and tasty

33 cL bottle from Beers of Europe, poured into a Gouden Carolus glass.  10.5% but beautifully disguised by the flavours.  Its incredibly smooth for its strength.  Theres a hint of caramel and its mildly syrupy.  Lovely.

Washington Commons, Brooklyn tap ($8): Pours brown with beige head. Aroma of anise seed, fruits, Belgian yeast, and a few other things. The taste is really strong anise seed, licorice type stuff, probably a little bit too much for me. However, there were also very pleasant notes of other spices, some mild Belgian hops, and a bit of that Belgian sweetness you always get in beers like this. A good complex beer, but not really entirely my thing.
Great beer. Definitely reminiscent of raisins and figs, but also carries heavy molasses and port wine flavors. Thick body, heavy alcohol leads to a slow, savory experience.
bottle, thanks to americanbrew,  reddish brown with creamy foam, herbal spiced aroma, flavor is malty candied sugar, herbal juniper, fruitcake

Served on tap at Brick Store Pub in Decatur.  Pours a dark brown-red with a murky profile.  Head dissipates quickly, but leaves a massive amount of lacing.  Aroma is really dominated by licorice and anise (I mean it) and spice.  Taste of licorice, banana, slight alcohol, with a slightly yeasty aftertaste.  Overall, a very sweet beer.  Nice mouthfeel, a bit chewy.  In sum, a very fine Christmastime Belgian, especially for the licorice lovers out there.  Gets a very strong recommendation.

29.03.2007. 0,33l Bottle. Brown colour. Malty aroma and a lot of alcohol. Very strong and tasteful. Sweet. (Vinner av World Beer Cup 2004 i klassen "Dark strong ale". Mye smak med sterk alkoholfremtoning, søtlig)

75 cl bottle. Body is dark brown with a thick beige creamy head. The aroma has roasted, toasted malts, pepper and alcohol in it. The taste is a litlle bit sweet with a hint of pepper, vanilla and licorice. Great with chocolate dessert.
bottle.  Pours black with a tan head.  Nose is of bubblegum.  Taste is of spice and bubblegum.  Sweet.  Mouthfeel is medium-thin and loads of carbonation.

On tap at Daily Pint. Dark brown body beneath a solid one-finger head with wonderful lace. Dark malts dominate the aroma with rich dark fruit, port, and alcohol also prominent. Black pepper, vanilla, and earthiness also present. Flavors match, with strong dark fruit sweetness, molasses and port leading the way. Plenty of warming alcohol just this side of too much. Medium body, minimal carbonation, and a lingering sweetness.

Aroma is funny on this one. Reminds me alot of some danish candy called "flagermuse" (bats). Really has that candy aroma. (sweetness combined with anis). Taste is sweet with caramel malts, dark dried fruits, vinous hints and ending off with some hops and sourness.

A great Christmas beer courtesy of Pat, split with Pat, Andrew and Ryan. Pours a murky brownish mahogany body with nice lacing. Aroma is full and rich with great notes of dark fruits - plum, raisins, figs, and slight prunes. Mouthfeel is a mixture of a strong Belgian ale and a dark, fruity brown ale. Notes of dark fruit take over with a very slight alcohol presence in the finish. This brew would be an excellent candidate for cellaring.

Bouteille de 750ml avec bouchon de liège. Cette bière est brune et elle a une belle mousse brune aussi. Le nez de cette superbe bière est un nez qui ressemble à celui de labsinthe, il est composé danis, de réglisse, de fenouil. Les notes dalcool sont impossibles à détecter. On perçoit aussi une touche de rhum et de fruits confits de noël. Ce nez est très agréable et aromatique. La bouche est ronde, soyeuse, elle est très longue. Cette bière goûte les fruits confits avec des épices. Elle est très réconfortante. Jamais bière de cette teneur en alcool descend aussi bien et avec une telle facilité. Une parfaite bière dhiver. 9/10
On tap at Quotations in Media - 12 beers of Christmas event.  Dark chestnut color.  Lots of dark fruits - fig, raisins, and also heavy notes of licorice in this beer.
Almost weizen bocky, sugar plums and dates.  Liquid fruit cake.... One of the beat holiday ales.

On the 12th day of Christmas....I drank a 2008 bottle.  Pours brown with a tan head, quick dissipation.  Aroma is dark fruits, caramel, roastyness, spices and some belgian yeast.  Taste is sweet with a somewhat acidic finish.  Very smooth.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2011 pours a dark walnut brown wih a tan head.Every sip taste a little more a little malty caramael and a good alcohol taste this beer is excelentreally a great christmas beer and u would neevr know the abv is over 10%

(Bouteille partagée avec Nicolas de Myre, cousin éloigné du Père Noël.  Nasdrovia!)  Le liquide a une robe brune.  La lumière du jour fait apparaître au contour du verre des reflets rouges.  La mousse se dépose pour quelques minutes et se transforme en un mince anneau.  Une dentelle est observable.  Au nez, les arômes maltés sont somptueux avec des parfums forts de réglisse et danis.  Des épices mélangées sont perceptibles et marquées notamment par la présence du girofle.  Lalcool reste bien dissimulé, de même que les houblons qui sont pratiquement introuvables. Des fruits foncés sévaporent et trouvent dans mes narines un refuge réconfortant.  Le goût est tout aussi complexe et encore touché par des saveurs maltées fruitées et caramélisées qui rappellent un petit gâteau aux fruits confits imbibé de rhum bien chaud.  Les épices chatouillent les papilles tandis que la réglisse est savoureuse comme un bonbon qui fond sur la langue.  Encore une fois, lalcool est introuvable, camouflé et pratiquement dangereux (10,5%!!!).   En bouche, le liquide a une structure étoffée, je dirais même corpulente, avec une effervescence parfaite et une texture qui est douce et crémeuse.  La finale est tout aussi agréable et longue de fruits bien mûrs, liquoreux et justement épicés.

I poured a big bottle that was a little on the cold side into a chalice for the pleasure of smelling the different layers as it warmed to temperature. The aromas didnt disappoint, as an initial blast of Belgian yeast and brown bread gave way to warming alcohol notes that evoked tawny port. The flavors also opened as this warmed, from raisin and date to figs tinged with honey. A fine and complex beer. My only complaint, minor though it may be, comes from the appearance. This poured a lovely russet brown, but raised only a minimal head that quickly dissipated to a persistent ring and a bit of lacing. I enjoy seeing a frothy head on a Belgian ale, but I suspect that the combination of a high abv and the 2010 vintage saw to it that explosive refermentation had not done its work. In terms of nose and taste, though, this is just what you would want for an evening in the study after the wife and kid have gone to bed. That may make me a cliche, but it also makes me very happy.
750 bottle. Dark brown and hazy. Sugary, malty nose. Taste is candy sugar, malts with the alcohol well hidden. very smooth and creamy. Good winter beer,
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: 2009 bottle thanks to americanbrew.  poured ruby with a cream head.  nose is licorice, spices, and yeast.  easy on the palate, flavor is heavy on the licorice, yeast, light spices in the finish.

Bottle courtesy americanbrew. 2009 Batch. Clear golden brown color with a bit of bubbly head. Spicy aroma. A bit of tart fruit with some candy cane notes and sweet flavors. Flavors are sweet malt with a spicy grain.

Bottle: Pours a deep black walnut  with a nice tan head.  One whiff of this beer and I just knew this was the brew for me.  I was pulled in by the delicious aroma of sweet malts and fig with just an undercurrent of alcohol.  My first sip?  Angels are singing "Merry Christmas!" There is a medium sweet quality to a complex host of flavors.  There is a little fig, there is a little sweet cherry, there is a little vanilla...  Each sip reveals a new flavor and before I know it the bottle is gone!  This has a medium body slightly creamy mouth feel with a smooth warming alcohol finish that is pleasing rather than overpowering.  My God is this a great beer!  Right in my wheel house.  It went down so easy I hardly notice the 10% ABV - which means its probably a good thing I only had the 1 330ml bottle!  This is as close to perfect as Ive ever rated a beer.  Im going to buy out the store tomorrow!
dark copper beautiful color with substantial head, malt and spice in perfect harmony, very high carbonation kicks the experience up, very very good!

Pours a deep brown with ruby red highlights and a white head into the glass.  Aroma has a lot of black licorice/anise notes with some sugary malt as well.  Flavor is similar.  A nice mix of sweet malt with the sweetness of black licorice with a bitter snap to balance.  Some dark fruits like plum and raison round out the flavor profile of this beer.  Really nice body.

2009 bottle opened at home and poured in a Gouden Carolous cup. Pour a nice dark brown with tan head. Immediately the complex aroma hits you with malty and caramel fragrance, then came the licorice and a spicy background and some rhubarb. 
Sweetness and Bitterness are well balanced.
Its full slightly sticky body and soft carbonation make this brew a wonderful pairing for "Cassoeula" a typical Milans winter old and poor recipe made by stewed pork parts (rind,rib,ear,snout,foot,lil sausages) and  savoy cabbage. 

Aging is strongly recommended. After 1 year the body and smoothness that didnt met my expectations last year (that doesnt mean I didnt enjoyed this beer ;) ) are now very satisfactory
33 cl bottle, The Dram Shop, Sheffield, UK. Deep copper colour, almost ruby-brown. Black liquorice and clove aroma, intense but balanced bitter-sweet flavour. A nice finish, thick and prune-ey.
The appearance of this beer is the equivalent of that feeling you get when you see comfort food. The alcohol is noticeable in the aroma and taste, but both are still pleasant. This is a great beer.

(Bottle) Another generous selection from the Keg_Juggler.  I found the flavor to be overwhelmed in alcohol and most of the attributes could not be enjoyed.  The palate was rather thin as well. Based on the rank, I was disappointed.  If this reflects "the days of yore" the folks must have walked around in a stupor.  At least they were happy.

Golden Carolus
Noel
Pours dark brown with a hazy complexion, medium to fat tan head and good retention. Aroma is fucking awesome. Divine dark fruits, booze, chocolate, caramel and an earthy spiciness. Flavor is smooth as ice with buttery chocolate, Belgian yeast and spices. Boozy red wine like finish. Awesome! I really want more.

The beer pours a dark brown color with a large tan head. The first aroma is nothing but licorice, which is not a smell I really enjoy. As the beer airs out a bit, I get some prunes, cherries and Belgian yeast notes.

The flavor is also very heavy on the licorice. I also get a little roasted malt, caramel malt, cherries, prunes, yeast, brown sugar and some alcohol. Overall, the licorice is dominant.

Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

12 oz. bottle shared by STLWill at the Royales Tuesday night beer showcase- thanks, Will!  2007 vintage.  Pours a cloudy amber color with a small beige head.  Aroma of caramel, cherries, raisins, candi sugar, Belgian yeast, and spices.  The flavor follows closely along those lines.  Medium-bodied, with low carbonation and a malty mouthfeel.  Not bad.

12oz bottle picked up at SL... Smells great... brown sugar, spices, cinnamon, nutty... Looks great as well. Large cream colored head,  dark brown in color. Taste is light caramel, light roastiness, bready, spices, dark fruits... Creamy smooth texture, I would of never guessed this beer to be over 10 percent.... Great winter brew. The belgians do christmas beers the right way.... December 7th 1941, one for the troops...

Pours brown with red notes and a small head. Aroma is caramel, raisins, sticky fruit and slightly roasted. Medium mouthfeel with some alcohol. Aftertaste is slightly bitter and balances the sweetness a bit. Good christmas beer!
Sweet caramel and chocolate aroma with dark cloved honey, apple. Appearance is cola brown with tan head. Flavor matches the nose, light bodied and quaffable with a touch of scotch. Palate is bubbly.
Dark amber of color with a beige head. An arome with sweets, spice, dark fruits, bubblegum, prunes and weak port. A flavor with sweets, spice, liqurice, dark fruits and weak bitterness.

750 ml bottle of 2009(?) vintage purchased a year ago at Holiday Wine Cellar ($9.59).  Pours a deep garnet hue with a big three fingers of fizzy beige foam.  Aroma of dried and candied dark fruit (raisins, cherries, other), rich dark caramel, spice (anise really stands out), and a hint of booze.  Flavor is more of the same: rich smooth caramel, lots of sticky dark fruit, tangy spice including anise / black licorice.  Fortunately, this is not anywhere near cloying.  More tangy spice in the finish and the high alcohol is quite well hidden.  The fruit and spice blend really well...one of my very favorite holiday ales to date.  (781, 432)

head: creamy,thick,beige
colour: dark brown/amber 
smell: liquorice ,anis,herbs/spices,candy,malts,dutch drops,bit alcohol,sweet/bitter
taste: salty dutch drops, anis, sweet, coffee? ,malts, notes of alcohol, oily texture, semi-dry end
Big and bold notes of black licorice come wafting out of this beer.  pours a hazy brown.  finishes with a bit of medicinal qualities. sampled at a Winter Warmer tasting.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2012 33 cl bottle, pours dark with a huge creamy head and lots of lacings, very solid head retention, aroma of licorice, yeast and malt, taste is similar to the aroma, bit sticky mouthfeel, ok finish, good but not great.

11/26/10.  11.2oz bottle.  Creamy brown pour with a fluffy brown head that fades to a ring but lasts and laces a tiny bit.  Fruity dried fig aroma with hints of caramel and licorice.  Huge sweet flavor that tastes of caramel, molasses, dark fruits, a hint of dry bitter malts, and a touch of alcohol.

Nose: Sweet spices. Like Traquair Jacobite Ale.
Mouthfeel: Thick, quite hard but round, medium carbonation.
Flavor: Sweet, but no overly.Licorice. Taste would benefit from a little more hop bitterness.
Very easy to drink, compared to the ABV. An excellent and enjoyable brew.

Bottle. Pours brownish orange with beige head. Aroma of strong licorice, chocolate, dark fruit, yeast, horse blanket and toast. Flavor is very much the same. Mouth feel is medium-heavy body with fizzy carbonation. Overall, not bad!

Bottle (tasted at a blind tasting). Pours with a hazed amber body and a lasting white head. Aroma is strongly perfumey with floral and fruit notes, and gardenia flowers. Flavors of vanilla, raisins, toast, carnations and the same floral/perfumey notes that were in the aroma. Medium carbonation and not as hot as I was expecting.

Bottle @ Home. Pours dark maghony with a small cream coloued head. Nose is dried fruit, vanila, cinnomon, pepper, caramel and raisins. Taste is sweet malts, dark dried fruit, raisin, plums, pepper, other spices, caramel. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily mouthfeel and long warming alchohol. Very good xmas beer. 101120

Amazing! Poured from a 750 ml bottle a rich dark mahogany color with a slight whilte head that leaves a small amount of lacing around the glass. Aroma is very abundant consisiting of dark fruits (raspberries, black currant and cherries), also malt, vanilla, and raisin. Taste is also extremely robust consisiting of a sweet/sour taste of raisin, malt, vanilla and cherries.  Palate is left with a full bodied taste that is perfectly carbonated.Keeps me longing for more. This beer is truely an amazing brew and it is so incredible that I feel too much of an amature to even be able to rate it correctly.

KC 12oz bottle. Nice dark brown pour with a little tan head that quickly settles into a ring. No real lacing. Dark fruit and caramel sweetness in the aroma with maybe a little vanilla. Pretty bold flavor with a fair share of sugar to it. Warming alcohol in the finish. Good but fairly simple overall.
Nose of cough syrup and weak malts; feel and carb are medium, taste follows Nose with early cake, middle butter and late sweet licorice
Dark brown with medium tan head. Flavour is malt, dark fruit, sweet, roasted malts and spices.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2010 Dark brown with an light brown head.
Aroma; Lots of malt (caramel), some chocolate, sweet fruitynes.
Flavours; A bit shy, getting som spice and a big load of malt. But you can sence the greatness!
Summary; One day, people will treat beer and wine equaly. That day you can open this bottle that you have stored for 4 years, and say "Told you so!"

On tap at the kulminator antwerp.
2009 version. Aroma is figs. Taste is licorice. A great beer

Bottled 0,33L. Elegant and fraught dark color with a long a nut colored head. Good resistence. Much complex aroma with decided notes of caramel, roast malt, cellar, red grape stum. Very warmy taste. Overbearing fruity content with pleasant notes of rum and clear mildew.
Draft at the Brugge beer festival. Dark brown colour . Nice brown head. Aroma is a strong fennel / liquorish. Taste is again strong liquorish with a lot of risidual unfermented sugar.

Pours a rich dark brown with a lot of sediment floating around.  The head is a light brown and is relatively small, but it sticks to the top of the beer and doesnt go away.  The beer smells of carmel, malt, chocolate and spices.  This beer is sweet.  Carmel, chocolate, prunes and spices.  I have to admit that I am drinking this in the summer, so it is a bit much, but on a cold winter night this would definitely hit the spot.  There is also just a hint of alcohol, but you dont notice it after the first sit or two.  The beer is creamy and smooth in the mouth and is fairly easy to drink despite being over 10% ABV.  Im going to have to try this again this winter in front of the fire and see how it suits me then.
Bottle. Pours hazy brow colour with a nice off-white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, malt, dried dark fruit, spice, caramel and alcohol.

A: snifter. dark, opaque mahogany color. light brown head. outstanding retention and nice velvety lacing.

S: aromas of apples, figs, plums, clove, some nutmeg. hints of anise. black currants. huge malt aroma. some honey.

T: very malty. dark honey flavors. black currant, huge spice notes, clove, cinnamon, nutmeg, some light coriander. some alcohol esters. a little too fresh/hot.

M: full-bodied. bigger carbonation level than expected. big bite. a little chewy.

D: wonderful beer. needs a little time to mellow out IMO. very nice flavors and a great seasonal belgian strong.

Bottle. 25.4 oz. Courtesy of and split with my good pal Vin. Pours a deep mahogany, bloody plum red-amber with a massive, meringue, creamy beige head. The nose begins with a rush of raisins, soft, buttery dough, and sweet yeast, following through on soft, warm sugar cookies, plums, dark cherries, figs, slight oak, molasses, toffe, Belgian candied sugars and finishes with subtle notes of nutmeg, cinnamon, and banana bread. The body is as huge, warm, round, and jolly as Ol Saint Nicholas himself. Heavy. warm, comforting, and as smooth and clean as the freshest winter snow. This is, perhaps, the best Christmas ale I have ever had the privilege and pleasure to sip and snjoy. Merry Christmas to all, and to all a good night. Cheers.

Draft.  Pours a dark brownish amber color with a tan head.  Nice aroma of spices, malt, and sugar.  The flavor has notes of dried fruit, candied sugar, molasses, and spices with a touch of hops.  Nice.

2008 Bottle shared with Priest...  Strong potent candied banana aroma.  Dark brown amber body with thin head, nice lacing... Strong potent flavor of candied, spiced fruits, molasses... reminds me of jager... nice warming finish
Bottle. Pours a hazy brownish amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty dark fruit aroma. Fruity malty spicy dark fruit flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy dark fruit finish.

Rating #366, bottle from Lagersalget @ Grønjordskollegiet  

Hazy greyish yellow-brown appearance with a medium beige head. 
Aroma is strawberries, raspberries, dust and caramel. Fantastic taste! It starts out with an earthy / leavy / basement-like yeast profile, which is succeded by berries and peaches. Then comes the alcohol with a bit of bitterness, that stretches out through the finish. Aftertaste is basement, alcohol and a low bitterhops profile. Thick and creamy beer, low carbonation. Masterpiece.

In bottle, thanks Dave! Nose is hoppy and like peaches. Tingly on tongue, fruity hop flavor. I think Id like this even better if it aged a year. Good malt support of the flavor, perhaps caramel malt. A very tasty beer, spices are just right, not out of control.

Sampled on-tap at the Kulminator in Antwerp, Belgium...

Pours a murky dark brown with tinges of mahogany topped by a frothy tan head. Smells quite yeasty and spicy, breadiness, cinnamon, clove and some strident aniselicorice aromas.

Taste evokes the holidays! Cinnamons, ginger, cloves and nutmeg are evident. Dark fruit and breadiness with a fair amount of anise. Very full bodied with a sweet finish and sweet spice and licorice in the finish. Nice warming from the ample alcohol as well.

Lovely x-mas beer!
Nice dark pour in glass. Bottle was a little funky. Lots of sediment. Something wasnt right here. Nose and taste of acidic amounts of alcohol, breads and sweet caramel. Rated 2/19/03

old note. on tap at Tylers Apex. Good aroma, sweet, caramel, brown sugar, Orangy brown color, minor lace. Bitter sweet flavor. Medium body, creamy oily mouthfeel, bitter sweet finish. Nice brew Didnt excite me as much as some at the bar, but good holiday beer. Aroma was very sweet. flavor took on a harsher malty bite.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Pours a dark rubybrown beer with fine adhesive beige head. In the nose cherries and spices, caramel. Very nice spicy sweetness, hints of chocolate. Sweet-dry aftertaste. Enough carbon to keep it lively and interesting. One of the better Christmas beers I had in 2009-2010.

Dark mahogany color.  medium carbonation.  prunes, dark sugar, molasses. A touch musty.  Almost completely devoid of a bitter component.  Liquid candy.  The alcohol is quite noticeable.  Clean finish. complex and nevertheless very drinkable.

33cl bottle. Pours a brown body with a lots of suspended particles and a  fluffy head. Malty aroma of molasses. Sweet flavor of dark candy sugar, molasses, brown sugar and some moderate spicy hops. Nice hop bitterness.
